review: It's not really that it's bad, just that its unfinished. And abandoned. Very buggy, even in 2024, and it's core game play really isn't all too much to write home about. It's not complex in the slightest, and there really isn't even a point to going violent since you can always win much easier by being peaceful 100 percent of the time. Rioters are generally easier to play than police, but smoke bomb spam allows you to win most maps as the police with ease. There isn't much "strategy" an the game is very overpriced. It's enjoyable enough though, if you can get it on sale.

review:
nonostante un interfaccia non chiarissima (specialmente durante la scelta del equip di polizia/manifestanti) il gioco è una simulazione PERFETTA della gestione delle folle.

Un titolo sempreverde che aiuta a capire criticità ed errori commessi (ambo i lati) durante decenni di scontri in piazza, si parli di Pisa nel 2024, del G8 di Genova nel 2001 o negli scontri del '68. 

RIOT nelle sue dinamiche resta un gioco ampiamente sottovalutato, che si meriterebbe molto di più, se non come intrattenimento almeno come mezzo didattico per formare le forze del ordine!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 491, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1704056212}
review:
+Es un simulador de protestas. Pero enfocado puro en lo RTS.
 Consiste, en que, los protestantes pueden cumplir sus objetivos mediante lo pacifico , o lo violento. 
 Los ¨Objetivos¨ son sencillos: Permanecer en un area, o entrar en ella. No permitir el avance, o destruir tal estructura.
 Lo mismo para los policias.
 -Mas bien, estos son los que, en parte. Precisan ser lo mas pacificos posibles. Tambien, que la mayoria de sus objetivos, es permanecer por x tiempo.
 +Me encanta el estilo Pixel art. Bien cuidado, detallado e INCLUSIVE, HAY ANIMACIONES INTRODUCTORIAS PARA CADA MISION. 
 - La banda sonora consite en un estilo serio y epico. Pero solo para el menu, o introduccion de algunos niveles. El resto, es Nulo.
 -Se torna monotono facilmente. 
Inclusive, a muchos les va a resultar muy burdo, o aburrido, y lo entiendo.
  Su estilo de estrategia, de controlar un grupo limitado, usar habilidades activas y pasivas. ETC.

8/10 Los RTS regresan.

Graphics are awesome, explosions, also sounds everything in terms of visual or sound it's pretty good.


Now, the most important part is gameplay.
I mean, i'm lost to be honest. I had no clue what i'm doing, i'm spamming skills and hope something will work. Looks promising to be honest, but the game is too old and i guess it will not change. 

To be more precise with gameplay, seems that what ever i do, kinda nothing changes, if i'm agressive, i spam granades and shots or just stay there, nothing happens.

review: Not worth playing. Though a great concept, the game barely functions properly. Certain missions are borderline impossible because more than half the time the guys you control decide to leave or freeze in place forcing a restart of the mission. There are many little things that just make the game frustrating (why do I have to hold a button to change from defensive to aggressive? why can't I skip some things but can skip others? why does the audio overlap? etc.) Frankly this game is just unfinished and while there are some bits of fun to be had, this game is really in a genre of its own right now, it is overshadowed by the flaws and poor game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003208726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1710584496}
review:
This game is an absolute embarrassment. This was an amazing concept, and I was very excited with the idea of it. I waited many years for it to drop and now I've finally managed to get round to playing it, I'm frankly disgusted at the lack of ethics and integrity the developer has.

They've failed to address any of the bugs or issues around gameplay, they've failed to make some basic mechanics function as they should, and half the time the game offers absolutely no challenge whatsoever. I've completed five missions now, first try each time, by doing nothing more than moving my officers forward to the protestors.

This game is a travesty and has been completely abandoned by the dev. Just do not spend your money on it. DO NOT.

review:
A daring take on a controversial subject. However I very much enjoyed the game as it is. As someone who has lived through social turmoil (Hong Kong) I've seen countless confrontations between police and protesters and it is somewhat interesting to play as both sides in a video game. Of course real life is much more complicated but still.

Controls are simple and easy to get a hold of, but I would prefer a tutorial rather than just a 'wiki' to refer to. Workshop adds much needed content to the game (The 4 campaigns of base game gets repetitive quick.) and opens an opportunity for players to learn more about historical events that happened on our planet.

For those who wish to play the game, I urge you to do so with an open mind. Between violence and pacifism, right or wrong is not something of this game's focus, rather this game is just for you to have a taste of riot control/riot organizing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097339414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1677254403}
review:
In [i]Riot: Civil Unrest[/i] werden Unruhen und Aufstände aus der jüngsten Vergangenheit repliziert. Dass ein solches Spielprinzip außergewöhnlich, gar einzigartig ist, kann zunächst unwidersprochen konstatiert werden; nur das zwanzig Jahre alte [i]Hooligans: Storm Over Europe[/i] kommt mit seinem ähnlichen Konzept in Betracht. Die internen Szenarien umfassen den Arabischen Frühling, die italienischen No-TAV-Märsche, die Indignados-Proteste gegen die spanische Sparpolitik und den Widerstand gegen die geplante Mülldeponie in Kerateas, Griechenland. Nachspielen können wir die Konfrontationen entweder auf Seiten der bewaffneten Polizei oder der protestierenden Massen. Die wuselige Pixelpräsentation ist etwas unübersichtlich, was jedoch als realitätsnaher Faktor einer Protestsimulation anzusehen ist.

Auf Seiten der Polizei stehen uns Beamte mit Schutzschilden, mit Schlagstöcken und mit spezieller Ausrüstung wie Tränengas oder Pfefferspray zur Verfügung, zuweilen auch ein gepanzerter Wasserwerfer. Ob gewalttätige Mittel eingesetzt werden, um die jeweiligen Ziele zu erreichen, muss gut überlegt sein, da eine aggressiv agierende Polizei die aufrührerische Menge zur Gegengewalt provoziert. Von großer Wichtigkeit ist hierbei das spielinterne System der öffentlichen Meinung, die sich gegen uns richtet, wenn wir auf Regierungsseite zu locker mit dem Polizeiknüppel zucken. So erringen die Cops manchmal den militärischen, aufgrund in Kauf genommener ziviler Opfer jedoch nicht den politischen Sieg, und sind in der nächsten Mission im Nachteil.

Steuern wir hingegen die Demonstranten, verfügen wir nicht über das technische Arsenal der Staatsgewalt, jedoch befinden wir uns stets in der Überzahl, oft in etwa zehnfacher Menge. Mit dieser können wir Personenketten bilden und als menschliche Mauer gegen die Cops vorrücken, um sie zum Rückzug zu zwingen, zum Hochhalten der eigenen Moral Parolen skandieren oder in den offensiven Modus wechseln. Je nach Szenario stehen auch Steine oder Molotov-Cocktails zur Verfügung, mit denen wir uns der anrückenden Exekutive erwehren. Ich hatte den Eindruck, dass sich die Fraktion der Protestierenden einfacher spielt und weitaus weniger Arbeit erfordert.

Trotz des hochinteressanten Konzepts ist [i]Riot: Civil Unrest[/i] ein recht ungeschliffener Rohdiamant. Das Game birgt einige technische Fehler und spielerische Ärgernisse, obwohl der Entwickler es nach vier Jahren Entwicklungszeit als fertiges Produkt deklariert. So werden von uns ausgewählte Aktionen oft überhaupt nicht oder erst auf erneute Anordnung durchgeführt. Ob es sich hierbei um einen Bug handelt oder dem Umstand geschuldet ist, dass die uns untergebene KI auch einen "eigenen Willen" hat, der aussichtslose oder zu gefährliche Befehle ignoriert, ließ sich bislang nicht erschließen. Hinzu kommt das häufige Steckenbleiben von Einheiten in Objekten oder gar ihr Verschwinden in der Map. 

Generell erweist sich die Bedienung als überarbeitungswürdig, da sich nicht nur das mit der Maus angesteuerte Spielinterface, sondern auch die zusätzliche Tastaturbelegung als wenig intuitiv erweist. Würde [i]Riot: Civil Unrest[/i] eine Kaffeefahrt simulieren, wäre dies freilich keine Zumutung, doch in aufgeladenen Massenkonfrontationen herrscht naturgemäß die Hektik des Moments. Da dem Spiel zudem ein ausführliches Tutorial fehlt, erklären sich viele Prinzipien nur im Trial-and-Error-Verfahren. Wenigstens reagieren die eigenen Leute auch ohne konkreten Befehl auf sich entwickelnde Gefahrensituationen. 

Insgesamt ist das Spielkonzept sowie die gestalterische Umsetzung ausgezeichnet, nur das Gameplay erweist sich als mittelmäßig. Wer zeitgenössische Aufstände mitentscheiden möchte, ob für das Volk oder die Regierung, sollte sich in [i]Riot: Civil Unrest[/i] gerne in die Straßenschlacht wagen. Neben dem Global- und dem Story-Modus, welche dieselben Maps enthalten, gibt es auch eine 1-vs-1-Variante für zwei menschliche Kontrahenten sowie einen Spectator-Mode, der sich hervorragend als Bildschirmschoner eignen würde. Mit dem integrierten Missionseditor habe ich bislang nur experimentiert, doch verlocken die Möglichkeiten zur Nachbildung jüngster Massenproteste und Revolten im deutschen Raum.

review:
Alright lets get to the point, this game is never going to receive an update, this game's community is essentially dead, only ever buy this game when it's on sale, and as to why I have so many hours is because I attempted at making a map by myself but the game's editor is just a pain to deal with so I never finished it. 

Now alright conceptually it could've been good but once the game was "finished," they've never touched on it ever since. The game it self, it's so painstakingly easy to win as protesters, meanwhile police have an extreme struggle after "Indignados," with "Arab Spring," being the absolute worst for police. Now I'm not saying this game is bad, I enjoyed it and the soundtrack is a bop, but after you do all the missions there's really nothing else to do besides the world missions but they're just utterly boring. There could've been so much potential had they just not stop working on it.

review:
I highly suggest trying this game, because it has an original concept, with so much time and research put into it.
Yeah, the game has some bugs here and there, but is not that bad, don't think of cyberpunk first release.
Is hard for me to compare this game with others, because right now there is non other game with this concept.

The riots/protests are very small to medium size, compare to reality and the art style of this game helps. The rioters are sometime uncontrollable just like in real life, the police units have there limits and can became hard to use, just like in real life, I think you catch what I am trying to tell you, there is so much research put into it, don't judge this game by the looks of it, you can have fun trying to stop the riots, or making the police run home.

Yeah, the gameplay is short, if you have some logic you can beat the game on medium difficulty in 7 hours, if you don't it might take you 10-15 hours, but if you really like the concept of controlling rioters/anti-rioters trying to beat the opposite faction with peaceful to brutal tactics by all meaning try this game, it might fill the need of this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072083420', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1674755295}
review: A great concept. However, the game itself is a hot, buggy mess. The mechanics are rough at the best of times, the game glitches to the point of breaking at least once per level, and the game takes very, very little care with the subject matter. It conflates protesters, rioters, and rebels together, tarring them all with the same brush with no self awareness. The levels, while inspired by actual public political actions, are all themselves uninspired with goals that don't work and units that make no sense half the time. The crowd and unit mechanics are the defining feature of the game, but they're buggy and hardly ever work as intended, so it's a complete moot point. What they wanted to do is cool, what they did is terrible.

review:
It's a fun concept game where you play a peaceful (or not if you decide that way) game of tug of war either as rioters or the police

Form defensive wall line formations as you encircle the other side and either arrest or beat the pasta out of them with your assault units while getting cover fire from your ranged officers as the police

Or do whatever it is rioters do because you're mostly just an unorganized mob (I don't like them since they fly ancom flags, communists eww)

The game mostly centers around scenarios with each one providing 4 missions where each side either has to destroy or protect something

Only gripes are: 
• No real tutorial, you have to activate your brain almonds to figure it out, similiar to american police training
• Individual members of a unit getting stuck on terrain like barriers or fences making them innefective at taking orders
• No quick unit selection, albeit the game is not that fast paced to need it but it's un-ergonomic
• Sometimes when you use an ability or action the game doesn't do it (like fire a grenade, attempt an arrest) but the cooldown initiates.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015004645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1671267495}
review:
Riot: Civil Unrest 
C’est clairement amusant, c’est possible que ce soit un bon jeu de stratégie avec des mécanismes bien constitués dans un contrôle d’unité plutôt anarchique.

Il reste pourtant confus et chaotique si le joueur n’est pas bon commandant d’opération.

En ce qui me concerne après une découverte de deux heures en incarnant les forces de l’ordre. 
Chacune des unités sur le terrain à son utilité particulière, chaque groupe ne fait pas la même chose, bien qu’il y ait une mission en commun. Il faut bien comprendre le mécanisme des forces de police pour rétablir l’ordre et ainsi avoir la victoire. Sur ce plan, il faut aimer la stratégie policière et être bien coordonnée et organisé, sans quoi c’est l’échec militaire assuré.

En faisant usage des nombreuses manœuvres policière envisageables, il y a celle de la force, mais là encore je dirais qu’il faut être modéré et précis dans sa manœuvre militaire sur chaque mission pour éviter de tomber en échec politique.
C’est marrant, mais je trouve qu’il manque d’une interface directive stratégique, optionnelle mais  complémentaire, à la Democracy (la simulation politique).

Du point de vue des graphismes c’est de la 2D rien d’extraordinaire, voilà un jeu très pixelisé, trop pixelisé peut-être. C’est là qu’il fait son effet, on pourrait même prétendre que le jeu possède une atmosphère suffisamment réaliste pour plaire à un public averti.

Sur la base de la progression dans la partie "Campagne", certaines missions policières sont historiques (le conflit Notre-Dame-des-Landes), particulièrement intéressant à découvrir mais trop peu mis en scène. Le déroulement de cette mission est bien trop courte et pas assez simuler pour ma part. En faite il est là le problème de RIOT: Civil Unrest, c’est un jeu de plateau tant il reste en surface avec un mécanisme de progression redondant. 

RIOT: Civil Unrest est un jeu d'action qui traite la gestion et/ou l'organisation des émeute ou désordre civil dans le monde. Son prix n'est pas excessif, (actuellement en promotion à -82% dans sa version Deluxe Edition. Un Wiki explicatif est disponible sur le menu (depuis mise à jour).

Il a le mérite d’avoir proprement été créé par un studio indépendant, cependant c'est un passe-temps qui se cache un peu trop dans la masse des jeux Steam. En ce qui me concerne, je l’ai trouvé tout à fait intéressant pour lui tirer mon chapeau dans un registre suffisamment inexploré jusqu'à présent.

Merci à Leonard Menchiari le studio de développement.

Bonne fin d’année à toutes et à tous.
Meilleurs vœux, et que la passion pour les jeux indépendants de ce genre reste intacte. 

Joyeux Noël Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561198139344280', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1669083690}
review:
[h2]Brisante Konflikte, [i]mutiges[/i] Spiel[/h2]
Riot - Civil Unrest wagt sich nicht nur an reale, politisch aufgeladene Szenarien, sondern bietet auch eine interessante Herangehensweise an das Genre der Echtzeit-Taktik.
In den Kampagnen stehen vier Konflikte der jüngeren Vergangenheit im Mittelpunkt. Es geht um den Bau einer Schnellzugstrecke in Italien, das Errichten einer umstrittenen Mülldeponie in Griechenland, Proteste gegen die Sparpolitik in Spanien - und als international bekanntestes Ereignis den Arabischen Frühling in Ägypten. Jede Kampagne besteht aus vier bis fünf kompakten Levels, die wir immer sowohl auf Seiten der Demonstranten als auch der Polizisten erleben können. In Sachen Hintergrundinformationen bleibt es bei einem knappen Einführungstext und kurzen Cutscenes, die ansprechend gestaltet sind aber eher wenig Informationsgehalt mitbringen.

Neben der Kampagne gibt es noch eine ganze Menge weitere Maps, die uns zum Beispiel nach Kiew oder Ostdeutschland bringen. Allerdings war für mich nur ein kleiner Teil spielbar, denn sie sind an ein Freischaltungssystem gekoppelt, das ich nicht wirklich durchschaut habe. Das war einer der immer wieder vorkommenden Aspekte, in denen sich Riot nicht so ganz poliert und durchdacht angefühlt hat.
Auf jeden Fall sollten diese Karten aber über den Global-Modus spielbar sein. Den hätte man wahrscheinlich auch mit der ähnlich aufgebauten Kampagnen-Struktur zusammenlegen können, denn hier spielen wir einfach der Reihe nach das gesamte Mapangebot durch. Vorspringen und damit die gezielte Auswahl eines bestimmten Szenarios scheint jedoch nicht möglich zu sein.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2881292724

[b]Das Gameplay[/b]
Doch kommen wir zum Eingemachten: In den Missionen gilt es immer, ein bestimmtes taktisches Ziel zu erfüllen - gegnerischen Kräfte müssen vertrieben, Objekte zerstört und Gebiete eingenommen oder gehalten werden. Polizisten und Demonstranten verfügen über sehr unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten und Taktiken, wodurch sich die beiden Parteien sehr verschieden anfühlen. Auf Seiten der Demonstranten sind wir oft schlechter geschützt und verfügen über rustikalere Druckmittel wie werfbare Steine, Molotovs oder Raketen, können aber auch durch friedliche Mittel wie eine Sitzblockade zum Erfolg kommen. Die Polizei ist in der Regel zahlenmäßig unterlegen aber mit Rauchgranatenwerfern, Schilden und Formationen stabiler und koordinierter unterwegs.

Apropos Koordination: Hier versucht Riot, den chaotischen Charakter der echten Auseinandersetzungen einzufangen, indem die Einheiten nicht eins zu eins auf unsere Befehle reagieren. DIe Masse ist zwar genretypisch in kleinere Gruppen eingeteilt, denen wir seperate Anweisungen bezüglich Position und Gadget-EInsatz geben können. Doch die Umsetzung steht auf einem anderen Blatt, da Chaosfaktor oder Einschüchterung massiven Einfluss nehmen können. 
Demonstranten etwa lassen sich im passiven Modus noch ganz gut im Zaum halten, aber wenn wir in den aggressiven Modus wechseln, gerät die Sache schnell aus dem Ruder. Und wenn wir unsere Polizisten zu großem Druck aussetzen, rennen sie uns in kritischen Situationen einfach davon. Das kann sich schon mal frustrierend anfühlen, doch insgesamt fand ich das System angesichts der Thematik schlüssig und es hat sich mitreißend angefühlt, die eigene Seite auf Kurs zu halten während meine APM-Statistik mit der Maus in die Höhe geschossen ist.

[b]Ein Sieg braucht mehrere Zutaten[/b]
Eine weitere Besonderheit: Ein militärischer Sieg bedeutet noch keinen Erfolg. Erreichen wir das taktische Ziel nur durch grobe Gewalt, müssen wir heftige Einbußen bei der ebenso wichtigen Medien-Wertung hinnehmen. Wenn die Straßen nach brutalem Vorgehen von Blut und Leichen bedeckt waren, hat sich das für mich trotz des Pixellooks eh teils ganz schön heftig angefühlt. Dazu wird es durch diese Mechanik vom Spiel also auch bestraft. Experimente sind natürlich trotzdem erlaubt, denn die Missionen gehen immer nur wenige Minuten. 
Die Balance war auf dem mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad ziemlich wild. Manche Missionen waren ohne Probleme im ersten Anlauf schaffbar, teilweise bin ich aber auch halb verzweifelt. Dank der großen Gadgetauswahl vor Missionsbeginn und einigen möglichen Herangehensweisen war ich mit meinem Latein aber zum Glück nie am Ende. Schließlich lässt sich ein Sieg nicht nur durch einen militärischen Erfolg holen - auch die Provokation der anderen Seite kann genügen, wenn die sich zum Chaos hinreißen lässt.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2888431967
Das Gameplay macht also durchaus was her, wird aber immer wieder durch einige Ungereimtheiten getrübt. Das Anklicken der einzelnen Gruppen hat sich zum Beispiel ziemlich unpräzise angefühlt, dazu kann man oft nicht mehr aus der höchsten Zoomstufe raus und muss dafür gegebenfalls die Mission neu starten. Ich könnte noch ein bisschen so weiter machen: In der Missionsbewertung standen die Abzüge für Sachschäden und Menschenleben in Ausnahmefällen in einem - nun ja - sehr eigenwilligen Verhältnis zueinander. Das Tutorial ist ziemlich versteckt und mir beim Anklicken abgestürzt. Der Journalistenmodus hat auf mich einen sehr unfertigen Eindruck gemacht. Der ehemalige Early Access-Titel wirkt im Großen und Ganzen einfach noch nicht ganz fertig geschliffen.
Toll ist dagegen der gleichzeitig sehr grobe und trotzdem detailliert und filigran wirkende Pixellook. Gerade die Menschenmassen sind gekonnt umgesetzt. Dazu kommt ein stimmiger rockiger Soundtrack.
Das Spiel beinhaltet auch einen lokalen PvP-Modus, den ich aber nicht ausprobiert habe. Für Content-Nachschub inklusive einigen aktuelleren Szenarien sorgt die Steam Workshop-Integration.

Eine letzte Anmerkung zur politischen Einordnung des Spiels: Obwohl ich davon ausgehe, dass die Entwickler mit der Seite der Demonstranten sympathisieren, kriegt man diese Position im Spiel nicht mit der Brechstange einmassiert. Stattdessen verzichtet das Spiel meiner Einschätzung nach auf allzu wertende Einordnungen und lässt den Spieler machen.

[i]Persönliches Rating:[/i] [b]71[/b]/100

[i]Fazit[/i]
[h3]Riot - Civil Unrest ist ein ambitioniertes Projekt, dem es etwas an Feinschliff fehlt. Seiner brisanten Thematik begegnet es mit einigen gelungenen Gameplay-Eigenheiten und bleibt dabei mehr Spiel mit Spaß-Ziel als politisches Bildungsinstrument.[/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561199360939142', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4223, 'last_played': 1698848410}
review:
该游戏的内容是在世界各地发生的大大小小的暴乱，游戏内许多关卡都能在现实世界找到原型占领奥克兰，伦敦暴乱，乌克兰革命，NO TAV运动等等（富士康暴乱应该是太原的吧，韩国训练真没找到），总体还是不错的，游戏音乐也很出色（只要你能忍住被吞掉的合唱和燃烧瓶，但毕竟是暴民干啥啥不行跑路第一名所以被吞了很正常吧乐），利用好Tab键，这能帮助你度过大部分关卡（游戏的新手教程在自定义里）
暴徒：
喇叭基本都带，其余带一些和平团体使用的干扰警察进攻的道具，如果卡关了就带燃烧瓶扔几个让警察恐慌就好办了，部分关卡的设计比较不合理，西班牙的莫斯科撤退我是用燃烧瓶，纸炸弹把警察弄恐惧硬打过去的，希腊埃弗蒂的歌谣就是硬打，把警察逼急了反过来打你，运用好摄像机政治方面碾压就能过了
毕竟是暴徒也别太指望行动起来听话
（神圣炸弹和手雷是怎么被开发出来的？？？）
警察：
基本大部分关卡一般情况下都能过（除了某一关）无非注意的就是，千万别使实弹武器这每一枪都得死一个，以及手枪，对待暴徒普通的防御模式就可以了，而对于骆驼之战这一关，就直接去看社区大佬攻略啦，不过这关怎样被开发出来的真是个谜
坦克：
埃及警方的，我们不走！他得走!里的坦克其实是可以发射的，首先把坦克变为进攻模式然后前进和后退中间就会出现发射（这就是用来玩的真射一炮媒体能把你卸了）所以其实意大利周而复始里头的车辆也可以发射（只不过射的是烟雾弹）
不过最后所有关卡通关了还是很不戳滴awa
全球模式：
控制好你的全球舆论 ，这会对你有很大帮助的，有些关卡确实很难，但是动动脑子还是会过的


世界各地的人们的抗议使这个世界变得更美好，使人们的人权得到维护，但是这只是个电子游戏，所以，
为了你的理念而战！!
RIOT

review:
目前只玩是了十二个小时，游戏进度刚刚打完富士康暴动案件，从一开始就玩的警方阵营，目前来讲游戏剧情是以全球各种暴动，游行，示威，等各类暴动原型改变的一款对抗游戏，玩家可选择警方和暴徒两大阵营，警方由战术组，突击组和发射组三个团队组成，通过各团队之间协调来完成任务，游戏玩发一般，像素画质就不过多评价。
       但是！！！！游戏内各种恶性bug太多非常影响游戏体验，有时一些bug直接影响游戏的输赢，平均一句能触发好几个bug，这就玩的非常难受，而且每个兵种操作一般，不能框一起就属实有点难受，当然兵种技能可以通过键盘上的1234来实现快捷释放。 
        总体来说游戏不错，喜欢策略，和police的酌情入手，游戏内支持创意工坊，
以上是我十二个游戏体验的评价....??????

author: {'steamid': '76561199077326317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1659741815}
review:
Despite all its flaws it mostly succeeds in what it is trying to do, which is accurately simulate a riot. A tall, really tall, order. Initially the devs were promising a system where each individual character had their own psychology, and where you only really "control" the crowds through broad gestures. "Go here" means the crowd will start moving there, but what happens on the way is totally out of your control. Anybody who's ever been in a protest, especially one that veers into out and out civil unrest, knows this is basically how it works in the real world. Nobody is ever really in control. The devs envisioned the police in the game having a similar type of setup, albeit with slightly more actual control on the player side. 

It was an ambitious idea to try to simulate all this, and to the devs credit they got as close as anybody really could. But that's sort of the thing, a riot is inherently un-gameable in that (again) nobody is in control. So what you end up with for the most part is a strategy game where actual strategy is pretty much impossible. You can barely even get your units to the right place most of the time. Getting them to stay cool in the face of rubber bullets and all that is even harder (they'll more likely go running away). 

I think the devs, over the course of this one's long development, sort of bit off more then they could chew. That isn't to say RIOT isn't fun, it is if you have 15 or so minutes to spare and like watching chaos erupt. The lo-fi visual style is also perfect for what the game is (it comes off looking like a grainy cell phone video from a failed state that you'd see playing on CNN. 

In the end it's an interesting idea that was unfortunately better as an idea then as a concept, but credit for taking up something so unfathomable to begin with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260623754', 'num_games_owned': 3600, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1661825330}
review:
[h2][b]操作繁瑣不直覺[/b][/h2]
本作是模擬抗議份子與鎮暴警察之間衝突的即時策略遊戲。以像素風格來呈現個人認為是不錯的，模糊了衝突之間的血腥。不過遊戲在使用者體驗方面處理得很不好：沒有遊戲教學、不直覺的操作、操作時常無反應......等，讓玩家一時之間無法分辨是操作失誤還是遊戲瑕疵。指令在處理階段無法中斷、使用道具後時常沒有效果，這些問題的存在也令人洩氣。單位的移動方式，點一下是行走，點兩下是跑步，非常繁瑣，完全無法明白這樣設計的用意。進入遊戲時會出現開發者的提醒，自稱開發團隊規模小...blah blah blah... 的說詞，但遊戲都賣這麼久了，成本也回收了，我不覺得這是遊戲做不好的藉口。

[h2][b]總結[/b][/h2]
基於遊戲內存在非常多操作的障礙與瑕疵，我無法推薦這款《RIOT - Civil Unrest》。

個人入手價格/途徑：約 NT$ 25 (Fanatical Bundle)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1654210870}
review:
C'est simple : ce jeu est injouable. Quasiment aucun aspect n'est réussi : les contrôles sont affreux, voire buggés (c'est vraiment LE gros problème du jeu) ; l'IA est inexistante ; la difficulté est ahurissante et sans aucune progressivité ; les graphismes rendent l'action illisible ; les missions sont à la fois incroyablement courtes et atrocement longues tant on s'y ennuie.
Sans vouloir insulter les développeurs, je pense qu'ils n'ont pas réussi à finir le jeu et qu'ils l'ont sorti quand même. Franchement, ce jeu ne vaut même pas un euro : il n'est simplement pas amusant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031771958', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1654087082}
review:
Veramente brutto. La pixel art giocata senza zoom potrebbe essere anche decente, ma zoomare sulla pixel art facendo finta che sia un meraviglioso effetto cinematografico è veramente assurdo. Le dinamiche sono banalissime e le tattiche decisamente poco realistiche. Se non costasse una cifra impressionante per un titolo tanto povero potrebbe essere anche un 'scegliete voi', ma il connubio fra bruttezza, dinamiche assenti, storia del tutto priva di pathos ne fanno un prepotente NO!
Non è bella neanche la colonna sonora. Non si capisce nemmeno la storia e dire che sono italiano e la prima campagna è ambientata fra i NO TAV, chiaramente a favore dei manifestanti.

-Gameplay tipo "Estrategia" 
-Manejas grupos de personas , policias o ciudadanos
-Objetivos variados, desde defender zonas, hasta romper edificaciones o material
-Manifestantes contra policias

author: {'steamid': '76561198026528874', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1666449911}
review:
6 years and an interesting concept. What do we get? Well not much. Its a tug of war game that I followed the development of which began when I was 13 and ended when I was 19. 

Currently priced at 17$ is too much. The game as it currently stands is worth no more than 10 and that is only if you adore the concept. Never mind its disappointing execution. 

This game could've been many things but it ended up not being much. One of the many things out of Steam greenlight that came into being which perhaps shouldn't've. In the hands of a team with a more dedicated and expanded vision this game could've broke ground. Which is why I find it hard to not be harsh on the developers. Because I know could've been so much more - and I almost guarantee the developers wanted it to be too. 

Worth 6$ on sale otherwise laugh at the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835378891', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3209, 'last_played': 1706336828}
review:
[h1] 《RIOT: Civil Unrest》 [/h1]
这是一个策略性的对抗游戏，就题材而言，防暴警察与暴徒是为数不多的现代冷兵器无限制格斗人员，很少有游戏专门描述过他们，所以这款游戏有值得加分的一点。暴力并不是唯一的选择，在对抗过程中谁先动手，谁的暴力程度高以及媒体的宣传都会影响到双方的政治得分，因此游戏中也会出现任务失败但因为政治得分高而胜利的场面。

现实事件——游戏中的暴动有实据可依，西班牙愤怒运动，埃及阿拉伯之春，希腊Keratea之战，意大利NoTAV运动，14年乌克兰危机和中国富士康事件。
游戏中可以指挥警察或者暴徒，警察偏向于战术的应用，暴徒偏向于道具的应用，警察的小队多于暴徒，而暴徒的人数多于警察，无脑蛮干往往会导致游戏失败，合理运用队伍和战术才是王道征途

游戏难度取决于事件和AI难度[spoiler] 以及你卡bug的程度和指挥的人群听话程度 [/spoiler]，关卡难度不是线性的，有可能上一关轻松无比下一关难如上天[spoiler]说的就是你骆驼之战 [/spoiler]，且ai方有一个问题，它可以同时指挥全部队伍并且道具技能CD短甚至有可能都没有CD，那你如果不熟悉操作往往会手忙脚乱，因此推荐刚开始ai难度不要调到太高,否则过关会很困难

游戏有两个成就很有趣，就是分别指挥双方和平通过所有关卡，或许这就是作者的用意吧。但对我而言这个难度实在是有些大，特别是乌克兰危机和韩国训练营， 这已经不是普通的暴民了，一定要出重拳.jpg

author: {'steamid': '76561198030217555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1597635588}
review:
Originally pitched as a realistitic simulation of riots, what was released is far from reality. This is a fairly basic game where both sides have different types of equipment. The evil terrorists has things like grenades, fireworks, and knives where the police have rubber bullets, clubs, and other non-lethal equipment. 

In the terrorist campaign you have to destablize the world and murder as many innocents as possible, destroying housing developments, staging violent demonstratons, etc. While the police obviously have to prevent the terrorists from setting the bombs ad fires typically by pushing them out of the area. 

The mechanics are vague, unresponsive, and you sort of just mash buttons half the time hoping it will function. For instance the terrorists basic attack is to throw things at the cops, but only the AI seems to know how to do it. I have never once been able to reflect this behavior in game while controlling the terrorists. I mention this because this behavior always sends the cops running the second it begins, they will essentially get locked in a state of retreat. 

I have to point out that I do not support terrorism, I do not like having to play as violent terrorists and being told that they are somehow to good guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040975031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1592612213}
review:
It has become rarer and rarer to see smaller games that possess a razor sharp focus on a topic or mechanic. This is one such game.

RIOT: Civil Unrest is a game that accurately conveys (as viewed from a distance on tv or cell phone footage etc) the chaos of various types of civil disobedience and complexities of managing large groups of people. This is done through simple mechanics.

The strategies employed vary from mission to mission, do you try goading the opposing side into more drastic forms of violence to justify you faction responding in a similar fashion, but being viewed now as defensive? maybe, or do you simply have your units peacefully sit down and refuse to budge. Perhaps you want to launch assault, fire off a  wall of teargas, followed by a quick rush to seize the objective?  Its all possible.

The true beauty of this game, is the lack of control the player has, similar to the combat mission series. Even when the player is controlling the uniformed and trained paramilitary forces or police, there is a lack of control over your officers.  They will break formations, perform acts of violence and compromise the mission through these acts. After all perception matters in this game.

The overall length is very short and there is a lack of variety in the missions offered. I hope to see more games of this nature in the future. There hasn't been a game like this since Riot Police. Its worth taking a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561199211935170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1644212236}
review:
大致上，这实际上是一款RI（爆）OT（乱）模拟器。
主要是用来模拟社会运动过程中对抗双方的过程，也就是叛乱反抗者与秩序维护者的对抗。
这种题材的游戏，在中国是比较冒风险的，不仅是基于题材的敏感性，而且更加是基于其更加注重的是技巧上的对抗性，而不是深入细挖对抗双方的动机、目的与缘由，以及双方的立场视角。所以，某种程度上说，在我眼中，这其实是一款即时策略类游戏。
其次，游戏中的对抗双方，关于谁胜谁负的判定问题，我认为是一个比较成谜的设定：那就是怎样判定维护秩序的一方是胜出还是输掉的问题：比如第一关，要求驱散示威聚集者，但警方如果不断前进驱散示威者的话，系统却又判定警察一方输，但从达成目的上来看，玩家又确实不断驱散示威者。因而，这就陷入了一个无法逻辑自洽的尴尬境地。
因而，我颇带小人之心地揣测，估计这个游戏也会有带私货之嫌。

因此，基于游戏性以及ZZZQ两点来看，我不认为这个游戏值得推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010364740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1644275566}
review:
Приготовьтесь к тому, что в режиме "Весь мир" обе стороны — злодеи. Полиция устраивает Оруэлла, за исключением вполне неплохих решений, типа "экономической колонизации" Африки или всемирного гражданского рынка оружия. А мятежники рушат мировую экономику за "светлые идеи", типа предоставления Африки самой себе (я эту ветку ещё не прошёл, примеров не будет). Зато вода для всех бесплатная.

В режиме истории же хорошие все. Полиция просто выполняет свою работу, без насилия и арестов, пока протестущие кидают молотовы и камни. А мятежники пытаются остановить коррупционеров и тиранов мирным протестом, пока полиция применяет дубинки и резиновые пули. 

С точки зрения умеренного правого, однозначно хорошей стороны здесь нет. И, вероятно. это к лучшему.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290821512', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1640924521}
review:
From the screenshots and videos I was expecting a lot more of a "Defend the area! Hold them off for as long as possible!" Type game for the police, and the exact opposite type of game for the rebels.

Not a game where you send your troops forward an inch at a time and hope they don't get stuck behind a fence because the path finding is terrible, and nothing at all happens.

Don't recommend the game at all, unless you're into a slow paced version of tug of war with screaming and sirens.

review:

review: Decent game but limited in scope. There has been a few updates over the years but it just *feels* abandoned. It does a good job of showcasing how chaotic situations can get and just how extensive the violence can be especially since protestors don't have all the heavy equipment that the police do. The Holy Hand Grenade is a meme-tier item. I could see it being used to teach politicians why its unreasonable and a serious waste of money to be militarizing the police. 10 dollars is probably a fair price, if updates were more consistent I'd say the regular price is more than fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273745911', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1658566521}
review:
玩这个游戏是冲着创意工坊去的。
不出所料，89学潮，光州事件，香港暴乱都有人做了。  
真正的政治不是靠在一两个游戏里过家家就能实现的，何况现实里大多是很多没什么独立思想或者认知浅薄的人跟风上街罢了，自由也好，民主也罢，包括生活里的诸多较小事宜的诉求，是通过脚踏实地的实践建设来的，不是举个旗子，拉几个人在街上走走就叫来的，那是山林野党，三流帮派的游戏，何况真要去抗议求表达，也要按历史的规律来，一群打着好听幌子的利己者在马路上演戏，实在滑稽。
创意工坊里香港暴乱关卡的作者就是个甴曱，但我还是要谢谢它，因为它我才有机会化身港警把那群黄头黄衣的甴曱赶走或者抓走（虽然抓不干净）。
每次结束画面上那句“警察很谨慎，暴徒很和平”都让我觉得有意思，因为我虽然玩的是一场游戏，但是这样的及其幼稚反动无聊的事情在现实里总有一帮人做给我看，历史的进程会给予他们应有的教训和惩罚。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006787252', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1610163794}
review:
Please do not buy this game. It is not finished, and it is really really poorly made what they did finish. The only enjoyment I have gotten from this game is when I went through into the INI files and changed all the settings for each and every single mission to even make them remotely playable.

That being said, some of the mechanics of this game are absolutely well made, but you will never even know they exist without going through and changing the entire setup of the whole game. Why the decided to create such an amazing set of mechanics and then completely shit on them with horrible mission setups is completely beyond me, but it really shows that this game was never finished.

I would recommend finding this somewhere for free. The devs will never complete the project and what they have made requires so much personal work to make it worth playing that I they should be paying me to play the damn game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2465, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1628865983}
review:
시위대가 되거나 진압군이 되거나

시위단체와 이를 진압/방어하는 무리 둘 중 하나를 플레이합니다.
시위단체는 진압하려는 이들로부터 특정 오브젝트를 수호하거나
특정 지점으로 이동을 하는 것이 목표이며
방어 수단, 보유 물품 들을 선택하여 게임에 진입할 수 있죠.

진압/보호단체는 시위대들을 쫓아내고 특정 오브젝트들을 파괴하거나
시위단체가 진입해들어오는 것을 막는 것이 목표입니다.
방패/몽둥이를 선택할 수 있고 특별한 아이템들을 장비도 가능하죠.

아이템의 종류에 따라서 발동하는 효과가 다른데
상대를 당황하게하거나 무리가 흩어지게 하는 효과를 가진 경우도 있고
반대로 자신의 무리가 특정 지점을 목표로 이동을 하는 등의 아이템들이 존재합니다.
어떤 단체를 선태하여 플레이하고 장착했느냐에 따라 원하는 형태로 조합을 할 수 있죠.

시위단체의 경우에는 무리의 수는 많지만 이렇다할 무구가 없는 듯 하고
진압단체의 경우에는 방패/스모크건 등의 무기와 보호구를 이용하는 경우가 있고
뭉치거나 약간 흩어지는 등의 대형을 이루어서 약간의 전략적인 움직입이 가능합니다.

문제라면... 이게 지금 내 명령을 따르고 있는게 맞는건가라는 의문이 살짝 생기기도 하고
개인적으로 키셋팅이 좀 불편하게 느껴지더군요.
1~4번의 번호는 분대들을 선택하고 변경할 수 있도록 해주고
QWER등의 키로 특정 액션이나 아이템 사용등이 가능했다면 괜찮았을듯 한대...
뭐, 이런저런 테스트를 한 뒤에 정한 것 같긴하지만...

아쉬운 점
-현재 진행이 맞게 흘러가는 건지 파악하기가 조금 힘듬
-키세팅이 개인 취향이 아님

author: {'steamid': '76561197986756755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1626869389}
review:
The UI make its hard to know whats going on, with too subtle highlights around units in a very chaotic visual style, and abilities that are lain out strangely compared to hotkeys, its all visually chaotic and unpleasant to both play and look at.

Gameplay wise, it doesnt tell you how anything works or what to do, you have an objective buts its not clear what to do, its not clear what the abilities do, its not clear what end scores are beneficial or not...

Then when you do get the hang of sorta whats going on and what you think youre meant to be doing, the AI that was meant to be something great here, it kind of makes as little sense as the rest of the game, it seems stupid with how individuals flow, and how the AI enemy itself reacts.

It also feels really bad to play, you feel like you really dont have the tools for the job, its a challenge to play rather than the gameplay itself being challenging, as if to cover the horrible gameplay design it was just covered up and called difficulty, which isnt something that hasnt been done before.

Top this off with a bug I have where if I zoom in it zooms all the way in and doesnt let me zoom out, looking on the forum I found a thread thats like 2 or 3 years old, posting a new thread got 0 responses after days, so afaik this games not only bad but buggy and developmentally dead.

Marketplace looks barren, nothing interesting there.

I think also the idea of the game seemed like more fun than it actually was, whether thats because of the bad gameplay, or just the premise isnt as interesting as I figured, IDK, but scraping through the BS, the games just kinda meh, its boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968566119', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1625463014}
review:
No real instructions. No tutorial. Ugly pixelation instead of pixel graphics.
They tell you to clear the people from an area, but they don't tell you how to use your 4 basic moves. 
Its hard to select units when other units are near them. 
Units have a hard time moving through other units. 
Heavy shield bearers are not placed in front, and seem to have to be maneuvered into place with hardship.
When I set my police to arrest rioters, after arrests they seem to stay back away and the units get lost in the pixels far away, sometimes being unmovable.
They tell you that you can earn new gear, but they don't tell you how that gear is better or worse.
Pretty soon I was wondering how to make my units just open fire on everyone, although some units fire smoke grenades the ones with rifles do not fire.
I can set my heavy units to use their shields. Other units to attack. This doesnt make sense that they don't already utilize their shields.

Because of green humans in the screen shots and key words such as "horde" and "public disturbances" I thought this was going to be a zombie game, but instead its about rioters protesting in 2011 and police defending or attacking the areas to disperse rioters. I expected a mindless zombie game, I got a messy game about civil unrest.

The graphics are not pixels, they are actually badly drawn characters that are then 'pixelated' to simulate pixel graphics. Imagine using warped bathroom window glass for your eye glass lens in real life but then getting inches from everything just to distort your vision and sense of reality.

The voices were annoying and loud so I turned off the voices, but they still are loud and obnoxious after being turned off! Its like if you were at a concert but there was no music and everyone is trying to be obnoxiously loud by chanting their songs. In fact, its like a band refused to play at a concert and the patrons start to chant to get the band to start playing again... but instead they never quiet down.

As you increase force used, there are news prompts displayed in the bottom left corner of the opposing forces thoughts that you can not click on but look like they are to be clicked on. None of it seems to matter.

I wanted to try both sides, but its just so poorly made I don't want anything to do with this game anymore. I bought this game on sale for $3.39, 82% off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029098805', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1618777303}
review:
This game... it's a very interesting concept but horribly depolyed and im here to tell you why and why you should save your money for something else. 

This game with 0 context is alright lacking some aspects and being to complicated in others. For example most the levels are really dull hold this area push them back to this area and not only that it is 100% unlike a actual riot. If you watch documentaries like for the riots in Europe or the capital riot there nothing like that i would have much prefered large scale battles with more realism aspects. Not only that but the camera angle sucks for these battles you can't move it almost at all to be in a good spot your almost never going to have all your units on screen which me being a big RTS fan i need to see my troops at all times or have easy access to them which is also not available seeing as moving the camera is like moving a brick around. 

Over all i give it a -3/10 it's just not all there. Don't get me wrong i had fun on the first levels but then it got repetative and un fun. As well as the single player skirmishes being equivelant to rocket science to set up it's just not worth your money.

review: не игра, а *б*ный рот этого казино, бл**ь, где играя на геймпаде тебе придется тыркать стик в вверх и вниз в хаотичном порядке и пытаться попасть на нужный отряд, потому что к примеру находясь на 4 отряде и нажав вниз, ты попадешь не на 5 отряд, а например на 2 и как это работает вообще не понятно. Когда курсор находится на скилле или отряде, который ты хочешь изменить, нажимаешь на кнопку, чтобы изменить этот скилл или отряд, а у тебя курсор почему то в итоге оказывается на "начать игру", а кнопка "B" это вообще не понятно что за кнопка, потому что вроде написано нажмите "B",  уже эта кнопка вылетела от количества нажатий, а ничего не происходит. Так же местный дисбаланс: протестующие тут биг бои, за которых можно даже ничего не делать, они голыми руками мистеров полицаев размажут, а в это время мистеры полицаи имея при себе нормальные дубинки, какое никакое оружие и потеющего игрока нагнуться как маленькие дети.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273688324', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1684412405}
review: Öncelikle RIOT: Civil Unrest araştırdığım üzere türünün tek oyunu. Eğer bu tarzda bir oyun oynamak istiyorsanız RIOT tek seçeneğiniz. Oyunun geliştirilmesi durduruldu bu yüzden artık güncelleme gelmeyecek. Oyunda ya polis yada isyancı oluyorsunuz ve grupları kontrol edip kazanmaya çalışıyorsunuz. Oyunun çok güzel bir tarafı ise şudur ki oyundaki oynadığınız tüm olaylar gerçekten yaşanmış olaylar. Ana hikaye 4 büyük olay üzerinden yapılıyor ve bunlar şuana kadar dünyada olan en büyük isyanlardan. Bunlar: Indignados, No TAV, Keratea ve Arab Spring. Her ana hikayede her taraf için 4 gün var yani polis olarak 4 gün isyancı olarak 4 gün. Ana hikayede geçen tüm olayların siz oyuna başlamadan kısa bir video ile anlatımı yapılıyor. İsyanın nasıl çıktığını, isyancıların ne yaptıklarını, polisin nasıl geldiğini vb. Şahsen ben pikselize grafiklerine bayıldım, hem akıcı hem de çok hoş gözüküyor. Oynanış açısındanda oldukça eğlenceli bir oyun, isyancı olup polise molotof atarak, polis olup ses bombaları atarak hırsınızı çıkarabiliyorsunuz. Gerçek bir kaos yapabiliyorsunuz. Ancak oynanışında sıkıntıları var, oyunda makul sayılacak sayıda bug var yinede bazen oynanışınızı batırabiliyor. Ana hikayelerin dışında size 17 adet tekli senaryo sunuyor bunlarda yine gerçekten yaşanmış olaylar. İçerisinde Türkiyeninde olduğu bir sürü ülke var. Oyunda ekstra modlarda var örneğin bir gazeteci olup isyanın içine girerek en iyi fotoğrafları çekmeye çalıştığınız bir mod var, bölümleri kendiniz oluşturduğunuz ve bilgisayarın bilgisayara karşı savaşmasını izleyebildiğiniz bir mod var, bunu gibi birkaç tane mod daha var. Oyunun müzikleride bence gerçekten muhteşem, ortama tamamıyla uyan müzikleri var. Ses efektleri yine muhteşem, çoğu ses efektini yapımcılar kendileri yapmışlar. Kısacası bu oyun gerçekten almaya kesinlikle değer. Ben bu oyuna 7/10 veririm, biraz abartı ama şahsi görüşüm böyle. Yinede indirimde 10,12 TL ye düşdüğünde kaçırılmaz bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094970826', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1636424859}
review:
In terms of realism, this game accurately depicts real-world situations. The pixelated style, alongside the animations, are easy on the eyes and beautiful to look at. The gameplay is... fun, having the ability to customize with weaponry, tools, and groups before you begin a level is definitely a 1-up from me, however, if you have a PC that only reached the minimum requirements to run this game, you'll be fighting through hours of lag to get through 1 minute of in-game time (including the results screen). Whether people will be able to complete the game through lag... I don't know. After nearly 6 hours of total lag-fights, I'm experiencing troubles progressing through without having to brute force the game to close.

Most of the other reviews tend to agree on everything else in terms of gameplay, the depiction, the style, etc. 
Tis also fun to ignore human rights and just go haywire on the opposition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139893873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1685815455}
review:
Ce jeu peu repousser les avares de beauté,que n'est ni c'est ici l'un des points fort de ce jeu ces graphismes en pixel qui vous immerge plus car vous avez vraiment l'impressions d'être à la fois sur le champs de bataille mais de pas être très concerné dedans le gameplay est intuitif quelques bouton pour les ordres et pour déplacer nos unités rien de plus simple que de cliquer où l'on veut aller mais,dans ce jeu l'on ne contrôle pas que de simple policier l'on peut aussi avoir accès à quelques véhicules (en fonction des missions ) .Il y'a énormément de missions et même après avoir fini le jeu il reste le workshop. Le jeu nous permet de customiser l'équipement de nos policier (manifestant aussi mais pas aussi précisément) .

Pendant mon utilisation de ce jeu je n'ai eu aucun bug entravant le jeu ,pas de crash 


Point négatif majeurs:

Attention si votre processeur est aussi bon qu'un âne à la politique laissez tomber ce jeu il a beau avoir des graphismes moyen ils est gourmand sur les sprites , à noter que certains caractères ont du mal à s'afficher peut-être dû à la version française et sinon la difficulté  . Si vous êtes des petites natures ne mettez pas plus que facile car ça devient de plus en plus difficile en facile vous avez affaire avec des énormes groupes mal équipés et peu ordonnés .Alors plus vous augmenter la difficulté plus ils sont mieux équiper et mieux ordonner , mais ils sont moins nombreux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212628331', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1611495084}
review:
На момент написания обзора я не прошел и половины игры, но уже стало всё ясно. Опишу по пунктам:
1) Разнообразие инвентаря. У бунтовщиков реализовано прикольно и разумно, есть достаточно всяких интересных вещей для разных задач, понятно зачем и че надо. Иногда даже получается условно сложный выбор, когда ты решаешь, какую же абилку тебе надо выбрать. У полиции - наоборот. Классическая дубинка, длинная дубинка, железная дубинка, телескопическая дубинка, тяжелая дубинка, деревянная дубинка, Гранатомет вар. 1, гранатомет вар. 2 и еще 100500 гранатометов с разными индексами. Вроде как разнообразие, но захером оно, простите за мой французский, надо - не ясно. Какой-то инструмент имеет больше "поинтов", чем другой. А какая в них разница на практике, не указано даже во внутриигровой вики. Как итог, всё это разнообразие у полиции не имеет смысла. 
2) Интерфейс. Он, с одной стороны, выглядит нормально. С другой - реализация паршивая. Горячих клавиш мало и назначить новые нельзя. Изменить стандартные тоже нельзя. Почти всё придется делать мышкой. Это забирает много времени. Пользоваться стандартными хоткеями просто не удобно. 
3) Графика. Я не знаю, чем обусловлен выбор именно пиксельной графики, но это самый вырвиглазный её вариант, который я когда-либо видел. Это слишком размыто и не красиво. Реализовано на уровне примерного понимания. То есть, ты отдаленн понимаешь, что вот тут у тебя дробовик, тут палка, а тут, вроде как, в тебя кинули камень. Сюда же отнесу видимость юнитов. А в сочетании с п.2 моего обзора, получаем ситуацию, когда вместо того, чтобы прогонять под хвост соперника, ты пытаешься найти 1 из 6 отрядов, который тебе срочно нужен. Небольшой спойлер: не успеешь. 
4) Баланс. Т.к. я покупал эту игру с желанием играть за полицию, то пытаться за бунтовщиков я даже не собирался. Вот такой вот я про-властный человек. И игра даже заставила меня перейте на легкий уровень в какой-то момент, потому что было реально сложно. Но черт дернул меня пойти за бунтовщиков. Так вот оказалось, что за них можно играть одним пальцем левой ноги. Даже не своей. Вывод - баланса нет. С другой стороны, это своего рода челлендж, ведь силовики всегда оказываются в проигрыше в глазах большей части народа. И по численным показателям тоже. Так что, возможно, это и логичный баланс. Но мы же тут в игру играть пришли, а не политические протесты устраивать. 
5) Время. При проигрыше идут обычные минуты. Но если вы побеждаете, то минут как бы на таймере становится раз в 10 больше, но и идут они, по ощущениям, в 10 раз быстрее. Как говорится, на*уя, а главное зачем - не понятно. Хотя это совсем не минус. Просто решил придраться.
6) И добавлю сюда свою личную боль: [spoiler]СРАНУЮ С*КА ШЕРЕНГУ НЕЛЬЗЯ РАЗВЕРНУТЬ ПО ГОРИЗОНТАЛИ! ТВОЮ МАТЬ! ХОДИТЬ ШЕРЕНГОЙ ВЛЕВО-ВПРАВО ПОЛИЦИЮ НАУЧИЛИ, А ВВЕРХ-ВНИЗ НЕТ. КАК ТАК ТО ЕПТА!?[/spoiler]

Вердикт. С точки зрения чистого геймплея и эстетического удовольствия это близко к провалу. Но вполне играбельно (и даже может принести сколько-то удовольствия) при условии, что вам нравится суть того, что происходит на экране. То есть, если вам нравится наблюдать за подобной движухой в жизни, или вам всегда хотелось жестко (или наоборот) разогнать какой-то протест, который имел место быть ирл (в мастерской, я думаю, он уже есть)(или можете сами создать), или вам просто нравится х*ячить всех ...длинной дубинкой, железной дубинкой, телескопической дубинкой.., то велкам. Лично для меня этот проект остался положительным как раз за свою уникальность и возможность *бнуть картечью по ах*евшим бунтовщикам. Буду проходить до конца.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385833106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1613010238}
review:
Contrary to the recent reviews, I think this is a good game! Not saying that it's perfect, but it is very good.
I'm not a great review writer, but here's my take.

TL;DR: Its a good game, but do yourself a favor and get in if/when it goes on sale. 

The Good:
The level creator is a blast to mess around with. The campaigns can be surprisingly informational, while still remaining a bite-size experience. The soundtrack and art style is absolutely amazing, and is one of my favorite parts about the game. Being able to pick sides (protest vs police) was very interesting, as they both have different play styles.

The Bad:
Sometimes the gameplay can get boring. There's only so many times you can tell your guys to sit down and wait before you go make a cup of coffee and put on some background music to speed things along. The newspaper element was interesting at first, but very quickly became repetitive. Many of the different items you can use are essentially the same, or worse, aren't even explained. Example being the 10+ different versions of a baton. I'm all for variety, but really?

The Ugly:
The game does have a lot of bugs, namely in the level editor. Keep in mind that it is in beta, so all of them will hopefully get fixed in the future. Placing lights in it is very difficult, sometimes it crashes, sometimes I cant add a ground, and other bugs occurred fairly often. I still had a great time with it.

Overall, a great game! I cant justify the $17 price tag, however. Do yourself a favor and get it if/when it goes on sale. A better price might be $5-10

author: {'steamid': '76561198146767331', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1607418133}
review:
游戏里面最让人头疼的骆驼之战可以这样玩，首先警察全部装备无线电，直线阵型。把帐篷全部拆了后，上下排成直线，把暴民吸引在周围，然后慢慢的把暴民推（引）到左边，就这样到时间结束。我已经发布图文指南在steam社区里面了，有兴趣可以去查看。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2311699905

先说优点：特别有新意的题材，可以代入警察或暴民进行推演，根据真实事件改编。
缺点：有的时候单位不听指令，狂点鼠标也没有用。部分关卡玩法单一（用盾牌把暴民推出去就行了），没发现良好的公共舆论有啥用，马赛克有时候挺伤眼的，骆驼之战警察关卡很折磨人！

有的关卡要求警察防守阵线，暴民会对警察投掷燃烧弹，，，，，货真价实的暴民。

I am a fan of the concept, but not this genre of game. Decided its on sale for $3 why not?

I will say, it is worth ALL of my $3 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047247058', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5182, 'last_played': 1579593219}
review:
Followed the development of this game since 2014. The concept is great and the art style fits the concept so well.

Unfortunately the gameplay destroys the games potential, and now that the game has been fully released any hope I was holding out for it is gone.

It isn't that its difficult or boring, it just doesn't make sense. There isn't really any strategy to it. You are just randomly clicking hoping your sides line moves forward and the enemies line moves back. There are items you can use both and law enforcement and protesters but their effects aren't well explained and due to the lack of a proper tutorial they are extremely confusing to learn how to use.

I still check in on this game every now and again but it hasn't had any noteworthy changes since the first playable version was released on Steam.

review: This game is very high quality and personally has blown me away with its unique gameplay. You can either play as riot police trying to contain a mob of rioters using riot tactics, tear gas and rubber bullets. You can also play as the rioters which is a nice touch if you want to experience the other side of the battle/riot. Rioters can become hostile throwing large objects at police making it difficult for the police to contain the riot. Police can use tear gas, rubber bullets and live ammo to contain hostile rioters which makes the game very good as you can make rioters more hostile depending on your actions. The game overall is very unique and I would love to see more games like this in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127636129', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1603807384}
review:
I remember I've seen this game a long time ago. Maybe around 2014 or so.
The concept is really cool, play a RTS-like game portraying conflict between rioters and police.
And the pixel art, guess I've never seen anything so good. It's low-res but has every modern rendering tech in it. light and shadow just looks so real. With the noisy shouting of rioters it's like you are really in that place, that situation.

But the gameplay is totally confusing, I find myself just randomly moving and pushing people around most of the time.
You can select equipment for your people but what does what is just vaguely explained. Like crackers can make a loud sound and scare people. But in reality it seems to do nothing to the armed and shielded policeman. Also playing as police you can't see the goal in prepare phase, instead there's a budget value which does nothing. I don't know what happened maybe they were changing stuff around but this should be a finished game not early access.

Violence is an important aspect in this game, but what counts as violence is barely explained. Of course shooting bullets at people is violent, but what about smoke bombs and stun grenades? What about charging to people with baton? Sometimes those actions do result in a little violence score in the end, sometimes they don't. I don't understand.

And there are bugs. Sometimes people get stuck in their action (like charging) and can never be controlled anymore. It happened in that most difficult Camel level a few times for me. That was a real nightmare.

Also it's very short. Only 4 scenarios each with 4 levels for both sides. (one has 5) Each level has a time limit for about 5 minutes so that's about 3 hours to finish everything. You may retry a few times in some harder ones but not knowing what you are doing and repeating the same level again and again isn't really fun.

Maybe it's intentional to make things vague so you can immerse yourself in that situation without being too "logical". But meanwhile you kinda wanna win so that you can unlock more levels to play. It's like the dev don't know which direction to go, and they want to achieve both, but unfortunately that's not an option, at least with what we have here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353117906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1597906817}
review:
反抗与镇压的小品游戏。有几个国家的剧情但剧情深度不够（一般来说足够，个人感觉太少）。
因为hk事件买的，玩了感觉很不是滋味
警察服从命令、群众争取权利无可厚非。但无论作为哪一方都难以以完全和平的方式解决争端（能解决就不会发生抗议了），哪一方失利都会引起反弹。
玩着玩着我感觉小渔村的年轻人的相貌出现在人物脑袋的马赛克上，和平与暴力都并非他们的本意，无论是哪一方都在为这场不是由自己引起的战争中付出代价。可怜他们……但其实我没有资格可怜他们，我连在公众场合支持他们的勇气都没有，我甚至需要在某些场合附和无知无畏的潮流。所以，我可怜自己……
那片土地因拥有自由和法制而繁荣，如今却要因为失去自由和法制而衰落。
丧钟已经响起，但不知丧钟为谁而鸣。
[spoiler]愿荣光归于香港[/spoiler]

review:
很有意思的游戏，基本贯彻了谁先动手谁先走的道理，暴徒建议什么都不要带，不要旗子不要护具，死人越多越优势，道具带媒体和照相机，开局媒体不断补人，照相机时刻准备，你人多警察很难推动你，警察动手就疯狂拍照，玩命克制，等警察先动手就基本先走了，就算场面数了，对面政治分也大概率-100分，疯狂照相就好了。
警察建议也是，给盾最好的装备，开着龟甲慢慢推，射击部队带个照相机，等暴民暴动，然后拍照赚政治。
打了好几把最高难度，个人感觉基本就是等AI开枪或者开扔，然后AI就被自己和媒体送走了。
玩了一把埃及最后一关，把人杀光了，暴民直接出局了，然后军事分直接NAN，报错了，悲

author: {'steamid': '76561198377431089', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1590936384}
review:
我的立场：PRO-COP
       之前花了很长时间才把生涯的警察关卡通关（绝大部分关卡0示威者死亡），玩完没有第一时间去评价这款游戏，适时正逢HK闹事，敏感游戏，不提也罢。生涯中最令我头疼的是什么任务呢，是那几个骆驼骑兵的任务，我打了3个小时才打过，至于这些意味着什么，我决定放在之后的分析里面一起说。
       这是一款不错的警察游戏吗？是的。那么为什么我会去不推荐呢，是因为这是一款与我相左政治立场的，私货让我唾弃的，罔顾警务事实的，煽动教唆软件。
       这个游戏里面有几个和美国相关的示威任务？在我上一次游玩的时候，是0。这里面对那些所谓的海外民运，分离主义反政府分子的话语引用，不在少数，那些话语和无政府主义没有什么关系吧，像做人皮唐卡的大喇嘛，能和人权沾边吗？农奴制度是一个平等和谐的制度吗？在一个充满政治表态的游戏里面出现这些人物，不是蠢，就是坏，要不然啊，就是又蠢又坏。
       谈回警务现实与事实，探寻新型警民关系，是现如今世界上所有大国和发达国家所正在做的， 在历年黑命贵中屡次出现的对警察军事化的反对，对消减警务部门经费的要求，都是属于手疼砍手，头疼砍头的行为。为什么警察“军事化”？因为治安环境恶劣。为什么要消减经费？如果你认为警察是来服务市民的你去降低薪资标准和减少装备支给，能换来更好的服务吗？（而这两个诉求也是游戏里所暗示的）
       我不认为中国的人民警察和美国的联邦，地方执法机构，乃至于巴西军警体系，在政府的施政行政过程中是异大于同的。但是，这不代表这些机构是同一个组织，你能因为巴尔的摩的巡警推搡老太而要求让NYPD的警长下台吗？（这件事的确发生了）
       事实就是很多人并不懂警务，他们懂武力升级吗？换句话，好话不听，要听什么话？（游戏里面的武力升级与报复系统有意思但不那么理想，搞笑的是，迫于行政压力，这往往成为了现实）
       政治问题，用这种方法方式去煽动教唆，我不会去推荐给其他人。尽管这个游戏是有一些些有趣的地方的，但这个游戏里面关于政治问题的一些明示暗示，我不能容忍，触犯到了我的一些底线。
       欢迎留言，那些允许杀害警察的杂碎。纵使是电子游戏，GTAV和CSGO和这个游戏之间还是有着很大的区别的，GTA里面那些走私贩毒残害他人的行为我个人认为是在任何地方都不能正当化的，当然这些东西作为一个表现要素在电子游戏中出现我是管不到的，我只能，不推荐。至于CSGO，它有在加载画面里面挂着本拉登语录吗？

review:
Отвратительно.

Во-первых, графен. Я вроде бы не графодрочер, мне очень нравится, например, Original War, но здесь у меня аж глаза болят смотреть на это пиксельное говно. Я серьёзно, от графена 1997 года не болят, а тут болят. Зачем вообще делать пиксельный графен в XXI веке?

Но это ладно, хрен бы с ним. Отвратительно оно совсем из-за другого. Я поиграл несколько миссий за полицию. Так вот это не геймплей. Это максимум жамеплау (и то с натяжкой). Управление отрядами сложно, неудобно, даже такой элементарной вещи, как повернуть шеренгу, нет. Весь жамеплау заключается в тыканье в рандомные точки экрана в надежде, что что-нибудь произойдёт и миссия как-нибудь выиграется

0 автозаков из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074006553', 'num_games_owned': 1656, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1594423492}
review:
I don't know what game the people who are recommending this are playing.
Previously I played it in early access and stopped because the game play was very rough, and nothing in the game felt satisfying.

After releasing and on a sale I decided to give it one last try, and the game play is somewhat satisfying but after doing 5-6 missions they just all kind of feel the same.  Depending on whatever difficulty you have to manage your rioters or police a specific way to obtain victory if you go against what is suppose to be done then you just lose 'politically'.  It's more of a shitty puzzle game that promised too much and got delivered late, and was a disappointment following the development.
Max hours of enjoyment I can truly see is 6-10 hours or playing on and off as it's a small niche game that there isn't really any other game like it.  Sadly it being its only kind was never truly fulfilled and no new news besides the publisher pushing new shitty games in the news feed, one look at Merge Games page will show you the level of quality control they expect from developers they decide to publish.

Overall I just don't care for much from games by Leonard Menchiari and soured more with a shitty publisher.
Game is interesting concept that's all an empty shell of a concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034493589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1682264900}
review:
tldr: Tolle Idee, plumpe Umsetzung. Eventuell im Sale zu Empfehlen wenn man Pixel-Art und die Thematik mag.


Technik:
Verbuggte und ungenaue Steuerung. Das Pathfinding ist praktisch nicht vorhanden und Einheiten bleiben oft stecken oder bewegen sich gar nicht.  Die Menüs und das Hud sind meiner Meinung nach schlecht skaliert und optimiert.

Gameplay:
Es fehlt ein ausführliches Tutorial. Man muss immer herumexperimentieren um herauszufinden, was die verschieden Befehle eigentlich tun. Sobald man ein Grundgefühl darüber hat wird es zu simpel und repetativ. Wenn man ein Level gespielt hat, kennt man fast alle. Es mangelt an Abwechslung und Erklärung. Die Kampagne fällt mit auch sehr kurz aus.

Grafik:
Bis auf die Menüs hervorragend, solange man Pixelart mag. Der Stil wurde, meiner subjektiven  Meinung nach, selten so gut umgesetzt. Außer in den Menüs, dort wirkt alles etwas "matschig" und plump.

Wertung:
Tolle Idee, aber in der Umsetzung sehr schwach. Für den Vollpreis von rund 17 Euro ist  es definitiv zu teuer. Im Sale für ca. 4-5 Euro kann man es mitnehmen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063227458', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1662267553}
review:
RIOT: Civil Unrest was a game in which I really, really wanted to give it a chance. I honestly did. I stayed with it through crash after crash, bug after bug, BS moment after BS moment. In the end, though, I just couldn't stay with it.

The game, while fun for the first few minutes, quickly devolves into nothing more than frantic running around, much like a real riot. The game has more bugs than the Amazon, and is about as stable as the political environment it seeks to replicate. Whenever I finished a storyline, which was only No TAV, as I previously played Global mode and didn't want to replay the other missions, the game crashed just like that. No matter what I tried, when I clicked the button to take me back to the menu, the game froze up and died.

This isn't even getting into the gameplay. While I previously hinted at it, the gameplay can be safely categorized into three categories:

Really fun

Really boring

Makes me want to shoot a child, then myself

Can you guess which category was most common?

While playing Global Mode, the first few missions were so easy it basically gave me a free ride through the rest of it.

Until I got to the Arab Spring.

That circle in the middle of the street still gives me nightmares. That wide open area, where protesters can slip through the tight formations of your tactical units, who are standing shoulder to shoulder, shield to shield, baton to baton. I sprayed them with tear gas, which only made it worse as they then ran around to the back. I eventually had to divert my assault teams to arrest the few people who got through, which was probably the intended purpose. This, however, was not the worst experience I had on that map.

Far from it.

I forgot the name of the mission. It doesn't matter. Everyone who's played it knows what I'm talking about. That same circle was now home to an angry mob of protesters with molotovs and rocks. And here I am with ~40 or so people trying to hold off what seemed to be a never ending horde of Egyptians. It felt like Thermopylae, except replace the Spartans with men with bellies so yellow it makes Homer Simpson look normal. I mean, they ran at the first rock thrown against their heavy armor. As soon as a pebble touched their half inch thick shields specifically designed to counter just that, they ran behind the nearby police van and got stuck behind there, losing me the battle. Eventually, I gave up and simply mowed down protesters with M16s and won the fight, even winning the political battle because they cast the first stone or something.

Then the Battle of the Camel happened.

At that point, I was sick and tired of the bugs, tired of the controls, which were absolutely atrocious. You can't even select a unit without clicking it, nor can you select multiple units. This sounds minor, until you try and make a coordinated push and end up having to click up a storm like a damned cicada.

All in all, exactly the opposite of ATBGE. This game had a very interesting concept, had a profound message, and was created for all the right reasons, yet its execution made me want to execute myself.

review: I looked at some of the recent reviews and thought well I will give it a try. Thought it might be some fun and yes it was fun...But only for so long. Within 30min of me playing I already passed 2 of the levels and there were only 4 levels to play from I was half already done with the game within 30min. When a game lets you complete half of the game in 30min it's probably not a very well designed game with a whole lot of content backing it up. Which is exactly this game. Don't get me wrong I did enjoy it, it was a pretty fun game but the lack of content there is in this game is really bringing it down. I really wish this game could have turned out better because it's a great concept but the way it was done was done poorly. Don't buy this game I kinda honestly price this game anything lower than $10 so if it ever becomes on sale anything under than $10 then yeah pick it up and try it for yourself.

review:
Played mostly on console and only own on PC because of a great sale. Glad I own it here too, as I bet M&K will be far superior to controller. And if not, at least I have the choice to use either.

Recently, I've been playing alt of Pandemic Inc., for some unknown reason - just had an unexplained inkling to play. Quite a good strategy game too. And the mobile version, in that rare instance, actually enhanced the game. 

As far as Riot Civil Unrest goes, last week I got the urge to play that too. It came out of nowhere and persists even when it's way past bedtime. I was about to go find the ps4 disc....and my ps4 too, but then I remembered I own it here. After checking to make sure, I saw that the scores had dropped, and not wanting such a great game to get buried in search results, I started this review. That's about it, for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041938444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1590231945}
review: I'm a little hesitant to say I like this game on a whole this game is a simple Strategy game it's short and easy to learn. Gameplay wise it's simple to know what your objective is. If your a cop you break the riot by destroying a campground or driving them from a point. If your a rioter.... you riot and break shit, but no you get identical objectives with differing assets to use at your disposal like bootleg fireworks and mollies to attack officers with. SImple and fun BUT there is a catch to this game. It has a horrendous formation system that may infuriate even the most patient. For example if there are obstacles in that map and you say arrest a few rioters. There is a 50% chance that the cops that dragged away those people will be gone and by gone I mean stuck in some sort of bullshit obstacle, even if you were to get that squad back one guy could still be stuck on the terrain you will have the formation get pulled back to the guy stuck on the terrain. It's.......Terrible....just awful. However that was a few levels in a game where the majority of the maps had little obstacles to get stuck on. If you want to try the game wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119403463', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1591924247}
review:
[b]Riot - Civil Unrest[/b], é um jogo único (por assim dizer) é o primeiro jogo que vi simular uma turba e pelotões de choque de maneira realista, divertida e fácil de jogar.
O jogo te permite assumir controle de manifestantes e tropas de choque. Nos pelotões de choque, o jogo te possibilita usar diferentes equipamentos para combater os manifestantes, desde a tonfas mais pesadas, granadas de gás lacrimogênio e até te permite atirar munições de borracha em manifestantes kkkkk, e te dá opções de formações pra tropa(formação em linha, em cunha e etc). Já do lado da turba, ele te permite jogar  de pedras, pedaços de madeira, rojões e até molotovs em policiais,dar comandos pra multidão e etc, pros manifestantes poderem cumprir o objetivo da manifestação.
Em relação a [b]gráficos[/b], o estilo pixelizado ajuda muito o jogo, para dar uma característica própria pro jogo e até no desempenho geral dele no PC, pois a quantidade de NPCs que existem em cada fase é enorme(tem fases que terá mais de 200 manifestantes e mais de 90 policiais.
O jogo não possui uma história complexa com começo, meio e fim, [i]PORÉM[/i], grande parte das fases irá começar com um texto explicando as manifestações (maioria delas por razões políticas) pra dar contexto pra nível.
Se tu estiver procurando um game divertido, simples com temática de controle de distúrbios e manifestações, esse é o ideal pra você.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090490140', 'num_games_owned': 2045, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1587529774}
review:
NS上全关卡通关，特地来补个评价。

作为特殊题材的即时战略游戏，本作的主要玩法围绕着“区域控制”这一机制展开，无论是作为抗议方还是暴力机器方，胜利条件都是获得对目标区域的控制权，因所选阵营的不同而区分出了坚守和驱逐这两类体验。

就暴力机器方而言，比较直观地再现了第一世界资本主义国家自八十年代始受英帝的殖民地治理经验影响所采用的常见治安战策略。但就抗议方而言，人数于局部上的优劣在大部分情况下是决定胜负的直接因素，可见本作对资产阶级暴力机器的理解太过一厢情愿和运动主义。而同样作为一大卖点的舆论系统，也很难说体现了具体冲突中不同的社会群体和组成所可能产生的应对，更像是某种动态的难度调整阀。另外，游戏中存在着一些操作上的BUG，也很影响具体的游戏体验。

除此之外，主要的可游玩场景集中在近十年来的公共性事件上，没能展现如五月风暴抑或全共斗在东大的那种历史，算是对个人而言的一种遗憾吧。不过，扮演抗议方的时候能听到《团结的人民永不败》和《华沙曲》还是挺令人惊讶的，也算是制作方在某种程度上对运动主体的均质化想象了（笑）。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198351419136', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1657872222}
review:
[h1]คะแนน 61/100 ไม่ดีไม่แย่ กลางๆ[/h1]
ตัวเกมหลักจะเซ็ตอยู่ใน 4 เหตุการณ์ประท้วงทั่วโลกได้แก่  Indignados ,  No Tav ,Keratea,Arab Spring เราสามารถเลือกได้ 2 ฝ่ายได้แก่ Rioters(ผู้ประท้วง) Police(ตํารวจ) โดยที่เป้าหมายของแต่ละฝ่ายในแต่ละด่านนั้นต่างกัน ยกตัวอย่าง เช่น ฝ่าย Rioters ต้องรักษาพื้นที่ของตัวเองจากตํารวจ ส่วนฝ่าย police ต้องไล่ผู้ประท้วงออกจากพื้นที่จุดนั้นเป็นต้น
Rioters : ผู้ประท้วงมี 2 โหมดคือ โหมดสงบ กับ โหมดรุนแรง คือ ผู้ประท้วงจะสามารถเลือกสิ่งของได้ครั้งละ 4 ชิ้นเช่น Megaphone(ใช้รวมกลุ่ม และใช้ในการบอกให้เคลื่อนที่) Firecrack(ประทัด ใช้ขู่ฝั่งตํารวจ) Firecracks(ใช้ในการทําให้เกิดเสียงดัง) Rocks(หิน ใช้ปาใส่ตํารวจ ใช้ได้เฉพาะผู้ประท้วงที่ใช้ความรุนแรง)
WIFI(ใช้ใในการเรียกผู้ประท้วงมาเสริมกําลัง) และอื่นๆ
ผู้ประท้วงที่เราควบคุมได้(อาจจะเรียกว่าแกนนําแหละ)มีจํานวนไม่เท่ากันในแต่ละด่าน ผู้ประท้วงที่เราคุมได้สามารถปลุกใจผู้ประท้วงในกลุ่มเราได้ 

Police:police มีทั้งหมด 4 หน่วยด้วยกัน ซึ่งไม่ขอเจาะลึก  การปรับแต่งตัวละครฝั่งตํารวจสามารถทําได้ แต่ขอไม่เจาะจง  ตํารวจมี 2 แบบคือตํารวจที่ใช้กระบอง กับตํารวจที่ใช้ปืน โดยที่ตํารวจที่ใช้กระบองขอไม่เจาะจง ตํารวจที่ใช้ปืน ปืนที่ใช้มีหลายชนิดเช่น ปืนระเบิดควัน ปืนแก๊สนํ้าตา Shotgun M16 และอีกมากมาย และอาวุธเสริมของตํารวจ มีหลายชนิดโดยที่ตํารวจแต่ละนายมีอาวุธเพียงคนละ ชิ้น เช่น Stun Grenade , Smoke Grenade,Handgun,Radio และอีกมากมาย

Riot Editor(BETA) : Riot Editor คือเครื่องมือสําหรับสร้างด่านของเราเองที่ไม่มีในเนื้อเรื่องหลัก 
Riot Editor ค่อนข้างให้อิสระกับผู้ใช้งานเพราะ เราสามารถสร้างฉากหลัง ตลค.ฝ่ายผู้ประท้วง ตลค.ฝ่ายตํารวจ และเรายังสามารถกําหนดเป้าหมายให้แต่ละฝั่งได้ Riot Editor ยังมีอีกหลายfunction ให้เราใช้งานได้
แต่เราจะไม่เจาะลึก ให้มาศึกษาเอาเอง

review: O jogo é excelente para o estado que se encontra agora de desenvolvimento (parece estar no fim do desenvolvimento). É completamente inovador, criativo, educativo e caprichado(nas fases do Brasil o coro é em português! da pra ouvir nitidamente "o povo unido jamais será vencido!"). A música é bem maneira e tem bastante coisa pra se fazer. Tem modo split screen, que pra quem não sabe(nesses tempos tem gente q n sabe), é quando da pra jogar de 2 ou mais na mesma máquina, mas não tem modo online oficial. Espero que tenha no futuro, é o que tudo indica. Até lá, tem que se virar com o steam remote? sei la. Meu único contra é o preço. N sei quantos dólares vale, mas 33 reais nao vale esse jogo não. Ele é tudo de bom, mas não o suficiente pra isso. Pra ter uma idéia, o jogo Ghost 1.0 custa 26 reais, 7 reais mais barato. Então só compre se estiver em promoção mesmo, porque por mais que seja muito bom, da pra enjoar rápido. E pagar 30 pila pra enjoar rápido nao da.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027613364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1586308172}
review:
I read the negative reviews and bought it anyway because I thought it would be fun. There are cool ideas in this game and I tried really hard to like it. But it is simply a bad game. 

The problem for me is the terrible UI and unit controls. And I really mean terrible. They are so awful, there is nothing else worth talking about. I feel bad saying it, but I think the devs need to go play any RTS game of the last 20 years to learn how those games have solved problems with unit control and direction. It's really that bad.

If there is a major sale, give it shot and see if you can handle it better than me. Otherwise, move on and don't look back.

review:

*I dont know

*Even though the opening has music and sound, the levels do not have music, or maybe I didnt waste my time to find out. Its weird to be just listening to literal sounds.

*I played on the easiest diff and the hardest. The hardest seems so broken and just tedious.

Although I did only play for an hour I think thats why I could not even become immersed.
