author: {'steamid': '76561198969729261', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1698495437}
review:
[h1] Верблюды не круто, ,,Черепаха" отстой [/h1] 
Покупая игру, будьте готовы застрять на 42% прохождения за бунтовщиков и на 63% за полицию. Если вам пофиг на режим Весь Мир ( что является по сути сюжетом всей игры ), то милости прошу. Знаете, очень часто казалось, что разработчики сами даже не тестировали игру. Проблема Верблюжьей Битвы ( за сторону полиции ) и Баллады об Эфтихис ( за бунтовщиков ), что у них одна и та же проблема. [b] Мир не работает [/b] потому что на Верблюжьей Битве протестующие просто уходят обратно ( локация огромная, у вас 6 отрядов по 4 верблюда ). Попытаться их разогнать силой, то тебе уже поставят марку Жестоко, а ты к тому времени едва ли половину прогонишь, а оставшиеся будут бросаться камнями. В Балладе Об Эфтихис точно та же ситуация. Миром не прокатит, потому что тактический отряд просто построит ,,Черепаху,, и ты больше никогда его миром не сдвинешь. Если будешь использовать силу, то во-первых ты не сможешь прогнать минимум два отряда полиции на целую минуту ( это невозможно, так как их точка ,,восстановления,, находится в [u] метре [/u] от зоны которую они должны удерживать ), во-вторых если ты убьёшь хотя бы одного полицейского, все твои отряды которые стоят рядом с зоной в ожидании атаки на эту зону просто убегут. И всё ! Тебе -100 полит. очков сразу и прощай мораль твоих отрядов. [b] И да, поставьте мне оценку ,,Забавно", кто тоже застрял на Верблюжьей Битве за полицию или на Балладе Об Эфтихис за бунтарей. [/b] Чисто посмотреть, я знаю что таких много.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314859625', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1583670449}
review:
还是给个好评吧。这游戏属于典型创意还行，但是游戏机制和操作上一塌糊涂。机制很迷除了催泪弹和震撼弹有明显驱散人群作用的话，其他东西根本就不知道有什么太大用（或者是不明显）。盾墙作用也不大总是有人群能挤过警察盾墙而且个人认为警察给的太少，有些突破任务我当人群基本都能挤过去。还有你这个游戏居然还不能框选？警察像素本来就低冲到人堆里我几次鼠标点不着警察。
我猜大多数玩这个游戏的人除了键盘政治家评论区秀自己没什么用的理想外，就是像我一样想看现代版防暴全面战争的人。所以我希望作者以后能优化一下游戏机制和操作向RTS看齐。如果作者是因为想表达某种观点的话就当我没说。

author: {'steamid': '76561198134713746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1578434358}
review:
Alors j'ai acheté ce jeu 5 euros pendant les soldes et je le regrette deja, n'acheter pas ce jeux ! pour les raisons qui suivent:
-les dévelopeurs prenne partie pour les emeutiers, vachement avantagé par rapport au flic
-abscence de liberté totale: si vous jouez en utilisant la violence vous perdez la partie dans 95% des cas (sauf si les autres ont été plus violent en gros)
-la p*tain de bataille de chameau: un niveau qui ne peut etre gagné que en utilisant la violence sauf que si vous etes violent vous perdez la mission mais si vous l'etes pas assez les manifestants vous contourne et rentre en permanence dans le cercle, enfin bref niveau purement injouable.
-les policiers ont des tas d'équipement... mais ils font aucune différence tout les lanceurs sont les memes etc
-vos unités en ont rien a f*utre de vos ordres et fuit dans tout les sens et des fois tabasse les manifestans sans raison
-le jeu prend ouvertement partie pour les manifestants et montre les flics comme des Waffen SS.

morale de l'histoire, si vous voulez vous amusez a controler des emeutes rejoignez les CRS ca serat vachement mieux

author: {'steamid': '76561197982580390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1590233895}
review:
La démarche artistique des développeurs est absolument admirable, et c’est bien pour cela que je suis embarrassé : d’un côté, on peut prendre le RIOT: Civil Unrest comme un loisir, car comme tous les jeux vidéo, il a des mécaniques qui permettent de gagner, de perdre, de progresser. Mais on peut également le prendre comme une œuvre d’art qui permet de véhiculer des idées et des émotions, permettant de voir ces évènements réels d’une manière originale.
En tant que jeu vidéo, Riot Civil Unrest est très intéressant et original, entaché par une confusion et une répétitivité.
En tant qu’œuvre vidéoludique d’art, Riot Civil Unrest réussit l’exploit de concilier l’interactivité du jeu vidéo avec un discours nuancé et politique passionnant sur un sujet on ne peut plus d’actualité.

+ Points forts de RIOT: Civil Unrest

- L’intelligence du game design au service du propos
- Les graphismes bluffant de réalisme tout en pixel art
- Le choix des conflits, suffisamment important et méconnus.
- Game design des maps.
- pouvoir incarné soit les forces de l'ordre ou bien les manifestants.

- Les points faibles de RIOT: Civil Unrest

- L’absence de tuto
- La confusion globale du jeu

review:
Очень интересная концепция, но иногда некоторые механики страдают. Например, где полиции нужно дойти до конца карты, это просто имбалансно, мирным способом их задержать невозможно (у игры есть ачивка на пацифизм), ведь полиции не нужно чистить территорию. Аэрозоль тоже более-менее читерский, ведь распыляется из рук и не нужно корректировать бросок. Да и само управление не всегда понятно под что подстроенно, на геймпаде проблема с игровым меню и с экипировкой бунтующих окно селекции поворачивает на 45* по часовой. 
Но, несмотря на все проблемы и баги игра дала довольно интересный экспириенс. Также пиксельная рисовка очень приятная. Да  и саму тему бунтов люблю.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966064154', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1576062356}
review:
J'avais financé le jeu des années avant l'early access et même si le concept est original, le résultat est un échec cuisant. 

Les + :
- Concept
- Environnements et cinématiques en pixel art.
- L'aspect vaguement éducatif.

Les - :
- Illisibilité de l'action et interface peu claire
- Absence de tutorial, la prise en main est très confuse et obscure.
- Gameplay ennuyeux et décérébré. On a des vagues de mobs à contrôler au clic de souris. Par exemple occuper une place pendant 5 minutes va consister à spammer le clic gauche aussi rapidement que dans un cookie clicker pour aider les troupes à tenir ou se faufiler entre les brèches. Il y a des gadgets et bonus passifs à débloquer et déclencher, mais on a malheureusement toujours la sensation de jouer à un RTS conçu pour de véritables handicapés mentaux. Ça irait si les missions n'étaient pas si "longues", mais spammer le clic gauche et deux, trois touches de claviers pendant 5 minutes pour tenir/capturer une zone, c'est juste l'ennuie total.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341089787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1575241996}
review:
在这游戏正式推出之前，曾在各种渠道听说这个游戏，感觉这题材选得不错，很有创意，所以产生了极大的兴趣。
结果玩过之后，体验并不好。
作为一个游戏，新手引导为零，我不知道我该做什么，该怎么做，我做了某些操作有什么用。前十分钟对游戏一点想法一点概念都没有，我怎么玩下去？[spoiler] 在现实中都有人教曱甴怎么搞，我线上模拟一下就不能教一下吗 [/spoiler] 而由于没有新手引导，我甚至都不知道我的手下（警察）是有血条的，[spoiler] 打着打着发现我的人怎么没了？哦原来都倒地了。怎么倒地的？哦原来都被暴民炸死了orz [/spoiler]
作为一个很喜欢数值的玩家，这游戏内的wiki跟没有一样。很多东西只是简单一句文字说明，那这东西是有什么作用呢？能起到什么效果呢？完全没有一个具体的表现。[spoiler] 所以又只能用生活常识来想象道具们的功能，然后实操发现好像有点出入，然后我又重玩关卡 [/spoiler]
还有一点，操作体验极差。选择队伍要用鼠标一个一个点，后者用tab键单向循环选择。有的时候对队伍下达一个指令就会自动跳到另一个队伍。这又回到新手引导这个问题。操作都是靠摸索出来的，连怎么操作都不了解，我还怎么玩得下去？
综上所述，这游戏体验是在太差，让人感觉真的像个半成品。用创意吸粉，然后用最基础的游戏体验掉分。唉……有种怒其不争的感觉。
正所谓希望越大，失望越大，是我对这个游戏期望太高了。我的。

review:
自分は好きだったがおすすめするかと言われると躊躇する

アートワーク等を楽しめるのであれば買い
自分でシナリオの元ネタ背景を検索して妄想できるのであれば買い

ゲーム性としては結構大味

最終的な結果以外数値として表れてこないので
自分の操作がどう作用したのかがわからない(あえてそういうシステムなのだと思うが…)

スキル等も使いやすいものがハッキリわかれており
だいたいこの組み合わせでやれば楽という定石がきまってしまう
(もしかしたら有効な組み合わせや操作があるのかもしれないが本当に効果的だったのかわからない)

自分はデモ側は楽しめたが警察側一部シナリオでの鎮圧がどうしてもできなくて投げた

でも雰囲気で楽しめたのでセールなら買い

review: The game’s sujet and graphical style looked enticing. However, I immediately ran into technical issues in the form of frequent crashes to desktop, glitched graphics shaders and disappearing resp. invisible sprites which rendered the game unplayable. Additionally, there is no sufficient onboarding of the player. The two short tutorials, which are hidden away in a sub-menu, do little to explain the underlying gameplay model. I had to restart the tutorial multiple times because logical triggers meant to advance the tutorial would not activate, leaving the player stuck. Unfortunately, I cannot go into the overall design of the gameplay, since selecting the global gameplay mode would reproducibly result in a crash to desktop. I since requested a refund.

review: A unique simple game. clunky controls that can be frustrating. However I highly recommend the experience it simulates very accurately the on the ground decisions of people during major unrests of the last few decades. Many games let you experience major events in history by being a mayor general or king, but RIot lets you look through the roles of Police, Hired Thugs, Armoured Corps, Picketing communists and angry Citizens in events important to our worl but somewhat more ambiguous to their finale place in history. I would recommend for some fun or as an education tool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044148668', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1634194646}
review:
Polis ya da protestocular olarak oynayabileceğiniz bir oyun. Protestocular olarak oynarken pasif kalıp çeşitli ses bombaları ve diğer aletlerle polisi kışkırtıp size saldırmalarına sebep olabiliyor ve bu sayede destek toplayabiliyorsunuz. Eğer pasif oynamak istemezseniz agresif moda geçip molotof, patlayıcılar ve taş fırlatma gibi özellikler kullanıp önünüzdeki polisleri yaralayarak ve hatta öldürerek yolunuzu açabiliyorsunuz. Fakat bunu yaptığınızda polis de etkiye tepki gösterip ciddi güç kullanmaya başlıyor, bunun içine tazyikli su, göz yaşartıcı gazlar, başta plastik ve sonra gerçek mermi kullanmak gibi şeyler de dahil. İstediğiniz yerlerde agresif davranıp, polisi güç kullanmaya zorlayıp tekrar pasife geçip, sosyal medyada çekilen "aşırı güç kullanan polis" fotoğraflarını da kullanıp daha çok destek toplayabiliyor, ve bir sonraki protestonuza daha büyük bir kalabalık ile girebiliyorsunuz.

Birçok yönden düşünülmüş güzel bir oyun, 20 küsür verilebilir, ama eğer indirimdeyse mutlaka almanızı tavsiye ederim.

Not: Çoklu mod sadece LAN olarak çalışıyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145417195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1574726519}
review:
创意不错，然而以玩法为主各种不行，这里说几个不行的地方。

先说玩法
本质就是赶羊群游戏，警察是赶羊群的猎犬的话，暴民方就是羊群。
羊群的目的是赖着不走，猎犬的目的则是轰走羊。
所以遇到地形狭窄的地图猎犬这边只要排排坐压回去就好
遇到开阔的地图四面八方都是羊就要想办法诱导羊群。

看起来挺策略性，然而
关卡与关卡之间毫无难度曲线而言，要么就一开始说的狭窄地形盾牌人阵什么都不干通关了，
要么就开阔地形给你一票残废骑兵队怎么轰都轰不走。这又不是战争游戏，利用机动性杀敌或者打击敌人士气让对方溃散。
是的，即便警察开枪暴民方人数也几乎不会减少，也不会溃散反而会暴怒跟你打。

玩警察，有个圆形地图里四面八方都是暴民，警察这边来了6队骑兵是什么鬼？防爆盾人阵呢？！
6队骑兵好容易把人群压到圈外，人群一个冲锋白压了，而且暴民的时间是累计计算然而警察方并不累计计算。
所以辛苦赶了半天一个见缝插针计时器清零白忙活。非常的无语。

其次是操作
操作方面很捉急，不能拖动一个框整体指挥，只能一队一队，要么点右上角的队伍图标，要么在地图里点人
然而地图里糊成一片一堆人，也没有小队提示除非你鼠标在警队头上才会给你高亮一下身体，
所以地图上点队伍基本不怎么实用，完全是靠右上角图标来操作，如果各队武器装备不一样的话就很麻烦，
因为你也不知道特定的哪个武器那队人究竟在哪里。
而且图标根本看不出来队伍之间的区别，还得记得住1队是啥装备，2队是啥装备。
感觉这块还是需要参考一下常见的RTS游戏来做。本作简略过分成简陋了

最后汉化
汉化不全，ui汉化了，但是每场之后还有个报纸部分，完全英语没汉化。

总评：创意不错深度不足，导致游戏华而不实，非常无趣。

author: {'steamid': '76561197984019045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1574653341}
review:
The good. The concept is neat. 

That's about it.

Sound is okay. Nothing impressive, nothing terrible. Music and effects are nothing memorable, but they aren't terrible.

The bad. There is no tutorial, so with almost an hour into the game, I had no clue what I was doing. I tried one of the campaigns for both rioters and cops. On the basic difficulty, the crux of the gameplay appears to be tabbing through your teams of units, and spamming right click. I've two achievements, and that's literally how I got them in about an hour. Tab, spam right click, repeat.

There are options, and abilities, but I never saw the need to learn or dig into them as the game never offered me a reason to do so dynamically. On higher difficulties, all of these techniques, and abilities probably serve a purpose, but the game really wasn't engaging enough for me to give that a chance.

Graphics... I like pixel art, I like it a lot, but at least on 4k resolution, the graphics looked really bad. Even the text instructions, and game menus look bad.

The game has a solid concept, but the gameplay itself isn't engaging or rewarding, and the game could definitely use an actual live tutorial. Hitting escape, to read the limited "instructions" is not a great way to introduce gameplay mechanics.

review: Boring and confusing. The game throws you in with very little tips or tutorial. The gameplay is bad and your units kinda just do whatever they feel like. The scoring system and "winning" are also confusing. The fact that there are such precise details in such a low resolution game also does it zero favors. Half of the time you can't tell what is even happening. This is one of those games where I would not recommend even putting in the time to fully get the hang of it, as the game itself is nothing special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083703524', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1647, 'last_played': 1568577065}
review: Erken erişim ile oyunculara sunulduğu günlerden itibaren takip ettiğim bir oyundu Riot: Civil Unrest, piksel grafiklerine rağmen aksiyonu bol ve ses efektleri de güzel bir oyun diyebilirim. Geçmişte yaşanmış büyük gösterileri, protestoları, ayaklanmaları vs. konu alıyor. İsterseniz polis tarafı olarak, isterseniz de halk tarafı olarak oynayabiliyorsunuz oyunu. Fazla şiddet uygularsanız kaybedersiniz, fazla yumuşak olursanız yine kaybedersiniz, hangi tarafı oynuyorsanız oynayın orta noktayı bulmanız gerekiyor günün kazananı olabilmek için. Ben oyunu hem polis tarafı, hem halk tarafı olarak ikişer kez bitirdim, birkaç görevde zorlanmam haricinde de fazlasıyla keyif aldım oynarken. Eğlenceli bir oyun, tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039827211', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1569375635}
review:
[quote=]
[h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36376191]点击这里关注我的鉴赏家 ▲

老K的游戏购买指南▼[/url][/h1]
这是款暴动题材的即时战略游戏。

游戏有单机剧情过关和自定义模式，同时也支持玩家本地多人或在网上寻找其他玩家。游戏自带33个场景可供解锁后选择，所有场景均来自于真实暴动事件。

玩家在游戏里可以选择扮演警察或示威者两大阵营，双方在争取目的的同时也要注意“舆论”的平衡，失去舆论支持后对方会准备更强力装备或更多的人手。所以玩家无论身在哪个阵营，都要结合单位技能来运用战术，尽可能非暴力的完成任务目标，但随着关卡情况越发复杂和时间要求的越发紧迫，这绝非易事。

游戏中单位类型比较少，几局过后就略显枯燥。虽然是即时战略模式但简陋的UI和快捷键的缺失也让操作变得很别扭。
 [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198235240620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1670054195}
review:
악법도 법이다.
우리는 치안을 어지럽히는 이들을 저지할 뿐이다.
우리가 맞았고 저들이 틀렸다.
저들은 모두 이성을 잃었다.

나는 알고 있다.
악법은 이미 법의 효능을 잃었노라고
치안이라는 이유는 그저 변명이라고
우리가 틀렸고 저들이 진실된 정의라고
저들의 고통을 헤아리지 못한다고.

하지만 이렇게라도 해야 한다.
저들에게 진압봉을 휘두르기 위해선,
저들을 돕고 싶은 마음을 억누르기 위해선,
울부짖는 저들을 제압하기 위해선.

눈과 귀를 막은채 휘두르는
투박한 진압봉이 내 손을 얼얼하게 만들 무렵.
날카롭고 찢어지는 듯한 소리가 애써 막은 귀를 뚫어버린다.

이제 되돌릴 수 없다.
어떻게 될지는 모두가 알고 있다.
저들도 그리고 우리도.

하지만 그 누구도 멈추지 않는다.
우리는 명령으로 움직이고
저들은 한으로 움직인다.

저들은 모두 죽고
우리는 평생 죽어가겠지.
내가 오늘 밤을 버틸 수 있을까.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991494627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1562758156}
review:
TLTR
Terrible controls, path finding and your units can easy stuck forever. Controls are even worst than in first MGS. If this problems would be fixed this game would be great, now it's terrible. So close yet so far.

This game have great idea and it would be quite fun to play.

BUT

It's terrible. Why is it terrible? Because of nearly everything. I don't have problem with fact that your units response like in real live, by that i mean they don't do action as accurate as in starcraft, they just do their action near cursor. It is okay.

But what about problems?
First controls suck. You can't hot key units. All you can do about this is switching from top to down unit list with TAB. Their actions like charge, testudo, etc are binded to numbers. Another problem with bindings are vehicles. They have movement binded also to numbers, so when you do primary action of infantry and accidentally select vehicle by switching with TAB, your water cannon ram into crowd (sadly they won't die). You have even binded formations but not individual units.

Another disgusting thing is main menu that's look like ported from android. Scrolling mouse wheel activates item on list instead of scrolling list.

Before each mission you can select gear to your units, but default gear is always recently unlocked not that you used last mission. Gear do not have any visible stats or something so you can pick what looks like cooler.

AI is also problem, and I don't mean your opponent, I mean your troops. They like to walk into wall, and they can't find path to target. Horizontal and vertical obstructions are most dangerous stuff here. Police forces have about 15% chances to forever stuck when you order them to arrest, that leads to lost control of that unit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004503655', 'num_games_owned': 1371, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1561500569}
review:
Плюсы:
- Интересная идея
- Визуальный стиль (хотя возможно кого-то оттолкнет, градус пикселизации тут зашкаливает)
- Ретроспектива исторических событий

Минусы:
- Неинтересный игровой процесс

Возможно список плюсов/минусов имеет еще много пунктов, но на этом мое знакомство с игрой закончилось. 
Собственно, из-за неинтересного геймплея и была дропнута игра.

Заценил игру только за протестующих, там это всего лишь закликивание несколькими группами с целью оттеснить полицейских. Раунд длится сильно долго, за время которого мало что происходит.

Возможно на высоких уровнях сложности открывается невиданный хардкор, но заценивать его не было желания.

review:
Gioco Italiano, su una tematica difficilissima cioè quella dell'ordine pubblico, sopratutto in Italia.
Penso che  il gioco sia molto avvincente e si possa ben capire anche tramite animazioni quasi reali, quello che significa stare in mezzo a una piazza.
L'unica pecca che gli possiamo trovare è la difficoltà alcune volte di capire come vengono assegnati i punti finali degli scenari, sopratutto quelli dell'opinione Pubblica.
Per il resto gioco approvatissimo, credo sia stato uno dei migliori titoli degli ultimi anni. 
Bravi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150706857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1625514941}
review:
If you like riots, tear gas and molotov cocktails then you've found your game. The game is basically about riots and protests that actually happened in real life. You can either play as the protesters or as the cops. The best part about the game is that if you use unnecessary force on the opponent (such as constantly beating people up as the police) then even if you beat the opponents you won't win. Although, you can provoke your opponent and when they get aggressive then you can hit them harder.

In the game you can use molotov cocktails, social media, tear gas, riot formations and even live rounds. The game isn't just about beating your opponent. It's also about having a good reputation after beating your opponent which is the important part. The game is good, but it ain't much. You will probably get bored after a week or two but it's worth the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136617719', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1584190070}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035647757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1535586425}
review:
It's alright. In terms of graphics, the pixel art, animations, music, detail... the whole presentation is fantastic. However I'd say the game lacks a lot in the terms of features or gameplay variety. As you go through story mode you unlock new items and abilities but the game doesn't change much as the opposition just gets more aggressive. In the end, the game just boils down to a loop of "smush my mob of pixel into people there mob. Oh no my people are moving back! I shall use an ability or click a thing onto the battlefield and maybe I'll move my mob of pixels forward." 

I haven't played in a while and I know they've added a "global mode" and bonus scenarios so I can't comment on those but I don't assume much difference.

My verdict: Worth a pick-up for pretty pixel art, bare-bones RTS, and some digital chaos... if on a pretty healthy sale. Otherwise? Not worth $16.99. There are plenty of pretty pixel art games out there.

review: Değişik bir oyun yapısı olan RİOT. Civil Unrest  adından  anlaşılacak üzere sizi isyan,ayaklanma,Vs. gibi ortamlara götürüyor Güzel yanı ise bunun sizi gezi olaylarından Arap Baharına kadar Tarihi isyanları oynanama imkanında sunuyor. author: {'steamid': '76561197993715237', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1555967424}
review:
Je n'y ai pas encore joué beaucoup mais je perçois déjà des points extrêmement positifs ainsi que d'autres qui le sont beaucoup moins et je m'en explique !

Bon graphiquement en tant que Pixel Art, c'est un choix de style et je trouve cela très bien foutu ! Il y a une sorte de mix en du vrai pixel art fait à la mains et des image digitales mais peu importe l'ensemble colle bien !

Coté gameplay je trouve que l'intention est vraiment bonne, il y a des mécaniques intéressantes mais je trouve que les formations des forces de l'ordre sont trop rigides on, dirait (et c'est sans doute un parti pris) que les affrontements doivent se faire "en dentelles" ou presque, il y a une sorte d'horizontalité dans les mouvements des troupes. Impossible de flanquer la foule devant et sur les cotés tout se passe de face. C'était ici ma plus grosse critique car pour le reste ce jeu est dans l'air du temps  et offre pas mal d'options stratégiques et ce à plusieurs niveau puisqu'en plus du résultat sur le terrain le résultat politique sera prépondérant ! Si vous pouvez l'avoir en solde à 10 euros ou moins et que vous aimé la tactique ce jeu pourrait fortement vous plaire à condition d'aimer le pixel art ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198044788417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1549992236}
review:
I must say that it's a fun game, and developers have definitely deserved the praise and support. Taking dead horse project off previous team and making it into descent game is a big achievement.

Yes, game is buggy at a time, and controls game logic may look somewhat strange and irrational at times. But so do riots. This game is not a clean crowd tactics game with balance and gameplay. But rather mix with simulation and attempt to somewhat recreate original events.

I really recommend to go though dev blogs and original events chronicles. It explains a lot what's going on in the screen.

Also game has full editor and workshop support available. May be not the 10/10, but solid average title I'm not regretting time I've spent with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252806204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1650898065}
review:
デモ隊と警官隊の衝突をストレートに描いた作品。
実際の事件がモチーフになっています。
ピクセルアートの繊細さや緊迫した雰囲気づくりの演出が上手く、
ドット絵や戦略ゲームや風刺ネタが好きな方ならおすすめ。

このゲーム、評価は賛否両論のようですが、その理由として
チュートリアルがないのでいきなり本番に投げ出されてしまい
大味なゲームのような印象をうけてしまうという点があるようです。
おせっかいかもしれませんがここに大まかなプレイ概要を書いておきます。
ストーリー攻略の参考にしてください。

１：勝利条件

「闘争ポイント」と「政治ポイント」があり、その二つを足してポイントの多かった勢力が勝ち。

「闘争ポイント」は、マップごとに設定された目標を満たすことで加算されます。
たとえば、広場の占拠が目標なら時間切れの時点で広場に陣取っていた勢力に多く加算され、
破壊活動が目標なら対象物を破壊すること、または対象物を守ることで多く加算されます。

「政治ポイント」は、暴力的な行動をとればとるほど減算されます。
相手側に負傷者や死人をだすと大幅に減らされます。
装備が貧弱なデモ隊側よりも、武装の優秀な警察側のほうが気にしなければならないポイントです。
言い換えると、デモ隊側が装備に劣る分、警察側の暴力を誘って政治的に勝利をおさめる、という戦略も重要です。


２：デモ隊側のプレイ

複数のチームがあり、個別に指示をだす必要があります。
指示を出すチームを切り替えるときはチームを直接クリックするだけでOK。
画面左のアイコンをクリックして切り替えることもできます。
選択中のチームには右クリックで移動指示を出せます。

左上隅の大きなアイコンを長押しすると、選択チームを「平和主義モード」か「実力行使モード」に切り替えることができます。

「平和主義モード」では、チームのモラル（アイコン右にある緑のゲージ）を保つ「シュプレヒコール」、
平和的な抵抗行動である「バンザイ」、「座り込み」、
SNSや爆竹といった平和的抗議アイテムを使用できます。
このモードの利点として、モラルが保ちやすいこと、バンザイや座り込みによる強力な占拠効果が挙げられます。
防衛が目標のマップならこちらをメインに使いましょう。

「実力行使モード」では、警官隊に対し牽制効果のある「投石」、
警官隊の進行を妨げる「バリケード」の設置、
火炎瓶や手製爆弾のような過激的抗議アイテムを使用できます。
警官隊のバリケードを突破したり、破壊活動を行うにはこのモードを選択することになります。
欠点として、モラルが保ちづらく、
警察側ほどではないにせよ殺傷沙汰になりやすいことが挙げられます。
デモ隊側は装備が劣る分闘争ポイントを獲得しづらいので、
政治ポイントでも負けることは避けなければなりません。
群衆誘導や破壊が目標のマップならこちらをメインに使いましょう。


３：警察側のプレイ

複数のチームがあり、個別に指示をだす必要があるという点はデモ隊と共通です。
平和主義モードと実力行使モードの切り替えも共通です。

警察側の特徴として、
「戦術ユニット」、「強襲ユニット」、「射撃ユニット」の３つの固有ユニットがあります。

「戦術ユニット」は大きな盾を構えた防御型で、
通路封鎖に大きな力を発揮します。
一方で群衆を押し込む力は並みで、機動力も低いです。

「強襲ユニット」は小さい盾と警棒を持った攻撃型で、
群衆を押し込む力が強く、機動力も高いです。
戦術ユニットの前進を助けてあげましょう。

「射撃ユニット」は銃器を所持した支援型で、
群衆を押し込む力はありませんが、
遠距離から強力な支援射撃を行えます。


また、各部隊には「アロー隊形」、「ライン隊形」、「防御隊形」、「散開隊形」と、
それぞれ隊形を組ませることができます。

アロー隊形は文字通り△の形になり、
群衆を突破する力が強くなります。

ライン隊形は一直線に隊形をのばし、
群衆を通さないようにします。

防御隊形は隊形を密集させ、
デモ隊の突進からの守りを固めます。

散開隊形は隊を分散させ、
投てき攻撃に対して防御力を高めます。

たとえば、群衆を特定の場から退去させたいときは、
戦術ユニットと強襲ユニットにライン隊形を組ませて前進させると効果的です。
目標に合わせて隊形を選びましょう。


警察側のほうが武装が優秀な分、実力行使モードを使うと
あっという間に流血地獄になります。
できるかぎり平和主義モードを使わなければなりません。


４：どっちを選んだらいいか？

多少の血を流してでも政治的勝利をねらうデモ隊側と、
犠牲を最小限におさえつつ効率的な勝利をねらう警察側と、
同じマップでも選ぶ側によって１８０度印象が変わります。
（一部修羅場すぎて変わらないマップもありますが…）

ある程度大雑把なプレイでも許容されるデモ隊側のほうが難易度が低いと思います。
初めて遊ぶ人はまずはデモ隊側で遊んでみましょう。
逆に警察側はパズル的な要素が強くなります。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019283303', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1553523316}
review:
RIOT:Civil Unrest takes momentous global conflicts and reduces them to a simplistic pixelated tug-of-war, lobbing in a few Molotov cocktails for dramatic effect.

The game places you amidst the haze of tear gas and glare of searchlights as you rally an undisciplined mob towards some ill-defined ideological goal, or adversely, to don riot gear and dive in on the side of police as you subdue the angry, unwashed masses, trusty wooden baton at the ready. Using actual historical uprisings as a backdrop, RIOT attempts to simulate full-on social pandemonium on a miniature scale. But the inelegant interface, unresponsive controls, overbearing visual clutter, limited feedback, terrible instructions, and constricted maps may leave you feeling like you’re playing with your hands zip-tied behind your back.

Typical play attempts to be RTS-like, but without the strong sense of control, tactics, logic, strategy or balance that is usually seen in that genre, making the results feel more like a riot-themed sandbox. There are several campaigns you can choose from, and after you select which side you'll be playing, you can define the loadout for your hapless lemmings, being careful not to overpower them, because the more gear you outfit your teams with, the stronger the response will be from the other side, and the more precarious public opinion will be. Once the level launches, you're presented with a timer at the top of the screen instructing you to complete a given goal within the stated limit, such as to hold a position, destroy static targets, protect an area, or disperse your opponent.

I absolutely adore pixel art, but using it for a RTS like this results in the player battling clutter more than battling their opponent. I think in a lot of ways, the fantastic art of RIOT is a roadblock to its playability, since it simply becomes just too visually noisy too quickly. In other such games, avatars usually represent groups of individuals. This makes them representative graphics that are easier to track and manage on a crowded battlefield. RIOT, by contrast, takes a literal approach, and every single blocky character sprite represents a single individual, and in a game that can have hundreds in a mob, the screen becomes blindingly dense very quickly. The limited size of the topographically-flatlined maps doesn't help either, as it forces all of the units into a crowded space, where they're constantly overlapping and getting lost in the melee. In order to really follow the actions of the parties you control, you have to either squint, or zoom in; but owing to the (otherwise lovely) pixel art, zooming in on the scene renders it even more abstract, and at that point it's just RGB soup.

Chaos, as an aesthetic theme, does not make for a very playable game. Half the time I couldn't tell if the orders I issued were being followed or not. Most of the commands require that you click somewhere to tell the agents where to execute their action. But since the game screen is such a crowded mess of pixel-vomit, with dozens upon dozens of sprites flickering on top of each other, it's unnecessarily difficult to even find a spot to click without inadvertently mousing over something else. I did eventually switch to the (limited) keyboard shortcuts and had better luck issuing commands. Even so, pathfinding was spotty, and more than once characters got stuck off screen among the giant black borders that tend to flank each level. At the best of times, RIOT felt like the video game equivalent of herding cats.

It doesn't help that there is an overall lack of player feedback throughout the game. A lot of the factors that affect how parties move and execute actions, such as morale, courage, cool-downs, and even where each member is when a group is scattered, are just too hard to read or access among the visual din that the game devolves into. The resulting mess leaves the player more often than not having to guess as to what works, what doesn't, and why.

Eventually you do get a feeling for the mechanics of the game, and develop a bit of a rhythm, but at that point it starts to become apparent just how shallow and simplistic the system really is. Once you figure out a winning tactic for a level, watching the results unfold is surprisingly dull. A lot of encounters reach a tipping point, after which the struggle becomes suspenselessly one-sided. When this happens, there's nothing to do but just sit there and wait for the timer to reach its inevitable conclusion so you can move on. There are almost no surprises, little tension, and a non-existent emotional pay-off for success or defeat. At times, RIOT feels more like a puzzle game where there is only a single answer. That approach makes each match feel like a disappointment, even when you do win.

Maybe I'm just a nihilist, but based on the premise, I was hoping for a strategy game that really sunk its teeth into dangerous ideas, but instead, RIOT just sort of gnaws at its theme with a weak whimper. The developers have made a very simplistic and tepid portrayal of what is otherwise a very complex subject. I don't fault them for this, but in being so even-handed, it completely neutralizes any tension, because there's no meaning behind the actions; the stakes are there in principle, but the gameplay is just too abstracted to carry any weight. There is no personality beyond the animations to indicate that there's any sense of passion about what the game is presenting. And given the subject matter, the game is far less controversial than its title would have you believe.

As I've already hinted at, the artwork is fantastic. Barring how cluttered the sprites can get, the actual designs for the characters and gear are wonderful. The set pieces, despite not being wide enough, are nice and balance functionality with stylistic interpretation. The sound and music perfectly suit the mood and enthusiastically bring the game to life. The star, though, are the animations: each time you begin a new level, you are treated to beautifully animated cut-scenes that set the stage for the challenge ahead. These are gorgeously crafted and give RIOT a high degree of polish, and are one of the main motivations for continuing to play.

Audio-visual indulgences aside, RIOT is also a treat for your creativity. Where it falters in play, it makes up for in customization. Perhaps the single feature saving RIOT from total obscurity is its surprisingly fully-featured level editor. The editor lets you make your own maps, goals, obstacles, load-outs, victory conditions, and can be shared with others to experience. When creating a level, you can base it off an actual world event, and the devs have thoughtfully added slots for Wikipedia links to give players more factual information behind the event being simulated. This is very noble and ensures that there will never be a shortage of new levels, as there is never a shortage of global conflict.

If you're looking for a unique and well-thought-out strategy game, keep moving; but if the idea of a riot sandbox catches your fancy, you might find more hours of joy crafting your own levels and watching the results than you do playing the actual game (phenomenal animations aside). It's very clear that the developers have talent, and I do believe they've hit on a great idea, so hopefully future endeavors can build on the successful elements here. As for me, my rioting days are at an end; putting away the pepper spray, hanging the gas mask back in the closet, all I’m left with is this battle-scarred white flag, which now I humbly raise.

review:
Foule sous tir létal - Alain Souchon

C’est bête, un joueur de jeu vidéo. On lui montre deux équipes face à face, et tout de suite il veut qu’il y ait un gagnant. Prenez ce quidam qui lance Riot : Civil Unrest comme un STR “émeutier VS forces de l’ordre”. Il se dit qu’il va réussir à tenir tête aux policiers avec des slogans. Le pouvoir des fleurs, jasmin, lila. Il spamme son mégaphone pour préserver l’unité de la foule. Manque de pot, il se fait éjecter de sa ZAD en express à grand coups de matraques et de lacrymo. Au bout du 3ème essai, déjà la voix de Laurent Voulzy n’est plus qu’un lointain écho. Il ne s’équipe que de cocktails molotov et de cailloux, et parvient enfin à tenir les perdreaux en respect.

Critique subjective sur La Gazette du Game

author: {'steamid': '76561198101578497', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1551918808}
review:
感谢SteamCN短评活动赠与的游戏副本。
详细评测可以看：https://steamcn.com/t470396-1-1

《RIOT》是个什么样的游戏呢？
简单来说它是一个暴乱模拟器，在国内可能会叫“群体性事件”。而且它不是一个简单的暴乱模拟器，它是基于最近这些年影响西方社会的那些暴乱事件来开发的。游戏有4种模式，全球模式是按照时间跟地点的流程一个一个的过发生在全球的暴乱事件；故事模式主要是游玩4个主要关卡，分别是意大利、希腊、西班牙、埃及。（后面我会详细讲他们的暴乱事件）对战模式目前只支持本地对战，一方扮演警察一方扮演暴徒进行对抗；自定义模式里面有好几种不同的模式，自定义暴徒跟警方的难度还有一个我最喜欢的模式，就是旁观者模式，把一切设定好之后就像上帝一样静静的看着事件的发生跟进展，非常适合我这种修仙玩家。

全球模式：
游戏关卡逐次解锁，难度也依次递增，每个事件都有自己的故事背景或者是发生在一次大事件中的不同侧面，每个关卡你可以选择扮演暴徒或者扮演警方来游戏，你可以看到同一个事件，不同势力之间面对跟思考问题的不同，而且每个关卡的开头都有一个非常用心的过场动画，再配合一些实录的声音，非常有代入感，我觉得这种古早的像素风能做出这么有感觉的过场动画确实不容易，而且没关都不一样。

故事模式：
故事模式主要是4个大事件，玩法其实跟全球差不多，不一样的地方是游戏里的道具啊、警方的装备跟人员有所不同，暴徒的道具跟技能有少许差异。这里我也给大家简单介绍一下。这4个国家发生的事件，由于涉及到地缘政治以及语言不通等诸多原因，我也不能讲的太细，容易跪，只是简单描述一下，所有内容来自网络，不代表个人意见。

意大利 NO TAV 运动
TAV 即意大利语里面对高速铁路的首字母缩写，NO TAV 含义很明确，就是抵制高速铁路。意大利国内一直以来有一部分居民是抵制修建各种高速铁路的，他们认为高速铁路不仅毫无意义而且浪费钱，更会在环境、社会和经济上对区域及其居民造成伤害，工程会破坏大片乡间区域，彻底改变村庄的样貌并造成地方企业倒闭。意大利国内爆发过几场相对比较大的 NO TAV 暴乱，比如2012年2月25日，意大利境内多地爆发 NO TAV 游行，反对修建法国里昂到意大利都灵之间的高铁线路，导致该项目多次延期至今。该运动还有自己的官网，有兴趣又懂意大利语的朋友可以前往参观。http://www.notav.eu/

希腊 Keratea 之战
Keratea 是希腊的一个安静祥的小镇，位于雅典东南部。2010年（具体时间真不清楚）左右，这个小镇被政府选中用于建造垃圾填埋场。这个小镇历史悠久，并且位于地震断层上，所以不是特别合适用于建这个，而且这个小镇的大部分居民是跟随土耳其军队并在希腊定居的阿尔巴尼亚战士的后裔，懂点希腊历史的都知道这个是什么含义。总之，2010年12月10日，防暴警察跟推土机准备强行进入该地区，结果遭到了当地居民的暴力抵抗，在长达120天的时间内，多次冲突并且有人员伤亡，同时政府封锁了消息，导致希腊境内对此事了解的人并不多，2011年4月8日至10日，Keratea 当地居民组织了大规模罢工以及游行抗议。

西班牙15-M运动（又称愤怒者运动）
15M运动源于2011年5月15日之后，遍及西班牙50多个城市、200多个协会参与其中的大型社会运动。主要目的是希望西班牙政府多方面的彻底改变，拒绝失业、削减腐败并要求政府履行居民的基本权利，比如住房、工作、政治参与、文化、公共卫生和优质教育等。在整个2011年，有200多次露营旅行和600多次集会，并且引发了随后的多项大型社会运动、示威以及游行。导致西班牙国内多年来已经出现了1000多个集体进行针对政府社会多方面问题的斗争。

埃及1·25革命
2011年埃及革命又称“1·25”革命，指从2011年1月25日开始由埃及民众爆发所进行的一系列街头示威、游行、集会、罢工等抗议活动向政府表达不满。由于当日正值埃及法定警察假日，所以一个名为4月6日青年运动的组织选定该日作为示威活动开始的日子。抗议示威活动在开罗和亚历山大最为激烈，在埃及的其他城市也有明显的抗议示威活动。超过一百万人参与了此次抗议，他们要求埃及总统穆巴拉克下台。此次大规模示威成为了自1977年埃及发生“面包暴动”以来近30年内发生的规模最大的民主化的示威运动。

对战模式：
作为一个独居的宅男，只有一只猫可以参与对战，但我看了一眼我的猫，它好像兴趣不大。

游戏内容：
基本包含两种游戏玩法
扮演暴乱中的警察：
1、招募疏散交通的交警
2、指挥突击、逮捕、策略、荷弹以及普通警察
3、召唤警车、水枪、防爆盾等等
4、选择使用烟雾弹、网弹、塑料弹、电机枪甚至是实弹

扮演暴民：
1、指挥领导者、暴徒（武装和非武装）、鼓动者和记者
2、煽动愤怒，使群众采取积极行动或通过战术让人群突进和撤退来应对局势
3、使用鸡尾酒，烟花，纸炸弹，岩石，街道设施和媒体的力量来攻击警察

无论你扮演哪种角色，都有任务目标，比如闯入建筑工地、驱散示威游行等。所有的行动都受到社会舆论的监管。当示威者没有使用武力，而警方使用了武力就会令舆论倾向于示威者，反之亦然，舆论将影响下一场暴动对方的实力。

每一关不同的暴乱，都有不同的场景、背景、警察的外观、游行群众的外观都有些许不同，每个npc都有自己的独立逻辑，所以他们在每场暴乱中都有各种不同的反应。游戏的场景是3D建模的，虽然看上去是2D的，游戏对每个角色都进行了物理建模，所以大群npc在一起的时候会有物理碰撞反馈，这让人群看起来更加真实，这让玩家可以设计出各种不同的玩法策略。

另外游戏还带有一个游戏内编辑器，开发者是希望玩家自己设计暴乱然后上传给别的玩家进行打分。需要在workshop里订阅别人的地图就可以玩了，不过我只浏览了一下，没尝试。

游戏的加分项
1、古早的像素画风，非常优秀的像素过场动画跟代入感
2、游戏自带一个有趣的编辑器可以游玩别人创建的场景
3、游戏内有一个非常详尽的wiki可以看，光那个wiki我就看了20min
4、游戏的开发组很有良心的做了大约4种不同的游戏模式，顺序解锁全球模式，对战模式，故事模式，旁观者模式

再来谈缺点：
游戏，首先需要的就是有趣，能带来快乐。这款游戏通过模拟现实社会中的暴乱让玩家亲身体验到那种暴乱的群体性事件中是一种非常有趣的想法，不过让人遗憾的是其玩法并没有让人觉得那个过程很有趣，而且不同模式下的玩法几乎是重复的，只有数值跟场景上的差异，这太让人遗憾了，如果说能做出除了暴徒跟警察之外的别的视角跟玩法，比如政府高层，比如普通民众等等就更棒了。而且个人感觉开发组对于社会上的这种暴乱理解的还是太简单了点，想法是好的，但是没有找到一种好的游戏表达。
玩的过程度过初期的新鲜感之后，可玩性立马下降了，面对重复的对手，重复的玩法，已经很难再激起继续玩下去的动力，另外游戏还有一些令人难受的bug，比如把人群指挥到屏幕外之后你很难再把他们拉回来，以及一些指令在莫名其妙的时刻就失效了。

说点题外话：
玩了游戏之后我突发好奇，是什么样的人开发了这样一款游戏又是为了做这样一款游戏，于是我顺着游戏的官网摸了个瓜。

《RIOT》的开发者是谁？
开发组由一帮意大利老炮构成，制作人是一名意大利的老哥，老哥自己亲身经历了意大利的 NO TAV 运动，有感而发决定做这样一个游戏。最近老哥还把准备把游戏带上ns，自己在twitter上还发了一张此游戏在ns上运行的图

《RIOT》游戏开发的目的？
开发组希望通过开发这样一款游戏来帮助那些需要在现实中为了自由而于媒体和谎言斗争的朋友，同时告诉世界上的所有人这个世界到底在发生着什么。通过每个人的帮助，我们一定能斗争到底。（也是个愤青）

author: {'steamid': '76561197993475888', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1551547034}
review:
[h1]Introduction:[/h1]
RIOT: Civil Unrest is a tactical RTS about the local protests all around the globe. The players can play as the police force, or the rioters. The game consists of the multiple campaigns, loosely based on the real life events, each in a different country. Unfortunately, the developers decided not to get involved into the political discussion too deep, so in case of interest, players will have to search for the additional information by themselves.

[h1]The story:[/h1]
The story in each of the multiple short campaigns is represented via few lines of text. While the text itself isn’t really a big deal, the problem arises in the briefings, as there are basically no briefings whatsoever. Players are given short task, which, in most cases sounds like ‘protect the equipment/belongings’, or ‘push the opposing side off that square’ and that’s literally it. Why are we pushing these people away? Is it because they block the way for upcoming stuff, or because they are too annoying? What’ll happen if the police ruin rioters’ camp? What actually happens when we complete the campaign? Why aren’t we given bigger picture? Sure, in real life things aren’t always explained to lower ranked people, but after all, it’s a game! They are supposed to have some sort of a narrative!

Now, to game’s credit, it’s worth mentioning that each campaign features a fresh newspaper with a brief result of the skirmish, but even these articles don’t quite explain the situation properly, instead serving as some sort of aftermath stats panel. The global storyline, or what game tries to present us as a global story, is mostly explained through the short serie videos after yet another campaign was completed. It is unclear, though, why the developers didn’t use the experience of Hitman: Blood Money, where newspapers also served in better understanding of the plot.

However, there’s a reason why developers actually chose such approach: Game wants to remain neutral towards the all sides of the conflict, as you are able to play as both, the police and the rioters, so maybe I’m a bit too pushy.

[h1]The gameplay: [/h1]
The gameplay is actually quite entertaining and can drag players in rather quickly. You have to give credit to the developers for the original concept, as games with a full focus on riots aren’t seen often. I can only recall ‘Riot Police’ from 2004 and ‘RIOT – Civil Unrest’, as funny as it may seem.

Both sides of the conflict have different approaches to the battle and several ways of utilizing their strategy, be it full scale rebellion, or just peaceful protest. Before mission starts, players are free to choose the squads, their equipment (and a leader, if you are playing as rioters). Each squad and equipment piece has a set variety of bonuses, suitable for different situations, although most of the stats are never explained during the choice phase. After preparations are done, you’ll be given a short task and then start the actual mission. 

Most of the missions would require one of the sides pushing their opponents away from the territory, or destroying/defending the equipment in a set of time. Quite often you won’t be able to simply push the enemy away, so you’ll have to use squads' special abilities. Cops, for example, are low on numbers, but able to use powerful stun and smoke grenades, or even a truck with water cannon. Rebels, on the other hand, prefer quantity over quality and use this advantage to scare the police off.

While the game doesn’t appreciate the violent approach, you can still choose heavy equipment for the protestors, supply them with the molotovs and make it a full scale rebellion. Don’t be surprised to find out that the cops are arresting your members and overall act more confident, though. As if not enough, if you keep doing violent protests for multiple missions in a row, with time you’ll get significally shorter on people. So in the end, you’d either need to replay some missions, in order to gain more positive score, or enjoy having to play as dozen of rebels against a fully equipped police army.

It works in a similar way if you play as the police force, though: brutal arresting tactics and crippling the civilians would have a negative impact on the global mass media and, as a result, few matches later you’ll face an insane amount of well-equipped insurgents, thirsty for blood.

Last but not least, the game features some modding resources and the ability to play custom matches on all maps, where you can set own rules for each level separately, which really helps with replayability of the game. Another interesting feature is Multiplayer, although, unlike many other games, RIOT –Civil Unrest also offers some sort of multiplayer, where people play together at one PC, using several gamepads. In other words, multiplayer in this game is a really 'specific’ thing.

[h1]Sound and Graphics:[/h1]
The sound is of a decent kind, really. I totally enjoyed the main menu theme and overall audio quality. The problem arises on a different thing, though. And that thing is the visual quality of the game. Indeed, game is pixelized on purpose, but it’s not the actual gameplay graphics that looks confusing, but rather video briefings quality: Quite often game zooms certain events during the videos. It wouldn’t be a big deal if the quality was increased too, but instead you’ll keep watching at  a huge pile of messed up pixels, trying to understand what on the Earth is going on. 
(Link with few examples goes below: https://imgur.com/a/61vQc7e )

[i]A quick PRO’s and CON’s analysis:
[b]The PRO’s:[/b][list]
[*][b]Unique idea and concept of the game[/b]
[*][b]Diverse gameplay[/b]
Both sides use way too different approaches and yet, the game still feels quite balanced.
[*][b]The importance of a tactical aspect[/b]
Both sides have tons of the unique equipment suitable for utilizing different strategies.
[*][b]Wide variety of the gamemodes.[/b]
Apart from what was mentioned before, there’s also a journalist gamemode, where you are supposed to take the best shots from riots, and usual spectator mode, which may show you interesting approach to a mission you can hardly complete.
[*][b]The game concept is really thought provoking[/b]
That’s something personal, as I’m a huge police fan, but during the gameplay I’ve caught myself multiple times on thinking whether I represent the good, or the bad guys. I’m sure revolution lovers may feel the same.
[/list]

[b]…and the CON’s:[/b][list]
 [*][b]The graphics[/b]
Again, that mostly covers the visuals during the videos, as the developers could've made them in a higher resolution.
[*][b]Lack of storyline[/b]
Sure enough, authors didn’t feel like picking any sides, but in the end of the day it damages the game, as it’s quite unclear who succeded in each campaign. It's also unclear whether the riots had been suppressed, or rioters achieved in what they wanted, e.t.c...
[*][b]Inability to select multiple squads at same time[/b]
Now that’s really weird for an RTS game, but each squad should be clicked on separately. It's quite uncomfortable, to say the least.[/list][/i]

[h1]The Conclusion:[/h1]
So what is RIOT – Civil Unrest? Coming up from both, positive and negative points, it seems like more of a ‘YES’ than a ‘NO’ game. Sure, it’s not perfect, it has flaws and feels somewhat unpolished and slightly underdeveloped, but the original setting, wide variety of the equipment and overall unusual idea, manage to save the game from a failure. Can I recommend it? Perhaps, I can, especially to those people who enjoy playing as the police, because decent games about the cops are quite rare these days.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/23741321/]Follow our curator page,[b] Alexander's Club Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1551382989}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32296668-Casual-Game-Reviews/]More reviews on our Curator Page[/url]

Published by [i]Merge Games[/i], [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b] take players into a virtual simulation of several real world conflicts, where the population rose against the system. Being completely impartial, the opposite side is also playable, as we get a glimpse of the efforts by the police to protect themselves and the lives of the citizens. There’s no need to hide the reality, as sometimes things heat up away too much, and riots become violent, almost like arenas!

This game does not support one side in specific, instead, delivers an original and realistic perspective of both forces. Events available are inspired by real world conflicts; Italian NoTAV movement, the Spanish Anti-austerity movement Indignados, the Keratea regarding Landfill construction in Keratea, Athens, and finally the Egyptian revolution of 2011, in Tahrir Square. Each event is treated respectfully, maintaining 4 global campaigns, with 4 or 5 missions each.

After completing the Global campaign, new levels are unlocked, and others are bonus maps that have been added. Areas such as France, USA, Italy, and may others that are still in development, which, thanks to Steam Works, can easily be added later, as fan work or extra content.

Strategy elements are always to be absorbed with as much info as possible, and although this game may look simple, it actually delivers a large amount of content to manage. The very first thing everyone should do is to learn how to properly play [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b]. To my knowledge, it’s actually the first time I have ever seen a game with this type of in-depth when comes to riots, so it’s only natural one does not feel prepared from the start. That’s why there is a Wiki in the Main Menu. This section is all about “How to” understand and play the game, learning its strategic component regarding items, objects used by both rioters and the police force, weaponry, formations and positions.

In [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b], players can play with their preferredside, either as rioters or police force. Perhaps the most interesting thing is how one side will have an impact on the other, like they are connected through your unique experience. Being extra aggressive with one side, might exploit earlier reactions from the other side, if you decide to play the opposite campaign. This adds a large replayability, but it’s not the only factor that will make you go back and re-act some scenarios.

Through the campaign, new gear and knowledge will become unlocked, as well as specific characters that play a significant role during the events. Some rioters are more aggressive than others, which can lead things to one side only. Same goes for the police, with a setup available to choose from, players decide how to play, by controlling the crowd, or going full force with the water cannon. Items can then be used in already complete scenarios to improve their final result based on influential points.

Thanks to the progressive unlocks, it doesn’t make you feel overwhelmed with new items and confusing tactics, instead, implants one at a time, to make the whole experience comfortable. The difficulty setting is also a great introduction to tactics, ranging from Too Easy, Challenging to Lawless. The easier it is, the longer players have to react upon the action occurring, as for Advanced levels, it requires a high base knowledge of the events.

Throughout worldwide missions, players will have to adapt to each situation, and calculate what type of approach they want to take. Final results will influence the media and therefore the next scene will have an impact based on such influences. Objectives may vary, from guarding a position, destroying objects, or in case of the police, push back the riot, divide them, or guard specific objects, all with a time limit. Tactical plays out really well, mixing the aggressive side or the pacifist attitude, considering how tides are flowing. It’s impossible to expect the result considering how many elements are in the game.

The developers made sure to use real life tactics against either side, for objects such as firecrackers, homemade bombs, the social media interactions, the motivational speeches, the fear and intimidation, and of course real police force tactics are also on display. In terms of gameplay, [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b] does not lose any points for bein g 2D game.

Visually, the game loses nothing except for the cutscenes, that are extremely pixelated and, when up close, it’s hard to depict what’s going on. Fortunately, these last only a few seconds, and when the show begins, it’s beautiful to see the details on the pixel art all over the place. Levels are well designed with faithful elements of each location, either by the type of roads, or backgrounds portraying very unique ambience. Groups move well within the scenery, and their interactions are very well animated. Players can also zoom in and out of the action in specific moments, but from my personal experience, action up and close does not look nearly as good as the standard point of view.

Having the engine Unity behind, developers had to completely edit the crowd physics, to improve their realism and behavior, plus, the optimizations don’t just stop there. For a Unity game, [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b] it’s very well optimized, with graphical options varying from Simple, Good and Fantastic. The improvements over the years have been nothing but supreme, making it a very unique and enjoyable experience.

Global mode puts players through the original experience, but Story Mode lets you enjoy a specific chapter or scene randomly. Costume mode gives the extra opportunity of creating your own setting, and watch it all happening. Thanks to the crowd AI, events won’t likely repeat themselves. Included within the game, there’s an Editmode still in Beta phase, where you can customize your level design using the predefined assets. Local Online mode is also available, as well as Co-Op!

With a good presentation, [b]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/b] mixes simulation and strategy, as well as a fantastic yet, animated approach over real life events that changed things, and pushed humanity forward. Using this as inspiration, or just to spread chaos and havoc, that is up to you, either way, it’s a fantastic game that went through several layers of development to deliver its goal. A unique and primal 2D videogame that was on the news all over the world, and for a good reason. Feel the tension and behold dozens of confronts as they’ll make you respect and understand far more about both forces of the coin!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001507954', 'num_games_owned': 3199, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1552435104}
review:
[h1]RIOT: Civil Unrest[/h1]

RIOT features a fairly lo-fi pixel-art style at its core with simplistic but stylish and somewhat edgy character designs, but its created with such a fine detail to its urban backdrops and such massive scale to the destruction seen in each setting that it manages to be jaw-dropping and gorgeous in its overall presentation.

Aside from the well established and full-length political events you can play through in the main campaign, there's an excellent selection of single instance side-missions that offer a diverse representation of many of the more modern acts of civil disobedience including the Gilets Jaunes protests in France or the fallout currently in Venezuela. 

What I'd love to see added, and perhaps this is already being taken care of through the creatively customizable Steam Workshop tools, would be fictional yet realistic instances staging possible riot scenarios in our current political climate. Something like a modern day American civil war like so many conspirators have implied is coming would be an interesting premise to see played out in this mesmerizing and engaging simulation of strife and dissidence

RIOT gets extra points right off the bat just for tackling a subject that we don't often see in the gaming medium. Perhaps the risk is too great and most developers don't feel confident in their ability to fairly or accurately portray these political situations without bias, but its that exact sort of unapologetic bravery that stands out to me. The portrayal of these historic events is so perfect transcribed to the medium of gaming here, and all without interjecting with opinions or personal thought.

[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575550', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 625, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1551409803}
review:
https://youtu.be/Aw7zPKpFqZ0

Huge fan of the theme for this game. It captures protesting/rioting perfectly. Where you have no idea or control over what the crowd will do. Also how boring a protest can be. Occupying an area is boring in real life and requires a lot of waiting around and that's translated to Riot: Civil Unrest perfectly.

I do think the preparation screens are done pretty well. Also the idea that a protest isn't always about occupying the space but the politics around it. So you can lose the objective but still come out politically on top. Pretty smart!

The game is hurt by the confusion between global and story mode. IMO story mode is where I start in games but I wonder if it would have been much better to start with global. I don't normally condone locking content but in this instance forcing the player to start with global might have been a good idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050967938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1551046746}
review:
Premetto che ho affrontato solo le prime due missioni finora, dovessi cambiare idea modificherò il commento ma mi sento poco motivato a tornare sul gioco. 

È un gioco di "spingere"! Si controllano quattro gruppi di persone che devono spingere i poliziotti per non far distruggere gli accampamenti, oppure si controllano i poliziotti che devono spingere i manifestanti per sgombrare le tende. Chi spinge meglio vince!

Puoi usare degli item durante la missione per creare dei diversivi ma fondamentalmente l'impressione è di qualcosa che non si riesce mai a controllare per bene. La pixel art è splendida nelle cutscene ma incasinatissima durante il gameplay e controproducente in leggibilità.

La cosa più umiliante per il prodotto è che tutto il tema delle sommosse, delle manifestazioni, della protesta è stato banalizzato in una serie di 17 spingimenti con sfondi diversi.

Dico qualcosa che non avrei mai pensato di poter dire: Hooligans era più divertente e pensato meglio. in Riot c'è un'unica idea e non è divertente. Credo non ci sia bisogno di precisare che per divertente non intendo lo sganasciarsi dalle risate ma qualcosa di piacevole da ricavare nell'esperienza.

Tutto quanto poteva riguardare la parte etico-sociale-storica è stata condensata in poche righe di descrizione dell'evento. Il cuore strutturale del gioco mi sembra piccolo piccolo ed è stato riciclato a nastro. Senza il tam-tam che conosciamo non se lo sarebbe filato nessuno.

Sono molto molto deluso, capisco lo sviluppo travagliato ma così com'è non è un gioco consigliabile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313432047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1550882855}
review:
[h1]名单加急，不可言喻[/h1]
我是一个暴民，我也是一个警察，我在政治上下，我在蔚蓝的星球上左右着历史的动作，我曾经扮演着暴民去试试捍卫我们的帐篷营地，我也曾经扮演警察，用暴力和烟雾弹驱散为我们纳税的公民。暴动的话题过于沉重，游戏将它浓缩成了简单的阵地运动，但背后的黑色幽默绝不是那么简单，注意看一下，创意工坊，该玩的不该玩的都在那了，名单加急，数量有限，赶快来玩吧

+细致的像素风格
+高度细致的UI界面
+精心制作的故事CG
~作死边缘的创意工坊
-游戏节奏需要增强

(3.5/5)游戏素质和游戏噱头双双在线，不过战斗节奏和文字滚动速度需要加强

[h1]画面[/h1]

事实上并不是所有的像素游戏画面或者表现力都值得大书特书，只有在采用了像素，并且打出了自己一致性的，独特性的像素风格的时候才会较为亮眼。该作的像素风格需要夸奖的在于它的UI界面是其一，作为一个暴动游戏，在进入游戏界面的时候，挡眼的UI就是一份环球报告，并且浓厚的像素风味，各个阶段，各种按钮，小窗口以及菜单，都有着暴动的狂野风。此外本游戏居然还用像素点阵为各种大事件都进行准备了CG。无论你是什么文化，什么背景，看到到据知能大概理解，当年发生了什么，为什么要这样做，你的接下来你要干什么。最后就是制作组的认真态度，因为像素游戏很多通病，比如说在近景的时候，使用小颗粒像素表达人物，而在远景的时候使用大颗粒像素表达，这使得的无论远近都有种粗糙感。而在本作中，无论是人物还是场景，都使用的小颗粒像素，里面的游戏画面在远景看来时会成为壮观的像素山河图卷。

[h1]玩法[/h1]

游戏的玩法，总体来说是需要平衡或者提升。主要的玩法就是模拟一场暴动，玩家可以自由选择暴民或者警察，这是非常亮眼的一点。采用了暴民的话，就需要在规定时间内守住自己的根据地。可以使用一些技能进行防御，主要的防御手段基本方面还是，使用人群展开链接阵地，保护后方的营地，在展开连接之后，如果达到一定的程度，经过时间的进化可以使用静坐。非常拟真有趣，如果是警察的话，可以使用多种不同种类，的警察，有持盾有持械，通过暴力或者催泪弹等方式驱散人群，破坏对方的营地。有些还分为故事模式了寰球模式，故事模式，就是演绎各种各样的事件，寰球模式在演艺事件的基础上增加了暴民和警察的数值，数值的全局数量还会影响不同的结果，这就让要通过玩家自己决定。相信如果是作为一名有反骨的玩家，这款游戏真是再适合不过了。最后就是游戏提供创意工坊，不敢说太多，但是第一个就非常引人注目。

[h1]总评
游戏本身的里十分出色，不过游戏节奏和打法需要改进，操作上也要商榷。最近反乌托邦反政府类型的游戏异军突起，从我的战争到奥威尔，事实上都是在危险边缘大鹏展翅。这款游戏的创意工坊更是到达了无法无天的地步，如果是作为反骨玩家，可以悄咪咪的尝尝，不要张扬，不然下个月名单又要加急了(¦3[▓▓]
[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039801906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1551483939}
review:
[h1]Un bon petit jeu mais pas un "bon jeu"[/h1]

On aime ou pas, mais Riot est plutôt joli dans l'ensemble et plein de bonnes intentions et attentions aux détails, dans les cinématiques, les textes, etc. D'ailleurs, merci pour la traduction en français. Côté contenus, il semblerait (je n'ai pas fini le jeu) qu'il y ait de quoi faire, il y a même un éditeur de carte et on a déjà un petit malin ;) qui propose une map "gilets jaunes" à Paris. Le côté "webdocumentaire" du jeu est plutôt cool.

Pour autant, le jeu, qui coûte quand même 17 euros (j'ai participé au financement participatif), a trop de lacunes, quelques [b]limites fonctionnelles[/b] (ne pas accéder aux options en cours de partie par exemple, mais j'ai aussi eu la mauvaise surprise de cliquer sur "recommencer" une partie que j'avais gagnée pour me rendre compte que du coup ma victoire précédente n'était pas prise en compte...) et des bugs au niveau de l'IA. Cela se voit beaucoup côté "forces de l'ordre" où la gestion des unités est catastrophique. Cela se voit moins du côté émeutiers, où c'est la gestion de foule qui prime et qui fait son taf. Mais du coup, il aurait fallu peut-être se concentrer sur ce côté "gestion de manifestants". Parce que les forces de l'ordre font généralement n'importe quoi et pas ce qu'on leur demande de faire. D'ailleurs, même du côté émeutiers, c'est très léger côté possibilités de gameplay : avancer, reculer, balancer des pétards, appeler des potes... bon, on ne peut pas vraiment se servir du décor, je trouve que ce jeu devrait valoir 5 euros, c'est un petit jeu, mais pas "the" jeu de gestion d'émeutes qu'il aurait du être.

review:
2년동안 찜목록에서 남아있던 게임이 정식출시를 했다. 정식출시전에도 세일할때 사기가 꺼려졌었는데 정식출시후 한번 원가로 구매해보니 17500원이 하나도 아깝지 않을정도로 매우 많은 변화가 이루어졌다. 기존 평가들은 플레이 타임이 짧다, 프레임 드랍이 심하다, 등등 문제점이 많아보여 사기가 꺼려지지만 지금 실행시켜보면 플레이타임이 짧을수가 없는 매우 많은 미션들이 존재한다. 그리고 글로벌 모드와 스토리 모드의 각종 시위들을 클리어할때마다 시위대에게 유용한 아이템이나 유닛이 나오며, 경찰들은 각종 보호구, 유탄발사기, 곤봉같은것들이 언락되기 때문에 클리어하면 클리어 할수록 게임이 매우 재미있어진다. 모든 스토리가 실제 시위들의 기반으로 만들어졌고, 그렇기에 더욱 현실감이 넘친다. 그리고 제일 중요한 에디터. 이 에디터는 현재 내가 만드는 5.18광주를 가능하게 할수도있고, 전세계 어디든 그 시위들을 재현해낼수있다. 더욱 엄청난것은 아직 정식출시 후 버전이 1.0이라는것이다. 이게임은 이게 끝이 아니고 계속 업데이트가 이루어질 예정이며, 멀티플레이가 가능하다.

결론 : 시발 이게 게임이냐 존나 와 씨발 갓겜이야 미친 컨셉, 게임성, 난이도 와 씨발 깔게 없어 오ㅓㅓ우엄나ㅡㅁ

author: {'steamid': '76561198084382428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1550132990}
review:
Riot – Civil Unrest si arrischia nell’affrontare temi incredibilmente delicati. Lo fa sotto forma di uno strategico, ricco di tante idee originali, che riescono così a distinguerlo ulteriormente dai concorrenti presenti sul mercato. La presenza di una folla costituita di persone con una volontà autonoma e la differenziazione tra approccio pacifico e violento rappresentano i cardini di un gameplay che può sicuramente incuriosire gli amanti del genere, magari stanchi delle solite meccaniche di gioco. Qualche sbavatura di troppo in termini di realizzazione e una mancanza di varietà nelle situazioni impediscono tuttavia a Riot – Civil Unrest di fare il salto di qualità verso l’eccellenza.

Leggi la recensione completa su: http://www.marzianiconilpad.it/riot-civil-unrest-recensione/

author: {'steamid': '76561198185454561', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1572792919}
review:
Это один из лучших и самых правдоподобных симуляторов гражданского неповиновения из всех, которые я когда либо видела. И почти все моменты, показанные в игре так же происходили и со мной: и разгоны палаточных лагерей, и оттеснение полиции с Ленинградки, и разгоны дубинками мирных митингов, и шествия сквозь "космонавтов"

Я снова окунулась в эти беспокойные года.

Россия будет свободной.

review:
Complimenti agli sviluppatori che sono riusciti a confezionare un prodotto credibile su argomenti e tematiche che difficilmente hanno spazio nel mondo dei videogiochi. RIOT ha grandi potenzialità, materiale e spunti per arricchire le campagne e gli scenari di scontro di certo non mancheranno anche nei prossimi anni (peraltro, il recentissimo sgombero all'Asilo occupato di Torino fornisce un idea per una modalità "barricata sui tetti").

Mi gusta anche lo stile grafico adottato che dona al prodotto un anima distintiva.

Sicuramente un gioco che consiglio!

review:

review: It's a real shame. I was looking forward to this for a long time and figured it might've improved by now. The lag is practically gamebreaking on the few maps I played and the sound is a horrible assault on my ears and there's no in-game menu to turn down the volume at all. Refunding. Please don't buy this.
developer_response:
Hi WildGoose,

Sorry to hear you had problems with the game. 
Volume controls are in the options menu and can be adjusted for voice, music and SFX. 
If you are experiencing performance issues, please double-check your system specs against the minimum on the store page. If you don't meet the requirements, you might struggle to run the game with a decent framerate. 
If you do meet the specs, it may be that you need to run the game on a lower setting. 
Please try and reduce the quality in the unity launcher (opens before the game) and choose a lower setting. 
We hope that this helps in the event that you try the game again. 

Kind Regards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092669392', 'num_games_owned': 3585, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1549122322}
review:
[h1] Riot Civil Unrest – симулятор государственных непорядков [/h1]

Маленькая студия решила создать симулятор повстанцев, чтобы показать эти непорядки с двух сторон, со стороны полиции и со стороны повстанцев. Этой студией была IV Productions. Издала игру нам давно известная Merge Games. Выход игры в ранний доступ состоялся 6-ого декабря 2017-ого года, а полный релиз будет 4-ого февраля 2019-ого года.

[list]

[*] Как я и написал ранее, в Riot Civil Unrest можно принять две противоположные стороны конфликта – полицию и повстанцев. Сейчас поговорим о полиции. 

Главная цель полиции – разогнать народ. С выбора задания нам дают выбор отрядов полицейских, которые будут задействованы в операции. Обычно это 2 группы защитников, 2 группы нападающих и ещё 2 группы стрелков. Каждый из них должен выполнять свои действия и удерживать восстание. К тому же, можно выбрать гаджеты для ваших оперов, чтобы изобрести уникальную тактику и задавить негодующих. 

От вашего поведения будет и зависеть поведение протестующих. Если вы будете пассивно стоять, то люди по ту сторону баррикад начнут наглеть и избивать вас. Если же вы будете чрезмерно жестоки, то не ждите спокойного и доброго отношения от своих противников. На этом и завязана игра – вам нужно держать толпу людей в страхе и разогнать их в последствии. 

[*] Геймплей за повстанцев немного иной. Если полицейских обычно около двухсот человек, то вас может быть в десять раз больше. Наше главное оружие – наша численность и ею нужно пользоваться Нашей целью является захват точки, либо её удерживание. Если наших арестовывают, то не забывай о социальных сетях, в которых можно набрать себе ещё более грозную армию. Если же полиция оказалась намного более жестокой, тогда ступайте и атакуйте их в ответ. Коктейли Молотова, удары битами и остальное. 

[*] Чтобы вы не скучали, разработчики добавили несколько сценариев в Раннем доступе, а если быть точным, то 4(все они основаны на реальных событиях) и добавят ещё шесть после релиза, который состоится 4-ого февраля, включая знаменитые «жёлтые жилетки», которые случились буквально недавно. На всех картах разный баланс, поэтому нужно строить разные тактики для разных ситуаций.

Ещё есть поддержка пользовательских карт и редактор карт, что позволит вам получить больше геймплея и самим стать создателем карт. Там есть различные карты, включая нашумевший «Майдан» в Украине. 

Вердикт:[i] оригинальный проект, без аналогов. Это единственная игра в жанре стратегии и стилистике повстанцев, которую вы найдёте. Как минимум, известных и хороших аналогов ей нету, что радует. Конечно, мало контента, но режим «Весь Мир» разнообразит мир и затянет вас на ещё пару часов. [/i]

Оценка:[b] 8.8/10[/b]. Быть повстанцем ещё никогда не было так весело и безболезненно.

Обзор был составлен Ci8, эксклюзивно для[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bigbadwhl] BigBadWhale Games[/url],  в сотрудничестве с [url=http://welovebundles.ru/]WeLoveBundles[/url] 

Ключ к игре предоставил издатель, но это [u]никак не влияет[/u] на моё мнение и оценку.

Оценка редакции:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1276828227

author: {'steamid': '76561198111232468', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1660154376}
review:
1. Идея, сеттинг - подобных игр не было уже очень давно, создатели смогут довести RIOT до ума и как-то тренд появится в будущем. Тут без претензий.
2.  Катсцены - порой превращаются в дикий пикселяч (тут уж такой стиль, извините), но даже несмотря на это, очень недурно поставлены, плюс хоть какую-то вводную по конфликтам дают, задают настроение.
3. Звуки, музыка - в игре их не очень много, но то, уже что есть - без претензий.
4. Эффекты частиц (дым, вода), тени - очень хорошо.
 
БЕЗ ОЦЕНКИ : графика на любителя .

Оценка по 10 бальной шкале . 
8.5/10.

review:
소재의 참신함 빼고는 죄다 문제점 투성이라고 봐도 무방할 지경이다.

 첫째로 최적화. 온갖 오브젝트가 굴러다니는 전략게임 답게 사양을 많이 타는 게 당연하다지만 심해도 너무 심하다. 최신 그래픽카드나 외장 내장 같이 굴리는 게 아닌 이상 안정적인 프레임은 커녕 게임이 하다 도중에 강제로 꺼지기 일수다.

 둘째로 UI 및 조작감. 전략게임이랍시고 나왔는데 조작은 불편하기 짝이 없다. 스킬 및 아이템 사용은 1부터 4까지 숫자키에, 부대 대형 바꾸는 것은 화살표 방향키다. 키보드 저 반대편에 이렇게 단축키 설정을 해놓은 저의가 도대체 뭘까? 더군다나 부대 선택은 탭키로 차례대로 넘겨가면서 선택을 하거나, 마우스로 일일이 클릭을 해야 한다. 평화시위때야 템포가 느린 진형 싸움이니 상관없다지만, 화염병과 실탄이 날라다니는 폭력 시위때는 도저히 제대로 컨트롤을 할 수 없다. 컴퍼니 오브 히어로즈를 비롯한 다른 전략게임에서 부대 선택을 숫자키로 못 하고 탭키로 넘기기나 마우스로 직접 클릭만 가능하다고 생각을 해 보자. 어짜피 부대 수도 많아봐야 8부대인데, 그냥 숫자키로 부대를 선택하고 그 이외 스킬 및 포메이션은 키보드 좌측에 있는 키버튼들로 설정 해 놓았으면 안 됐나? 그리고 방어태세에서 공격태세로 바꾸는데 숫자 키 2번을 3초간 꾹 누르고 있어야 한다. 공격태세로 바꾼다는 건 폭력시위가 됐다는 건데, 그 급박한 상황에서 다른 부대는 컨트롤도 못 하고 방치한 상태에서 한 부대만 3초씩이나 붙잡고 있으라고? 게임을 한 번 해보기는 했나?

 셋째로 버그. 경찰측으로 게임을 하는데, 연막탄을 던지다 연막탄을 던지려던 인원이 연막탄을 못 던지더니 갑자기 좌우로 빠르게 회전을 하면서 행동 불능 상태가 된다. 그 뒤로 연막탄 사용이 불가능해진 건 덤이다. 그런데 어찌보면 이건 한 명만 행동 불능 상태가 돼서 다행이지, 체포 명령을 내렸는데, 그대로 부대원 전체가 굳어서 행동 불능 상태가 되는 수도 있다. 통상적으로 5~6부대, 많아봐야 7,8부대 쓰는 게임에서 부대 하나가 통째로 어이 없는 버그로 없어지는 셈이다.


 아직 얼리억세스라고는 해도, 출시된 지 1년이 지났는데도 이런 문제점이 해결이 안 되고 아직 남아있는데, 앞으로 해결이 될 지도 의문이다.


-------



정식 출시 이후에도 바뀐 게 없다. 차라리 얼리 억세스 땐 문제점이 있더라도 나중에 고쳐지겠지라는 생각으로 위안을 했는데, 정식출시 이후에도 이 모양 이 꼴이면 도대체 뭐라고 생각을 해야 할까? 인디겜은 평가 확실하게 좋은 게 아닌 이상 사지 말라는 말이 맞다는 것만 재차 확인만 하게 된다.

review:
It's a really nice concept with a somewhat poor execution. 

I played the game a year or two back, and I moderately enjoyed it. I revisited it this year, and I realised that it's awfully broken. 

Crowds are hard to control. That makes sense for the sake of realism, but what ends up happening is that I tell the crowd to sit in one spot and maintain position just to block the police. There's no point in turning violent, as the crowds are really bad at combat and the police becomes more aggressive.

Similarly for the police, you can just push the crowd out with the peaceful stance in almost every mission. There's almost no point in strategising or turning violent. On both sides you just push the other team to the corner of the map.

This game has a very limited enjoyment value in my opinion.

review:
Linux player (LXQt):
The game keeps crashing, Linux support is a lie. The controls are hard to het used to, 16:10 resolutions are impossible.

But i thing we should support this game for being such a refreshing piece of art, It deserves to become better. When stable it could become a real classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011863805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1688696979}
review:
I wouldn't recommend buying the game in it's current state. For some computers it seems to have an irreconcilable issue with locking you to an unplayable resolution by constantly resetting your resolution between loading screens; half of the text, buttons, playable area and other things are off-screen and unclickable making the game, by definition, literally unplayable.

No ammount of changing the resolution in or out of game seem to help the situation, as setting it outside of the game has no effect and setting it from within the game only works until you hit a loading screen, meaning absolutely no mode can be played without it defaulting to that resolution, making changing your resolution pointless.

This seems to happen to users at random and if it happens to them it never goes away, I wouldn't really reccommend taking the risk of your copy inexplicably being unplayable, wait until it's confirmed that this issue has been fixed.

EDIT: Getting close to a year later and the resolution bug making the game unplayable because of buttons leaving the window space is still present. Fix your shit, more people with this issue have had this problem crop up in the forums, maybe you should address those issues and make your game playable.
developer_response:
Hi EpicWin,

Sorry to hear you're having this issue. 
We've not encountered this behavior before and we're unable to reproduce it on our systems. 
If you could spare a minute to send your DxDiag info to support@mergegames.com, it would be really appreciated.
Once we have more information, we'll do our best to help resolve this. 

Kind Regards.

总体好评，期待未来的进一步完善。
非常看好的一款独立游戏。

--------------

简要概括一下玩法

起义人民

①到达示威地点，打开社交媒体开始呼喊正义的伙伴。
②举手投降，和平示威，原地静坐静待网友们汹涌而至。
③起义人民人数在四处赶来的网友增员下渐渐远多于警方，局势开始朝人民倾斜。
④拿起喇叭，指挥和平示威人群朝警察数量薄弱处发起冲锋，打乱警方阵型。
⑤安排一小队激进分子混杂在和平示威队伍中朝警方投掷鞭炮，石子，进行挑衅。

⑥一旦警方开始朝人群投掷催泪瓦斯，进行武力镇压，则立刻拍照上传社交媒体，呼叫记者，同时停止挑衅行为，让和平示威者们继续朝警方冲锋，直至出现大量和平示威者被打至流血骨折甚至牺牲，此时舆论制高点已抢占完毕。
⑦若局势进一步失控，邪恶警察开始暴力镇压，则此时勇敢的起义人民一切有关暴力的行动时皆会被舆论认定为还击，即：在政治评价中享受极大的惩罚减免，毕竟还击又有什么可过多指责的呢？
⑧掏出准备已久的纸制炸弹与莫洛托夫鸡尾酒，捡起地上的破铜烂铁大砖块，毫无保留的朝助纣为虐的邪恶警察们倾泻人民的怒火吧！

⑨若警方始终保持高度克制，展现出邪恶帮凶狡诈阴险的一面时，这种情况下为了达成正义的使命，必须在一定程度上放弃占领道德的制高点，并通过武力向世界传达人民群众正义的诉求决不可被忽视。
⑩以和平示威者为主体的大部队牵制警方，同时指挥群众中的一小部分激进分子包抄警察后方，修建临时路障，阻挡车辆前进的同时影响警察撤退整编的效率，同时大部队继续不断朝警察发起冲锋。逐渐放弃和平示威，开始主动升级事态，激进分子朝警察投掷臭鸡蛋，整串鞭炮，将助纣为虐者暂时逼退后立刻着手继续修建临时路障，步步为营并最终取得武力的胜利！



警察

①到达示威地点，立刻开始整编队形以完成国家给予的光荣使命。
②战术小队以古罗马龟甲阵维持阵线缓慢推进，突击小队则紧跟战术小队伺机而动，强击小队在突击小队后方待命。
③时刻牢记三大纪律八项注意，坚决执行对人民群众打不还手骂不还口的最高指令。
④对待别有用心煽动广大无辜人民群众的反动派领袖要绝不手软，这些领袖往往手持危险品，例如高分贝喇叭，酒精及土制炸弹等。一经发现，则以突击小队进行不伤及人群的战术冲锋以驱散无辜群众，同时命令强击小队冲刺并将嫌犯缉拿归案。
⑤在群众密集处谨慎使用催泪瓦斯等强力人群控制手段——即使由于催泪瓦斯对人并无过大影响以至于对于舆论上的损害微乎其微，但一支由广大人民群众组成的队伍必将坚持用和平手段维护人民的秩序：用纪律与训练缓慢推进阵线！
⑥反动派的领袖们往往心狠手辣，下手歹毒，有时在面对极端危险时警方也不得不采取非常之手段予以应对，例如：[strike] 狙击枪，实弹霰弹枪[/strike]催泪瓦斯喷雾枪。
⑦若局势在反动派领袖们的挑拨下开始失控，暴徒们开始暴力抗法，则此时光荣人民警察的一切有关暴力的行为时皆会被舆论认定为还击，即：在政治评价中享受极大的惩罚减免，毕竟还击又有什么可过多指责的呢？
⑧尽管如此，此时此刻，伟大正义的执法者依然可以继续保持最大程度的忍让与和平，让被煽动至头脑发热的无辜人民群众能在冷静下来后毫发无损的回到家中与家人团聚，顺带在舆论与政治评价中占据更大的优势。

⑨若经过现场警司的严明判断后认定这并非一起普通和平示威，而是一场经过不法分子精心策划，有组织有预谋的一场阴谋，则应当进行大规模的逮捕审问。以战术小队横列最大延展拖延敌人的突进，突击与强击小队一同参与抓捕，很快就能将犯罪分子一网打尽。
⑩如果这群卑鄙无耻的法外之徒开始不择手段，利用人数上的绝对优势开始不断冲锋，并妄图使用易燃易爆品彻底摧毁我军高昂的士气，则此时民主与法制的军火库大门将彻底打开！战争机器咆哮轰鸣，钢铁的履带滚滚向前，前进，前进！

author: {'steamid': '76561198170884395', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1596728884}
review:
I'm underwhelmed at this point, the game is great in theory. The pixel art so far is 7-9 out of 10. The music is pretty dope for the game and I'm happy with it. I've only played through one side of one senario (rioters) but there are about 30 other missions for me to play, so maybe another 3.5 hours of single player content (not that bad) as well as multiplayer which I haven't touched yet because I barely know how to play honestly. There was no tutorial or even key guide readily avalible just hey play this game. Don't get me wrong I hate it when a game holds my hand but I would have liked at least a click to continue key guide/explanation of how everything works besides having to go into options to figure stuff out on my own.

So all in all I'm happy with the progress made, I was expecting something different but hopefully this will develope more as time goes on. For now, I'd say if you have the money go for it

author: {'steamid': '76561197969807004', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1537726158}
review:
Apesar dos gráficos pixelados que fazem doer os olhos, literalmente, RIOT é um jogo único. 

Ele tenta te colocar a par de alguns atos históricos, porém, o próprio jogo pede que você vá pesquisar um pouco sobre cada ato caso tenha curiosidade de saber das histórias de forma mais profunda, afinal, é um jogo e não um livro de história interativo.

Nisso, ele te apresenta com a possibiidade de encarar os dois lados: os rebeldes ou os policiais/governo. O modo de "carreira" em si tem como maior base a opinião pública, já que a violência desmedida ou o cumprimento parcial ou demorado de certos objetivos fazem com que esta opinião pública te ajude ou não no jogo, seja qual lado você escolher controlar.

Há alguns personagens que você ganha conforme passa cada ato e cada um muda muito a dinâmica de jogo. Dependendo do objetivo proposto, um personagem pode deflagrar ou mesmo aumentar atos violentos, assim como fazer com que você consiga lidar com um objetivo de forma mais fácil ou complicada, dependendo do temperamento de quem você está controlando e quem você deve manipular. 

Por exemplo: policiais ficam super agressivos se você os provoca com bombas e socos, mas têm uma certa dificuldade, no jogo, de manter a linha caso você force a ocupação ou invasão de um local sem violência. Ou, às vezes, segurar um posto significa fazer os manifestantes sentarem e não responderem às ações violentas da polícia, em vez de simplesmente responder à agressão na mesma moeda ou pior. Ainda, há momentos em que a violência se torna necessária, mas se for a primeira coisa que utilizar de início em vez de ser algo que resulta de uma resposta violenta (ou seja, você agredir de cara em vez de primeiro ser agredido), pode fazer com que você venca os objetivos, mas perca força da opinião pública, e o próximo ato ficará bem mais complicado de lidar, por consequência.

Enfim, é complexo. 

O jogo está sendo desenvolvido por um time bem pequeno de ex-empregados da Valve, se não me engano. O progresso acerca de polimento do jogo e correção de bugs é um tanto mais lento. Apesar disso, é um jogo que, pelo trabalho desenvolvido, vale facilmente o investimento pedido em Early Access.
