author: {'steamid': '76561198042745540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1610155040}
review:
I mostly enjoyed this game, it's a really cool idea and it's a lot of fun. However I came very close to giving this a negative review because it seems the devs do update it anymore, and it needs updates.

Almost every level is great, except I can't stand the Egyptian missions, they're either boring or straight up annoying. Mainly Friday of Anger Part II and Battle of the Camels. Both are insanely annoying and just plain not fun. Those two missions alone make me want to give the game a bad review but I won't mainly because the majority of the game is good. Friday of Anger Part II is only bad for the police, it goes so fast, and people are constantly throwing explosives at you so your guys keep getting scared and running off, which is annoying because when they do that you have no control, so you just get to watch yourself lose. Battle of the Camels sucks because anytime you try to push the protests they all get stuck to you and won't leave until you leave their zone, there are so many, mixed with the units it forces you to have in this one, it's just trash. 

There is a few glitches here and there, they don't always happen, but when they do they'll make you want to pull out your hair. Two of the worst glitches is when you fire off either smoke grenades or guns nothing will happen but it will say you did fire it and make you wait for another shot, even though nothing happened. The next and by far the worst is that your units just sometimes get stuck, like you click to move them and they just don't move. And sometimes your units will get stuck on trees and stuff. It drives you insane.

I'm being kind and giving this a good review because I have hope the devs will release some updates and fix my complaints, I've been following this game from the start. If they don't however, I'm going to give this game a bad review in the future for the simple fact that they left a half finished game.

Overall, in it's current state, 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035158331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1515132622}
review:
A unique idea, but not captivating.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Unique art style that really fits. It's a really beautiful type of Pixel art.
    [*]Audio tastefully fits the art style, and escalated seemlessly
    [*]Real-life situations well documented and implemented in the game, giving flavor to the levels
[/list]
[h1]Negatives[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Lots of UI problems. I had a lot of problems selecting different loadouts. The menus would become bugged and stayed so.
    [*]Disconnection with orders and implementation, lack of feedback. This is somewhat by design in that you are only giving orders to your units - they may not follow them. This is a nice concept - but what is lacking is feedback. You get no obvious feedback that what you are asking them to do is being followed (or not - and if so why).
    [*]The game just felt a bit flat. I didn't really get a sense I was learning, nor how I was choosing to deal with the riot on either side actually mattered.
[/list]
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Ultimately it felt like the parts of it have just not meshed together well. The disconnection from your orders really pulls you away and left me feeling like I was really just watching the (admittedly, beautiful) pixels on the screen do what they wanted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036187691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2277, 'last_played': 1564554980}
review:
[h1] QA를 실패한 (혹은 포기한) 인디게임 [/h1]

솔직히 게임이 재미없는건 아니다. 그 많은 에러와 크래시와 그래픽카드 드라이버 강제종료를 당하면서도 플탐 30시간을 찍고 있는데 재미가 없다고 할 수는 없다. 그럼에도 이제 와서 비추천 평가를 작성하는 이유는 게임이 반년간 컨텐츠 추가는 있어도 이러한 근본적 문제들이 조금도 해결되지 않고 있기 때문이다.

인디게임 많이 하는 입장에서 게임 버그가 어느정도 있는 건 어지간해서는 넘어가는 편이고 이렇게 리뷰로 까기보다는 개발진한테 알려주고 하는 편이지만, 얘들은 내가 지금까지 세 번을 피드백 폼을 작성해 보내줄동안 크래시 문제를 개선을 조금도 하지 못했거나 않았다. 업데이트를 거의 주 단위로 뽑아내고 있는데 그동안 게임 크래시/그래픽카드 드라이버 크래시로 인해 디스플레이가 먹통이 되는 것은 조금도 줄어들지 않았다.
물론 조금 이를 누그러뜨릴 방법은 있다. 게임이 돌아가는 동안 외장 그래픽카드(GTX 9 시리즈) 가 전혀 돌아가지 않는 것을 발견하고 내장 그래픽카드(인텔) 대신 외장 그래픽카드 갈구게 해 줬더니 좀 나아지긴 한다. 그러고 보니 어디선가 읽은 이 게임은 2D 그래픽 처리만 하면 되는 것처럼 보이지만 사실 3D게임에 가깝다는 이야기가 떠오른다. 그런데 이건 개발진이 해야 할 일 아닌가? 아무튼 그래서 기본 그래픽 프로세서 바꾸고 돌리니 좀 나아지긴 하는데 전보다 크래시가 감소한 정도지 아예 사라지지는 않는다. 작업관리자 켜보니 GTX 9 시리즈 (VRAM 4GB) 의 GPU를 99%까지 뽑아먹고 있다. 그런데 그래픽 권장사양이 '그래픽: 2GB Dedicated VRAM' 이라고? 아무튼 최적화도 실패했고 디버깅도 실패한 게임이다. 주 단위로 컨텐츠 업데이트 꼬박꼬박 내면서 디버깅은 조금도 하지 않는건 버그로 화난 플레이어가 화병으로 죽기를 기다리는 메타인가?


그럼에도 게임에 대한 긍정적인 또는 유용한 정보를 써보자면 우선 크래시만 없었다면 추천할법한 게임은 맞다. 그럭저럭 몰입감 있는 RTS고 도트도 예쁘다. 작년 12월만 해도 서너시간만에 스토리모드 전부다 깨고 폭력 0으로 클리어하는 도전과제 하러 갔었다. 하다보니 적당한 파훼법도 찾아서 시위대 측 비폭력 도전과제도 깨고 그랬다.(경찰 측은 이집트 스토리에서 시작부터 폭력적인 상태로 시작하는 미션이 있어 불가능하다. 근데 이걸 깼다고 나오는 사람이 0.3%나 있고 오히려 시위대 측 비폭력 클리어가 0.1%인건 이해가 안간다) 나중에 추가된 글로벌 모드도 나름 하는 재미가 있다. 여러모로 폭력도가 나중에 승패를 가르[i](기로 되어있)[/i]는점수에 가산되고 다음 미션에 영향을 주는[i](것이라 주장하는)[/i] 시스템은 이 게임의 핵심 요소라 할만하다.

근데 이러한 핵심적 요소가 구멍이 뚫린 상태고 게임이 뻑하면 크래시해서 그래픽카드 드라이버랑 같이 강제종료하는데 이걸 사서 해야할까? 아니 누가 주더라도 이걸 해야할까? 이 게임 구매결정에 유일한 긍정적 요소는 게임이 두 시간 내로 크래시 할 것이기 때문에 환불타이밍을 잡기 쉽다는 점 뿐이다.


3줄 요약

[olist]
    [*]이 게임은 그래픽카드 최적화에 실패해서 그래픽카드를 엄청 갈구고 여차하면 드라이버까지 강종시킨다.
    [*]정치적 영향력이 평가요소가 된다는 시스템은 매우 흥미롭지만 완성도가 떨어진다.
    [*][b]그럼에도 이 게임을 해볼까 싶은 생각이 든다면 1,2번을 다시 보라.[/b]
[/olist]



 * 그럼에도 이 게임을 해보고 싶은 사람들을 위한 크래시 관련 팁
 - 난 내장그래픽카드만 사용한다: [u]사지 마[/u]
 - 난 외장그래픽카드만 사용한다: 일단 상대적으로 문제가 적다. 크래시는 정말로 아무런 원인도 없이 나타나는 경우도 있지만 대부분은 다음과 같은 조건에서 나타난다. [잦은 Tab 키 사용]+[잦은 우클릭 이동명령] 즉, 여러 집단에 명령을 빠르게 내리기 위해 Tab키를 난타하며 APM 300을 찍을 기세로 이동명령을 계속 찍다보면 그래픽이 깨지기 시작한다. 이 단계까지 오면 조만간 크래시가 날 확률이 높으므로 그냥 게임을 재시작하는것이 좋다. 이걸 안하면 되는거 아니냐고 반문할 수 있는데 시위대 측 플레이할때 최대한 폭력 안쓰고 경찰 돌파하는 방법이 이것뿐이라 어쩔 수 없다.
 - 난 내장/외장그래픽 다 달려있다: 앞서 말한대로, 이 게임을 외장그래픽카드로 돌리도록 설정해야 한다. 아니면 내장그래픽카드를 갈구면서 높은 확률로 개복치마냥 크래시가 터질 것이고, 여차하면 내장그래픽카드를 같이 사용하던 웹브라우저를 날리거나 아예 디스플레이가 먹통이 될 것이다. 그러니 NVIDIA 제어판같은걸 들어가서 설정을 바꿔주어야 한다. 물론 그럼에도 크래시는 터지겠지만 적어도 빈도는 조금 줄어들것이고 피해도 작아질 것이다. 암튼 이걸 한 다음에는 외장그래픽카드만 사용한다 쪽 설명을 읽어보면 된다.

kinda repetitive, your units wont be responsive when you need them, thell be standing somehwere gawking at the crowd, after you tell them to keep pushing and arresting people, and... OPPS youre out of time to complete the game, game over i guess. Fuck that. All you do in this game is click vaguely near the other side, then the other side moves back into place, thats all there is to this game. and the 'rebels' are so bipolar in how angry or calm they get they make flash floods look like slow floods.police side = smoke/flash then arrest till complete (or charge and start a fight and fight more people next round). 'rebels' = walk towards police like youre supposed to in basketball (just being a pain), or start throwing molotovs and give the police a reason to hurt you. whats with the super short times to clear people out of an area, like does the president of the world need to use that particular road in 3 minutes? like, why would you make it 3 minutes (one guy left in the spot as timer hits zero = FAIL) Fuck this im asking for a refund.
Edit: its shallow in terms of strategy and content.

Then I got bored, there was just way too much repetition. I pickled it up again like two months ago and was met with constant crashes even going so far as to making my entire pc crash into a bluescreen kind of state. 

However! Since the last updates the game have really improved, removing the crashes and incorperating new fun mechanics into the game, really making me enjoy this game like I thought I would all those days, months, years, waiting for it. 
Thank you guys! You are on your way to make this game into the game I dreamt about playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113938038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1575380700}
review:
RIOT - Civil Unrest to gra strategiczna mająca na celu ukazanie klimatu i przebiegu zamieszek zarówno ze srony oddziałów prewencji policji jak i cywili. Mamy do dyspozycji do 6 oddziałów (rzadko zdarza się mniej), których liczebność zależy od wybranego incydentu oraz pajazdy (zwykłe wozy lub armatki wodne). Policjanci dzielą się na trzy klasy - Tactical (duża tarcza + tonfa/baton), Assault (Małe tarcze + tonfa/baton, w Polsce w realu, policjanci tego typu nie posiadają tarcz) oraz Ballistic (Gaz, granatnik dymny, Strzelba na gumową lub ostrą amunicję). Każdemu oddziałowi można dać wyposażenie dodatkowe (granat hukowy, radio, pistolet itp.) Możliwe jest również granie jako protestujący/zadymiarze, jednak mają oni mniej bogade mechaniki (aczkolwiek w mej opinii gra się nimi trudniej niż policją).

Najlepszym zakończeniem krótkiego, bo z reguły kilkuminutowego starcia jest osiągnięcie celu (utrzymanie pozycji, zniszczenie danych obiektów, dotarcie do krawędzi mapy itp.) bez rannych lub matwych bo obu stronach. Od wyniku w starciu odejmowane są pukty polityczne (za zbyt agresywne działanie), dopiero po tym działaniu otrzymujemy prawdziwy wynik. Czasem (najczęściej jako protestujący) możemy nie osiągnąć celu, ale z powodu nadmiarnej agresji (która z reguły pojawia się pod koniec rundy, gdy cel nadal nie jest osiągnięty) przeciwnika po odjęciu punktów wygrana jest nasza. 

W grze mamy do zagrania 4 kampanie do 4/5 misji w każej. Możemy się wcielić w obydwie strony. Oprócz tego mamy jeszcze kilkanaście pozostałych map. Polskich zamieszek nie ma (czy dobrze? odpowiedźcie sobie sami) bowiem wszystkie wydarzenia dzieją się po 2000r. Być może kiedyś pojawią się polskie starcia z ZOMO w roli głównej, ale tego stwierdzić na dzień dzisiejszy nie można. Na dodatek jest jeszcze edytor poziomów oraz tryb gry w którym to my ustalamy zasady i liczebość oraz wyposażenie stron.

Zalety:
Nietypowa koncepcja i grafika
Ciekawa rozgrywka
Klimat
Wględny realizm (nie ma narazie jakiś super zaawansowanych taktyk)
Wszystkie zamieszki miały naprawdę miejscie

Wady:
Krótka rozgrywka (w zależności od poziomu trudności, ale raczej nie przekroczy 15/20h)
Sporadyczne bugi (znikanie jednostek, blokowanie się), ale trzeba zaznaczyć, że gra jest narazie w wersji alpha i wszystko może ulec zmianie

review: I honestly tried to love this, but it definitely isn't worth the money in this state of development. You remove every protester from the area that you're supposed to take - timer doesn't start, you lose. You have your waterthrower set on fire and officers killed? Protesters are considered "peaceful". You're supposed to hold an area, there's not a single rioter inside, behind or on the sides of the marked area - oh, you've lost because "you failed to hold the area". You're playing protester? Here, take these teargas canisters and batons by peaceful cops - oh, you're playing the same mission as police? How dare you throw a smokegrenade! You're violent now! Getting a refund now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281614135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1523850206}
review:
Straight off ill admit that I do like playing the game.But I cant say I would recommend it anymore.

     The more I play it the more a lot of it feels like a game of chance especially playing as the rioters.There are missions I cant beat because I have to take an area and the only way I can seem to  manage that is  through violence but because of that violence I lose anyway because then I lose the political score.I guess that was uspposed to game the game more realistic but all it did is make some objectives impossible.One time I managed to take the are with minimal violence despite the police often firing into the crowd, throwing grenades, and ramming vans into the protesters but somehow throwing 2 molotove cocktails in response to being shot at over and over is "heavy amounts of violence" ad the police were "peaceful"?What?The camera tool is supposed to help gain political score and maybe that is how they expect you to overcome that obstical but its hard to do that what what it is your taking pictures is critical while also being hard to pull off.Ive tried taking pictures of police standing off with the crowd, both groups mashing together, vans charging into the crowd and vrious other things but the only way I could find to reliably get a high picture like rating was from police with red icons (I assume thats them being violent) and police firing into the crowd (which happens way more often but is very hard to get a picture of even if you just sit there waiting for it to happen).But sitting with the camera over the police waiting for anything to happen to get a halfway decent pciture means I cant actually do anything to attempt to achieve the objective.I can only manage one or the other, never both.The other problem is that if the police dnt want you to go somewhere (which is often a main obstical), then chances are its going to take your entire time limit and all of your attention to get past them.No time for rallying scattered portestors, using social media to fill out the crowd, or take any picture to save your political score to keep from losing when you finally get there anyway.Oh wait nevermind.Once in a while the police will turn into pushovers somehow and then go right back to being brick walls again.It really does turn into a game of chance at times.But back to why I said I liked the game but wouldnt recommend it.This game as it is meant to be played sucks.But if your looking for a game to let you fire into a crowd and then just watch the chaos for some amusement.This is really good for that.The only reason I touched the campaign is because im pretty sure its the only way to get live fire and certain other options in the other modes where I plan on setting up chaos to amuse mysef for a few minutes which is really all this game is good for.

review:
Dissapointing, at least today. 

There is no real progression system aside from just playing missions as both sides to unlock "special" missions. The gameplay is generally lacking atmosphere, and I feel like if every mission is just the same thing time and time again, regardless of which side I play as. Most importantly, though, the game failed at providing much emotional connection. When the police indiscrimantely fire on the rebels, it would seem to be an exciting thing, but the bugs and cuts break the immersion. Maybe as time progresses and patches are put out, I could change my review. For now though, it's lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268593558', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1545822054}
review:
8 saate yakın oynanabilecek, çerezlik, mekanikleri güzel ve bence çok eğlenceli bir oyun ama 21 lira etmez. 15 lira ve altı uygundur diye düşünüyorum. Dışarıdan bakınca kontrolleri zor gibi gözüküyor ama 2-3 elde ısınıyorsunuz. Hiç İngilizceniz yoksa kontrollerde başta zorlanabilirsiniz. Genel olarak 8/10'luk bağımsız bir geliştirici ekibinden çıkmış güzel bir oyun.

Artıları

1) Oyun mekanikleri çok eğlenceli. Göstericileri dağtıırken, tutuklarken, gazlarken ve özellikle tazikli suyla yerlerde süründürürken ya da polise molotof bomba falan atarken gerçekten hissediyorsunuz.
2) İki taraftan da oynayabiliyorsunuz poliste her birim için alınabilecek çeşitli yetenekler ve silahlarla mekanikler zaman içinde gelişiyor ve çeşitleniyor. Göstericilerde ise topluluğa genel olarak özellikler alıyorsunuz ve topluluğun yapısını da siz belirliyorsunuz. (Hafif zırhlı olsun ama sayısı çok olsun, ağır zırhlı olsun ama sayısı az olsun falan)
3) Birçok bilindik siyasi olay içinde bulunduran eğlenceli senaryo modları var. (Arap baharı, Gezi Parkı vb.)

Eksileri

1) Oyun erken erişimde ve bu yüzden içerisinde buglar var. Benim oyun deneyimimi tamamen mahvetmedi ama arada var yani söyleyeyim.
2) Haritanın en köşelerindeki birimler bazen istediğiniz yere gitmeyebiliyor. Oyun erken erişimde olduğu için ve bu birimlerin komut dinlememe özelliği çok nadiren yaşandığı için çok sorun olmadı.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149394919', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1664651662}
review:
Premesse:
E' un gioco che ho aspettato tantissimo sia per il tema trattato (rivolte e sommosse che, personalmente, adoro) sia per la grafica stile retrò che mi ha sempre entusiasmato, perciò al momento dell'uscita non ho resistito e l'ho acquistato a prezzo pieno. E' valsa la pena aspettare (e spendere!) tanto? Purtroppo la risposta è no.
PRO:
- grafica (semplice, ma che esalta moltissimo il contesto)
- audio (fantastico, registrazioni direttamente sul campo)

CONTRO:
- comandi (difficoltà a selezionare le unità e a impartire gli ordini)
- costo
- gameplay (composto da molti microlivelli che non portano a nulla; sembra troppo un gioco flash & casual)
- fps (nonostante la potenza del mio pc, il gioco, operando con centinaia e centinaia di personaggi, raggiunge picchi di 2fps. Un po' pochini per qualche omuncolo pixellato, considerando che tutti i Total War mi girano a >60fps con grafica ultra!)
- giocabilità (si spaccia per gestionale in tempo reale, ma non lo è assolutante. Hanno calcato troppo la mano col concetto di rivolta: infatti è un totale bordello! Il giocatore si limita a "guidare e impartire consigli sul da farsi" piuttosto che dare ordini veri e propri)

Rapporto qualità-prezzo pessimo. Come già detto, da come è ora, vale quanto un banalissimo (e gratuito!!) gioco flash online. Speriamo in ulteriori e migliori sviluppi da questa idea buonissima, ma realizzata coi sandali.
Per ora è un no, neanche scontato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005606830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1522248832}
review:
I have almost played this straight today, got 6 hours down on it.

[b]IMPORTANT:[/b] First thing to mention is, a lot of people are posting their specs and saying the game lags and feezes. This happened to me after about five maps. But it is not the game exactly. To [b]FIX[/b] this, you must ensure your nvidia graphics card is running the game, and not the graphics card off the mother board chipset. I did this and it fixed all my problems, and my computer specs are a lot less then most peoples!

PROS

.Great story telling.
.Fantastic AI and crowd modeling
.Brilliant retro graphics
.Huge array of weapons and units, even camel mounted!
.Loads and loads of maps, and even a map editor.
.Multiplayer on one computer, love retro in house multiplayer, although LAN would be a bonus.

CONS

.The campaigns are great, but there could be more of them, hoping there will be. Many maps currently, but a lot of them are standalone missions.
.Lack of multiplayer online or LAN means its life span will probably be limited to all the single player content.
.They need to fix this graphics card selecting bug, as it will create a lot of bad reviews and confusion by those who don't search for the fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998029976', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1521747355}
review:
Tried to love this game since it first came out, but no matter how many times I come back I always end up with a bad taste in my mouth. See, there's just no rhyme or reason to what you or your units are doing in this game. Controls are clunky, units ignore commands all the time. I literally have no idea what the point of playing this game is, when units continuously don't seem to do what the player is commanding them to do.

Imagine if you are playing The Sims, but all you do is tell the Sim to walk on a pavement and occassionally it will collide with another Sim. It will continuously ignore your walk command and go in the opposite direction even if nothing obstructs it. Everything has a mind of it's own, but it never seems to be interested in completing the objective. This doesn't play like a game, more like a random simulation where you give directions... directions that the AI can choose to not follow.

Primarily the Arab Spring campaign is a problem, although it's known to be the most difficult, it just doesn't make any sense. I remember playing when it was just released, I could not beat Friday of Anger Part 2 because the rebels continuously kept pelting me with objects which murdered my police units all the time even if they had optimized defense options and abilities. To add insult to injury the results screen wouldn't just show me a loss, but it would show me that the rebels had like zero aggression thus zero political drawback even if I miraculously won the encounter. Not to mention that the mission had like a short 1,5 minute timer (changed to 3-4 minutes now) which made it near impossible to keep the area clear. Right, so after the implementation of a longer mission timer... it's still a royal pain to beat this level.

So I tried it again later, figuring after months something had changed. I instantly adopted an aggressive stance as I knew this level was unfair, so I decided to play dictator and just keep shooting at rebels. I won quite easily and the controls made a little more sense (only barely)... but then on the results screen I had maximum aggression... which meant I failed the level. So... wait, what, I fail a level because I choose a violent strategy? If I can't use violence then what's the point of having violent abilities? Oh, I see, they want you to use moderation so you can't cheese a win as police...
[h1][b]...Which is stupid because the rebel AI can cheese a win if they go apesh!t on the pelting strategy: I don't get a win if all my police units are pelted to death.[/b][/h1]

So, okay. I try-harded it with micromanagement (hard when units keep having a mind of their own) and only occassionally shot a gun at the rebels while I spammed smoke grenades. Somehow this made them extremely aggressive and they started to pelt me again with a barrage of crap. So from this I deduced that the AI decisions are completely random as they did not even bother to attack me when I went full killing machine on them. Having shot maybe 3 times I still ended up with like a -44 political result and I barely edged a win which I got no satisfaction out of because it was basically me shuffling back and forth because the damn units won't sit still while they get continuously pelted at like they are haversacks, while I just let my units spam smoke grenades in retaliation. Because we bought this game to see pixelated smoke effects 24/7, right devs?

Anyway, after that unenjoyable mess you get the dreaded Camel mission, dear god. If you look on the discussions for help articles on it, the devs even link to specific user's tips, which I followed to the letter and I get the same sh!t as above. I tried one run on peaceful, not even noticing that with the number buttons I could toggle abilities for the camels because, hey: the devs thought it was a great idea to make the ability bar invisible in this mission! Sigh, anyway, I saw tents so I figured clearing them was a priority. In no time did I clear it and then I walked around colliding with rebels... and then I suddenly lost. There was no visible timer. There were no losses on my side. There was no insane aggression. So, what, the mission felt like it was over and... I lost? 

Okay.

So I tried one more time, using the advice for abilities and indeed pressing buttons toggles otherwise invisible abilities. Great development there. I tried using my camels offensively this time and used the radio to get them to rush/focus one spot which kind of worked, except for the fact that some camel units kept bee-lining back to the place where they came from for no reason. Eventually the square was cleared, there were barely any casualties on either side and I destroyed a few tents... then I got the message that I won, except I still failed because... I had maximum aggression and maximum political defeat on the result screen. While there actually were almost no casualties for either side.How much more peaceful would you need to be? I thought this game was called Civil Unrest...
[h1][b]...Not Civil Un-Rest In Peace.[/b][/h1]

At this point I just dropped the game. Yeah, I can probably try-hard the level and keep trying until I get the magical moment where the game THINKS I caused zero casualties, but then I'm relying on the game's random nature to decide the outcome for me. If I want a simulation of a battle and let another party surprise me with the outcome... I could watch an action movie. This is supposed to be an interactive game, with perhaps a little bit of stress relief at the sight of protesters and police colliding...
[h1][b]...But no, instead it's making me frustrated from all the unexplainable game-over scenarios coupled with the AI of the side I represent just doing the truffle shuffle on my screen instead of fighting or completing objectives.[/b][/h1]

It probably doesn't help that outside of these random moments there are also moments where the entire game straight up fully stops responding. It can happen that menu buttons stop working, that units get stuck or do not respond anymore or that abilities sometimes stop being usable. At other times unit costs are suddenly higher or lower than it was, when you repeatedly switch gear.

The game is such a bad mess that I can't even logically pick it apart either in a cohesive review, it's just not reliable to play it as a game because... it's a randomised mess. The biggest struggle is not police bringing rebels to order--it's the player trying to bring the game mechanics to order... without ever succeeding.

In summary:
- Units do whatever they feel like and police retreat all the time; they look badly organised
- You lose games if you use violence... so why is violence an option then?
- The game can still think you have been too violent when you haven't: bugged or bullsh!t
- Apparently the AI is free to use violence however they please without repercussions
- Units, menu buttons and unit abilities can space out or completely stop working
- No major improvements after months of the initial release

This is one of those games that I loved as a concept, but where the developer waited way too long to release it, only to end up with a non-functional game that feels more like a 14-year old's Game Maker school project (no offense)... and now the damage is done and I sincerely doubt they want to go through another phase of post-release development to listen to all the feedback to fix the entire bloody game. The devs should've released it early, taken in feedback DURING development and thus ended up releasing a logically playable game. 

Instead, as it is, this remains an inherently flawed game that I cannot recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061974601', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1521423418}
review:
Performance

Game runs fine for the first 2 levels, then the action increases and it starts to stutter, dropping frames and become unresponsive.
After 50 minutes it started to display 1 frame every 5 seconds and after a minute of agony it crashed because of 'out of memory'.
I have 16GB of ram, CPU: i5-4690K and GPU: gtx 980.


Gameplay

While I understand that an unorganized crowd is difficult to coordinate
and that a fearful citizen won't obey your orders, the result is simply not fun.
Rioters would stall for no apparent reason and given the short time to complete the objectives,
the experience is tragicomic and frustrating.


Graphics

While the cutscenes are evocative and the overall visuals while playing are pretty,
the big blocky pixel art doesn't help to understand what's going on.
Trying to zoom in worsen the situation, leaving you wondering at a blurry mess of chaotic rectangles.


Development

For what I've read, the concept began 5 years ago and the development 3 years ago.
This game uses unity 3d ( https://riotcivilunrest.gamepedia.com/Engine ) and on January 2016 the crowd physics (the main problem causing performance issues)
was rewrote from scratch ( http://riotsimulator.com/12-jan-2016-unity3ds-crowd-physics-vs-trigghys-crowd-physics/ )
It looks like the developers were happy with the result: "The end result is a far more fluid mass of individuals that react as a crowd would in a real world situation"
but promise to further improve: "we’re all back working hard on the project and are confident we are making great progress".

To date, after two years, using much better hardware than recommended, I can't see that promise fulfilled.
Reading the news I see the Devs working on the menu, the gameplay, the UI, skills and adding levels.
There is no mention of performance.


Translation

As a native Italian speaker and given that the Devs are Italian, I faithfully and proudly opted for the Italian localization of the game.
Within 2 minutes I'm welcomed by glaring typos and poor sentence structure:
'agressivo' instead of 'agGressivo', 'blocca un area' without the apostrophe, 'usati per creaTe' instead of 'usati per creaRe',
'molti pedardi legati con un laccio infiammabile usati per creaTe molte pesanti detonazioni in un breve arco di tempo' sounds poor and contains the mentioned typo.
The overall impression is of a rushed localization and poor attention to detail.


Feedback

I've opened a ticket on the discussion forum here on Steam on the 18th of March, sunday morning at 7 am, about the 'out of memory' crash.
To date, Tuesday evening, I got no reply.
Reading the reviews I noticed a frequent answer from the Devs, they are grateful for the feedback and promise performance improvements,
which unfortunately is not backed by the mentioned change log detailed in the 'news' section.


Politics

The game puts you in the position of handling the delicate event of a civil revolt, being it an occupation, an uprising, a revolution,
and gives you the option to manage the rioters or the police.
Those events are actual representations of past facts: Indignados in Spain, NoTAV in Italy, Keratea in Greece, Tahrir in Egypt, October in Rome, Gezi Park in Turkey, and more.
I remember all of those and have personally spoken with some witness of the NoTAV and the October in Rome.
A friend of mine is still unable to look a police officer without shaking and another one breaks in tears, both having participated at the Genoa G8 '01.

While I appreciate the gory videogames as much as the next guy (Doom, Carmageddon, Butcher, Party Hard, Hatred, ...),
I found myself uncomfortable and guilty, thinking of those friends while playing.
I guess that the poor gameplay and the overall impression that the crowd acts as a bunch of monkeys
adds insult to injury.

In my opinion, this game fails to capture the depth and the tragedy of those events.

Given that it's a paid product, I feel that capitalize over those events is of bad taste.

Reading reviews of people that enjoy the idea of beating the population to death doesn't help.


Conclusion

I've spent that 50 minutes of gaming session with a friend and it was a tragicomic experience.
The feeling is that the Devs have no previous development experience and are not able to fix the performance problems.
I'm getting a refund and I'm sorry for the backers but to me this project is a scam that belongs in the same realm as Godus.

The game feels more like a quick show than a game. Pin to forces and sit back an watch. Hopefully somthing more comes from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030422449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1520204715}
review:
Grosse daube. Je l'ai essayé après avoir vu la vidéo du Joueur du Grenier et parceque le concept est très intéressant et bien trouvé. Sauf qu'un concept, ça ne fait pas un jeu.
Ce jeu est codé avec le ... 
Alors oui, on va dire "accès anticipé", sauf qu'accès anticipé, ça ne veut pas dire balancer un jeu à la vente pour plus de 10€ (ba dis donc, on s'emm**** pas sur le prix d'un jeu non fini... Ca va les chevilles ?) où l'interface n'est même pas capable de gérer la navigation.

Le jeu est illisible, non seulement à cause du graphisme dégueulasse qui rappelle des animations amateurs de Windows 95, mais parceque le jeu ne t'explique rien. R-I-E-N.
Comment voulez-vous proposé à des gens un jeu dont vous n'expliquez même pas, juste textuellement, le gameplay ???!

Put@** mais c'est la base! 
Quand vous achetez un jeu de société, Monopoly par exemple, on vous donne une notice de jeu non?! Ca parait évident.
"Hey! T'as jamais joué au Poker ou à la belotte ?... Jamais ?... Tiens, bam voilà un paquet de carte, démerdes-toi!"

Et puis tiens, parlons-en des graphismes, j'ai vu dans les évaluations des gens qui mettent "graphisme fabuleux"... Attends c'est du sarcasme ?... Non parceque ça arrache les yeux (littéralement, ça crame les yeux tellement c'est pixellisé). Bordel, un mec qui n'aurait que ça à faire pourrait compter le nombre de pixel qui constitue le menu principal.
Si vous aimez pas le crénelage graphique et bien vous allez être servi!

Sinon, bien la difficulté... Tu lances une partie en difficulté "normale" (nommé "sans foi ni loi"... pourquoi? On en sait rien, surement pour nous perdre, tellement c'est pas du tout explicite de la difficulté) tu te fais dégommer -> Game Over en 1minute 30 secondes montre en main.
Allez, équipons nos gus... A bah, tu cliques sur l'un des 4 emplacements d'objets mais quoi que tu fasse ça ne remplira qu'un seul des 4 emplacements et toujours le même... okay ? Sympa le bug de novice développeur ?...

Ah, j'aime bien aussi la description item qui dit :
item description item description item description item description item description item description item description

C'est bien, bravo, j'applaudis le bug de wording (ou de récupération de la donnée).

Non mais c'est pas de l'accès anticipé ça ! C'est à peine l'ébauche d'un jeu.
Tout au plus, c'est de l'alpha...

Bordel, mais quand Steam va faire son taff et empêcher des voleurs de balancer un morceau de tomate dans leur store en annonçant "Allez-y, achetez, c'est de la ratatouille...".

Vendu + de 10€... Non mais lol, les mecs... 

J'arrête là avant d'avoir atteint le plafond des 2h de jeu pour pouvoir demander un remboursement Steam, car là, ya vraiment foutage de gueule.

Et encore un jeu indé en ""accès anticipé"" qui permet surtout aux 2~3 dév pignoufs derrière de s'assurer une issue de secours avant (ou pendant?) que leur projet prenne l'eau...

review: Ich habe mich auf dieses Spiel sehr gefreut, weil auf dem Markt aktuell nichts vergleichbares gibt. Leider ist das Spiel auch nach mehreren Updates einfach nicht gut. Zwar wird die Atmossphäre eines "Riots" gut rübergebracht und die Aufmachung der Story-"Kampagnen" ist auch interessant, aber die prinzipiell stimmige Pixelgrafik ist stellenweise sehr unübersichtlich. Das gleiche gilt für das Setup der Einheiten und die Steuuerung. Die meiste Zeit hat man das Gefühl, überhaupt keinen Einfluss auf das Spielgeschehen zu haben. Oft reagieren die Einheiten nicht und man weiß nicht, ob das Bugs sind oder vom Entwickler gewollt. Die Missionen laufen allesamt auch sehr ähnlich ab. Im Prinzip geht es fast immer darum, die gegnerischen Menschenmassen über eine bestimmte Distanz wegzuschieben. Aufgrund des fehlenden Einheiten-Feedbacks gestaltet sich das oft sehr mühsam und frustrierend. Ich kann derzeit leider nur vom Kauf abraten, da das Spiel auf keinen Fall über 10 Euro wert ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046235241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1519829134}
review:
This is a great game. I've read the negative reviews and saw that a few people disliked the game because of the old school graphics or because of the controls. First of all there is a tutorial so you can learn the controls very easily, in fact I didn't even play the tutorial and quickly learned how to use the controls and which button does which thing. The graphics are old school yes, but they're done in the right way. Animations such as shooting or rioters waving flags look authentic and dynamic and you're able to zoom in and out while you're ingame. Granted, the menus look a bit too pixelish but that doesn't negate the fact that the gameplay is great and you get to do exactly what you'd expect when you buy this game.

Unfortunately police brutality isn't always rewarded, so it might be fun to clear the Tahrir square with police squads who are armed with M 16s but you'll probably lose in the overall result anyways. I'd do it again any day though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053650321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1518807151}
review: Mi ha sin sa subito interessata, avendo scoperto il gioco circa un anno fa ad una fiera di indie game development italiana. Ne ho potuto anche discurre direttamente con gli sviluppatori, il che mi ha fatto apprezzare ancora di più lo stile grafico pixel art e la simulazione della folla, con relativa intelligenza artificiale che controlla la fazione avversaria. Ma la caratteristica che mi è piaciuta di più è sicuramente il comparto audio; la musica ma sopratutto gli effetti sonori riescono a farmi immedesimare moltissimo, inoltre ho scoperto solo ora che i suoni sono stati registrati in presa diretta all'interno di una scuola abbandonata, WOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031169840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1519715886}
review:
This is what you get for kickstarted game. 

After all promises we get:
- Game is ugly as hell. it is like it was drawn in MS Paint. In a very old one MS paint
- the resolution is SO LOW, thet you can count the ammount of pixels on screen! In one cutscene resolution was 48x88! What the fluff was that?
- the game play is not bad. it is absent. None of it. you just send hords of rioters/police on other herds of police/rioters. There is NO way to clerify, what is happening on the screen. You just send everyone and use skills as soon the cooldown is ready.
- Oh yeah. there is NO information about how to play this game. No skill descriptions, no tutorials. it's like: Here is 12 missions, you can change anything like in a sandbox, have fun. 
- Game lags like crazy. every 30 sec i get 2 sec lag

You can get more enjoyment from particles simulation games by throwing wawes of water/lava/other fluids at each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051160895', 'num_games_owned': 1703, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1519390771}
review:
30분 밖에 안했지만 평가를 내려본다.

'주제는 좋으나 게임성이 없는 게임'

솔직히 완전히 못할 게임은 아니지만 조작이 모든걸 말아먹는다. 시위대나 진압팀을 옮기고 명령내리는게 얼마나 힘든지는 해보면 알거다. 그다음으로 문제있는건 프레임 문제, 도트 무더기가 돌아댕기니 떨어질만하다.

허나 시스템적으로 재미있는점이 많이 있다. 시위대와 진압팀의 양측의 폭력사용 유무, 당시 시위의 장면을 찍어 상대의 폭력성을 보여주는 사진, 폭력성으로 인해 다음 시위에 자신의 편에 올 인원등, 결국 진정한 승리는 자신의 비폭력을 최대한 알리고 존나 맞아야 한다는 게임이다. 물론 실질적으로 펜보다 칼이 강하다. 허나 여긴 전쟁터가 아닌 일상속에 시위일 뿐이다. 전쟁터에선 전쟁법만 잘지키면 말이 거의 없지만. 시위는 온곳에 카메라가 렌즈를 당기고 있다.

말이 길어졌는데 시위를 표현한건 잘했지만 게임성이 병신인지라 좀더 지켜보고 사면 좋은 게임이다.

review:
Ho scoperto RIOT durante un evento di indie game italiano e mi ha sin da subito attirato per le meccaniche e per lo stile pixel art. Non ho mai partecipato ad una manifestazione ma il gioco riesce a prenderti molto, grazie all'intelligenza artificiale che reagisce molto accuratamente quando provocata. Volendo, infatti, provare le reazioni della polizia contro un atteggiamento aggressivo dei manifestanti e avendo provocato un morto, il gioco mi ha colpito al punto da farmi tornare in modalità pacifica.
Di solito cerco di evitare i gioci in Early Access ma avendo potuto discutere del gioco anche con gli stessi sviluppatori non ho potuto non prenderlo. Consigliatissimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966609157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1524217918}
review:
Un gioco che aspettavo da anni che finalmente è uscito su STEAM. La pixel art è fenomenale e lo stile, per quanto volutamente low-res, è ancora più di impatto vederlo animato a tutto schermo.

Mi ci è voluto un po' per capire il funzionamento ed i comandi ma appena si capiscono quei due o tre trucchetti lo si padroneggia che è una meraviglia (consiglio di iniziare con la polizia, molto meno caotica dei rivoltosi). 
Le diverse abilità di ogni fazione rendono il gioco molto più profondo e strategico rispetto a quello che pensavo (sopratutto se si gioca ad alte difficoltà) e la varietà con cui si possono affrontare le varie missioni ne aumenta di sicuro la rigiocabilità.
Il single player mi servirà per allenarmi meglio prima di addentrarmi nel pericoloso mondo del multiplayer :P

Non avendolo preso subito al day-one mi sono ritrovato pure tutte le varie fix e migliorie "aggratis", segno che comunque gli sviluppatori ascoltano la community e sono attivi nel migliorare sempre di più questo ottimo prodotto.
Un po' come è stato per Age of Empire poi, l'avere scene di gioco ispirate a fatti storici reali, ha suscitato in me voglia di approfondire certi temi ed avvenimenti lasciati dai notiziari un po' più "in secondo piano" rispetto ad altre notizie. Grazie a RIOT ho avuto modo di approfondire meglio senza però volersi sbilanciare da una parte (polizia) o dall'altra (rivoltosi).

author: {'steamid': '76561198121432275', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1579484836}
review:
(NOTE: Most of my review is copy-pasted from my comment under someone's review, though all of these words are my own.) (http://steamcommunity.com/id/kwebber321/recommended/342310/)

There are other games out there that took 5+ years to develop just like this game, are far better/more polished, and are a lot deeper than this game. Two games that immediately come to mind are Prison Architect and Rimworld, among other titles. This game launched, not only into early access, but with mountains of bugs - (To name a few: Certain UI elements don't highlight correctly, removing units from a police roster would bug out the whole game completely, and the "destroy property" objective on some maps doesn't work correctly).

Keep in mind that PA and Rimworld had the same size team as this game, and are now COMPLETELY finished titles, and go much deeper in terms of their systems than this game. Meanwhile, RIOT took five years to develop, but has a much simpler (admittedly pretty) art style, and launched into early access ([b]AFTER FIVE YEARS[/b]). This company is completely incompetent and irresponsible in my eyes, unable to meet their own deadlines year after year. Saying that they're a small company isn't a valid shield at all.

Also, saying that they've come up with "new ideas" is incorrect. They made AI with extremely simple algorithms, only telling the AI when to panic or when to relax. Saying that they applied it in a new way is correct, but in my opinion, it was a very poor and sloppy application.

This product is a result of 5+ years of development. It is a pitiful excuse of a product, and has no right to be in early-access, let alone the Steam store. I don't think we should be praising this developer for launching such a buggy, pitiful, content-less product on the Steam store after five years of development, and thousands upon thousands of dollars in donations from patient, caring fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040602816', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1518124729}
review:
E' un gioco unico nel suo genere.
Non aspettatevi un RTS in cui date dei comandi ad ogni singola unità per vederle ordinate e tranquille ubbidire ai vostri ordini. In questo gioco vige il caos: oggetti che volano, urla, petardi e molotov che esplodono ovunque. 
Non si ha mai la sensazione di avere la situazione sotto controllo, ed è proprio questo che rende l'atmosfera credibile, secondo me. 
E' vero che c'è ancora tanto da sistemare, ma tanto è stato già fatto e mi sembra tutto sommato un ottimo lavoro. 

Riot è un'esperienza, in effetti, più che un gioco. Ed è un modo interessante per conoscere meglio molti avvenimenti successi negli ultimi anni. 
Se cercate un prodotto diverso dal solito, ve lo consiglio assolutamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120552989', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1623491056}
review:
After I bought this game in early access I was able to correctly run the game. Considering other aspects, that's the only advantage I can find in gameplay. Even after many patches it's barely playable. Showers of gliches turn the group you're commanding into some kind of "sleeping state" where they absolutely ignore commands or enviroment which means as soon as that happens (and it happens a lot) the player has actually already lost. 
The lore, you ask? I wish i could actually learn it. Even little slide shows providing info on the event have a tendency to break and aren't showing anything or just jump a few times in the row very quickly by itself. 
The game creators had a wonderful idea trashed by horrible making. I wish I could say "well, maybe it will get better" but since early access, it's still as broken as it was before making me loose any hope for that to happen.
Art concept is actually something to be proud of but it's really muffed by irritating gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993240784', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1517333933}
review:
Тенденция выпускать игры в не готовом для релиза виде, а потом за пол года пытаться превратить продукт в конфетку раздражает. Особенно когда такая ситуация касается проектов с длительным периодом разработки и/или постоянными откатами релиза на поздний срок. Сегодня я Вам расскажу как раз о таком варианте.
Вы скажете - "так ранний доступ же, ты платишь за тест!"
Но не забывайте, что даже тестовые версии должны быть играбельны и приносить хоть какое-то моральное удовлетворение от процесса игры в них.

[h1]Графика и звук:[/h1]

RIOT в качестве своей графической составляющей избрала крупно-пиксельный стиль, который несмотря на свою невыразительность, выверен разработчиком до максимально возможного внимания к деталям. Живая картинка ощущается как настоящая масса недовольных людей, игровые "ролики" шикарно создают "бунтарский" настрой, а простенькие эффекты разбавляют все это экшеном.

Звук нельзя назвать сильной или слабой стороной игры, ибо по большей части это "шум толпы и беспорядков", который вполне вписывается в происходящее на экране.

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

На релизе это был ужас...за артстайлом скрывалась этакая базовая версия игр серии Total War. Есть мораль, есть "отряд" - не потеряй мораль, не потеряй людей....задачи миссий тоже не блистали разнообразием - оттесни полицию, удержи точку...по сути все. Не улучшал положения местный баланс, который непонятно каким образом выверяли. Да и на самом старте игры вменяемого обучения не было, все постигалось своими силами.

Но прошло время...десяток патчей...и о чудо! Работа над солидной частью ошибок разработчиками проведена, баланс стал ощущаться, прохождение перестало быть бездумным кликом на 3 кнопки и тупое ожидание окончания таймера. Появилось обучение, "инвентарь" стал краеугольным камнем успеха, а не непонятным и бессмысленным набором предметов. Конечно, есть еще над чем поработать, но прогресс на лицо.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Необычная РТС про реально происходившие народные волнения и бунты. Симпатичный визуальный стиль, нормальный звук. После череды патчей игра стала адекватной по отношению к потребителю, а значит ее с чистой совестью можно порекомендовать.

Моя оценка 7.5 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202098269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1515660903}
review:
[h1] 无论自由or秩序，都不能用暴力作为解决方式：《Riot - Civil Unrest》 评测 [/h1] 

[u] 本评测来自杉果点评小分队	[/u]

[b] 前言 [/b]

秩序和自由这两个对立面经常出现在各种游戏中，比如育碧就很喜欢拿它们作为一款游戏中的主要矛盾，无论是看门狗中的黑客与ctOS还是刺客信条中的刺客与圣殿骑士，都分布代表了自由和秩序。本作也将此作为主题，且以现实生活中的游行暴乱作为背景，模拟了四个历史暴乱事件。然而，特别的是，《Riot – Civil Unrest》中玩家可以自己选择扮演警察或是暴民，选择坚守阵地亦或者是平息暴乱。

[b] 玩法 [/b]

玩家扮演历史事件的其中一方，每个历史事件需要在四次冲突中完成任务。任务类型有坚守阵地或是占领阵地。

暴民只有一种，可以使用如鞭炮、炸弹或者呼叫设备等技能来对抗警察。

而警察有三种，分别具备不同功能。警察可以使用烟雾弹。

双方都可以使用暴力来进行有力的打击，但一旦使用暴力，对方必将同样进行暴力反击。

每次冲突结束之后，根据本次冲突的暴力等元素进行评判并会放出相应的新闻，会对下一次冲突起到影响。

从游戏的成就可以看出，本作倡导的是无暴力行为来完成任务，然而可能暴力引起的混乱场面才会是很多玩家想看到的。

[b] 优点 [/b]

-	本作很好的还原了暴乱中的元素，烟雾弹、烟花爆竹、炸弹、枪支、新闻等等。

[b] 缺点 [/b]

-	内容不太完善。最开始都没有教程，相信很多人一上来对于操作都是懵逼的。以及存在丢档等bug。
-	像素分辨率过于低，以致于有种打马的感觉。

[b] 总结 [/b]

对于游戏的立意来说，尽管游戏中的种种暴力元素极大的还原了真实的暴乱游行活动，但是作者还是倡导无暴力的手段。无论哪一方是对哪一方是错，都应该用和平的手段来对话，民众和警察都不应该成为暴乱的牺牲品。

而从游戏的本身来说，内容的不完全、游戏性的缺乏都使得其很难称得上一款出色的作品，希望未来制作人可以不断改进，不断丰富它。

author: {'steamid': '76561198168567866', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1607104941}
review:
Una grandissima esperienza, lo attendevo da tempo, interessato al contesto e alle tematiche trattate nel gioco non ho esitato a prenderlo appena uscito. RIOT - Civil Unrest offre un esperienza davvero importante nella quale più di rendere uno strategico simulativo ci confrontiamo con le dinamiche caotiche di uno scontro di piazza; partiamo con l'idea di allontanare i manifestanti, ma qualcosa va storto,un gruppo non si vuole spostare,allora dopo un po' di tentativi utilizziamo la violenza e lanciamo dei lacrimogeni, a quel punto la situazione esplode e ci ritroviamo nel caos più totale, possiamo aggrapparci solo a noi stessi,dobbiam tirare fuori da quella situazione i nostri,allo stesso tempo dobbiamo riuscire a sfondare e spostare i manifestanti, come fare? a voi la scelta.  Il gioco tralaltro permettendoci di giocare sia da una che dall'altra parte ci fa capire come ogni posizione e giudizio sia relativo e ci consegna un importante lezione da applicare nella vita: prendere sempre il tempo di conoscere appieno la situazione prima di prendere scelte e dare giudizi.
consigliatissimo,bellissima iniziativa italiana, bravissimo Leonard Menchiari. Ottimo lavoro, da non abbandonare

author: {'steamid': '76561198212639239', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1662290872}
review:
오랜개발기간끝에 사람들의 출시재촉을 이기지 못하고 버그도 다 못 고친채 얼리 엑세스로 출시된 게임.
그 탓에 출시 되자마자 버그 때문에 부정적 리뷰가 많이 달려 버렸다.

주제는 시위대와 경찰의 충돌을 소재로 만들어져 매우 흥미로운 게임이다.
캠페인 또한 실제 사건을 배경으로 만들어져 어떤 부분은 플레이어에게 충격을 주기도 한다.
한국도 캠페인은 아니지만 커스텀에서 플레이 해볼 수 있다.

2D 픽셀게임이지만 엄청난 이펙트와 수많은 AI 때문에 결코 만만히 봐서는 안된다.
개발자들이 버그를 고치기 위해 많은 노력을 하고 있지만 아직 버그가 많이 남아있기 때문에 정식 출시후 사는 것을 추천한다.

난 일단 캠페인도 다 깼고 나름 재미있게 했으므로 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561198304786521', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1660051180}
review:
Global mode have arrived!

[spoiler] And it sucks [/spoiler]

You can not skip a level this make it that impossible buggy levels [spoiler] Battle of camel [/spoiler] which people have complained a since the beginning have still not been fixed and no you can not skip the level in global mode.

The controls feels cluncky and unatrual. You need to target every singel unit there is not group controll [spoiler]There is a radio where it sends all units to 1 area[/spoiler] there is game like prison architect that make it better and Total war where you can select mulitple units and you have a nice outline where they go and can change it.

The game is not the best looking and therefor needs to great gameplay and control and UI

Sadly this is not the case

There is a few great maps but the balance is totally off but that is fine the game is in EA

The bigger problem is the contol and UI intuitive and the biggest problem is that they havent implimented group control that is a bigger deal then you might think.

Lastly the game is in EA but they have already spent 3 years building the game after they recived 241% on indiegogo that means funding should have been sufficient when they deliver this buggy game and do not quickly address huge issues on a couple of levels that stop gameplay or atleast add a option too skip it then it show on there part a lack of awareness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039737394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1562960889}
review:
Игра про митинги , бунты и массовые протесты. 

Сразу отвечу на вопрос , покупать ? 
Да , но не всем, людям с не тактическим мышлением игра не дастся никогда , особенно за поллицию. 

+ игры 
1.Игра Полностью оправдывает свою цену 
2. Игра очень деномична (на сложности выше чем : Too Easy) 
3. Игра не надоедает , а на оборот хочеться её перепроходить раз за разом 
4.Игра очень маштабна , особенно в истории: Арабская весна
5.Игра Позволит вам выучить историю новейшего времени 
6. Можно играть как и за служителей закона как и за Протестующих 
7. Игра млжет быть как и пассивной так и агрессивной и динамичной 
- игры 
1. Не любовь к новичкам, игра не прощает ошибок на сложности выше Too Easy 
2.Странная система насилия 
Пример: 
Протестующие : 10 из 10 насилия, полиция: 3.1 из 10 
Поддержка народа: Протестующие +99
Полиция:+1 
???
3.Лаги на пк , много нпс = лаги 
4. Нету Мультиплеера *вощможно скоро будет * 
5. Слишком жёсткие протестующие на сложности выше чем Too Easy

review:
Première évaluation pour ma part. 

Le "pixel art" est à l'honneur dans ce jeu au service d'une ambiance urbaine bien restitué. Nous sommes plongés dans quelques unes des plus grosses manifestations des dernières années. Au choix vous pouvez incarner la police où les émeutiers. La prise en main est assez simple et la difficultée au rendez-vous. 

Il s'agit d'un jeu unique en son genre. Il nous plonge dans un contexte de lutte urbaine où les objectifs sont variés en fonction du camp que vous allez choisir. Contrôle de la foule, prise de position, destruction d'objectif... Vous avez le choix pour gérer la situation, par la force où par la voie pacifiste. Cependant en fonction de vos choix vous bénéficierez d'un bonus où d'un malus pour intervenir au prochaine événement. 

Les gros points positifs du jeu sont: -Principe d'incarner police/émeutier
                                                           -Gameplay différent d'une faction à l'autre
                                                           -Pixelart ! 
                                                           -Choix des armes, équipements
                                                           -Exigent au niveau de difficulté élevé

Les points négatifs: -Absence de multi (possible de jouer à deux sur le même écran)
                                 -Peu de contenu
                                 -Gameplay à paufiner (Ergonomie interface, maniabilité à revoir subtilement)

author: {'steamid': '76561198129653091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1550079625}
review:
Un juego que, a pesar de sus fallos técnicos que pueden resultar molestos pero no desmerecen la experiencia de juego tanto como podría parecer, representa de forma fiel los conflictos sociales de nuestro tiempo y lo caótico de estas experiencias para ambos lados.
En cuanto a las mecánicas del juego, en un primer comienzo pueden resultar algo abrumadoras, sin embargo en la última actualización añadieron un breve pero útil tutorial, hasta después de 11h y agotar el contenido descubrí cosas nuevas xD, y que enseña las mecánicas básicas.

-Una gran cantidad de escenarios, tres campañas basadas en hechos reales y actuales bien representados; aunque con algunos fallos de localización (en defensa de los desarrolladores cabe decir que se deben a una generación automática de las banderas y "skins" del juego). 

-Las posibilidades son casi infinitas, tras completar todas las capañas se presentan una serie de escenarios adicionales que ayudan a prolongar el contenido. Sin embargo la inmensidad de este juego reside en el modo [i] custom [/i] que nos permite utilizar cualquiera de los mapas existentes y alterar una gran cantidad de los factores. El contenido se abrirá más cuando añadan el editor, actualmente en beta, que nos permitirá crear y modificar los escenarios a nuestro gusto.

-Aunque nunca he sido muy fan del estilo pixel en este juego no está fuera de lugar ya que representa de forma curiosa el caos de un disturbio.

-No tiene multijador online, un gran fallo, estaría bastante bien la verdad. Esto junto con la falta de editor (PD: Aclarando esto, el juego "tiene" editor y se puede usar, pero no podrás jugar tus misiones ni compartirlas así que como si no hubiera, aunque están trabajando en ello) son algunos de los mayores fallos del juego pero son más debido a que esté en desarollo que fallos en sí del juego y seguro lo añadirán en un futuro no muy lejano.

En general es un gran juego, si estás dudando en comprarlo hazlo igualmente antes de que suba de precio ya que en su estado actual es totalmente disfrutable y si no siempre puedes dejarlo hasta que lo actualizen y arreglen sus fallos. Se puede disfrutar, es divertido, único y bastante realista en su temática. Yo lo recomiendo bastante si tienes 13€  y te gusta la política, los rts y te interesa la temática.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023054906', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1518407826}
review:
***EARLY ACCESS REVIEW***

A really unique look at some very recent history. The last decade and this one were amazing times in history, full of struggles that many of us were seperated from or maybe a little too young to completely understand. For this alone, I am really appreciative of this game.

The controls seem kind of... sticky. I'll be trying to set up a barricade and instead of forming a line, the cursor will only move people to a static blob. I'll be trying to get the media to focus on some cops dumping rubber bullets at my guys, and the cursor will just stay as the viewfinder. I'd have to click the camera again and activate it. Very frustrating.

I also experience, from time to time, the game freezing for no reason, then starting again. I don't know what causes this but it's a pain. The game is also prone to crashing at loading screens from time to time (call it one in three times, some times two in three). This is improving (one in four or five).

While the pixel art is a nice aesthetic, it can be very disorientating. It's almost TOO pixelated and can make it hard to figure out what is going on. Opposing forces are fairly east to spot at least, due to the character models moving and looking extremely different. The rebels are the hardest to make out what they're doing.

I praise the devs for constantly wanting feedback. There was a form that was opened every time you exited the game you could fill out regarding what you liked and didn't like. That seems to have been heeded as now the very helpful tutorial has been added. Before, I had no idea how to change from aggro to peaceful stances. Now I do and the game is much easier. The tutorials were also cool little levels too. Shows each side really well.

The gameplay, however, is almost cookie cutter re: missions; rebels or cops move or hold objective while pushing the other back with either non-violent or violent methods. Other than the media dynamic, there isn't a lot of variation. Either side does have some starkly different sklls and abilities to use, I mean that's great, but it doesn't really seem like the game has a great deal going on gameplay wise. I can see people feeling like they wasted their money on a short game that sometimes feels eerily like a mobile port despite not being one.

The map editor is a great idea. I don't know if online multiplayer is planned, but that would be fun maybe.

This game is in early access and shows a lot of promise, in terms of showing an interesting topic, but there's still a long way to go for a game that might be a tough sell due to some limited replayability. Ultimately, I look forward to the devs ironing out some of the bugs and maybe adding a little more content. Other than that, I've really enjoyed playing it, but I don't put a night aside to play it either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004097788', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1512955038}
review:
Alright, I've been following this game's development since the Brazilian riots of 2013 (a bit later I think). Couldn't wait for it to be made.

And it really seems it will be as good as I've been expecting. Of course, if developers keep working on it and our requests.

Pros: 
- The pixelart is gorgeous.
- Lots of different equipment and customization for your units.
- The stories and settings are outstanding. Was not expecting such great intros and actual "storylines". It really makes you think you are fighting for a cause, regardless of which side you pick.

Cons: (Well it's on Early Access. A couple tips for the devs)
- Tweak the learning curve. I failed miserably on the first level and then I won on the second try, and I've no idea what I did differently.
- I know the devs added tutorials, so that's great. Maybe a tutorial campaign? 
- FPS drops like crazy during chaotic riots. 
- Some physics issues (the water cannons blow people upwards like 20ft into the air. 

Bottom line it's actually quite fun, even in this early stage of dev. I'm really happy this is becoming a reality. Let's see how it holds up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198404855190', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1591196936}
review:
I was one of the many customers who followed the development of this game from its announcement way back when. So when it finally dropped on Early Access earlier this month, I immediately made the purchase. And unfortunately I kind of regret jumping into it so soon. The game is frustrating and not because of some high learning curve. The feedback is all but nonexistent. It's like you're trying to play the game, but the game won't budge. And that is especially the case when it comes to playing the rioters. 

It's a rare occasion when a game is so unplayable that it just makes me want to stop. It isn't fun to play. It's just very very frustrating. With all of that being said however, it's still in Early Access. As much as I don't like it as it is now, I still think that it has potential and the concept still has yet to be fully explored. A narrative that explores the underlying causes of the aforementioned 'civil unrest' would be alot better than some disembodies short "campaigns" that each give you a scenario and two sides to choose from. But of course the first and the most pertinent step, is to tune the gameplay mechanics. Then maybe it could become something great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054663623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1531305390}
review:
TL;DR at bottom

I honestly wish I didn't have to say this, but...
The game just isn't that great.
Before you rail into me, I'll at least name off some pros:
-Animations are smooth during cutscenes. The color choices are nice, and overall the game LOOKS good...... in most cases. More on that later.
-The game is at least... trying? It's certainly making some good things here and there.
-It finally came out at least. I'm surprised it even came out this year.
-The soundtrack is actually very well-done. Congrats to whoever did it, you did a superb job. Just wish your music was used more often rather than restricted to cutscenes.

Now for the unfortunate cons.
-The animations can become very cluttered and the whole screen can become messy and disastrous. I know that a riot is MEANT to be chaotic, but it's hard to explain the exact problem. Instead, I'll give an example.
During the Arab Spring riots, at the last mission, the police and rioters duke it out. Rioters are all aggressive, police have lethal weapons, etc. This is meant to be the massive climax.
Instead the end result is a complete and whole inability to even accomplish anything. The only way I managed to beat this stage was by breaking the game itself, even moreso than the game already is. I tried shooting tear gas and smoke and advancing slowly, but all the police retreat (there's no way to set formations for all units except with the radio, which just puts all units on top of each other. Think if in Total War you tried putting all your archers on ONE place rather than spread them out).
I then also tried being lethal to disperse the crowd, but the handguns do jackshit, the tank does one massive lethal shot and then all other shots from the tank do nothing (not even running over protesters does anything, I think it's a glitch), and the shotguns are so ineffective at dispersing the units that it's stupid.

-The rioters are far too easy and the police are far too hard. The rioters can practically just put their hands up and sit down and the cops just simply can't do anything about it when you're playing as the rebels, and during aggressive riots the rioters just simply toss things at the cops and they continously retreat, not employing any tactics that you'd actually expect to keep a formation.
And when playing as the cops, there is no way to improve morale except through the radio (which barely does anything anyway). Your units will often begin retreating at crucial moments, and it's damn near impossible to get much things of substance done during the very hectic parts.
For example:
In one of the Indignagos riots, there's a bunch of miners with fireworks launchers and rocks. You have only 6 officers to disperse a crowd of 40. These 6 all have rubber bullet rifles.
Now, IN REALITY, this would be fine. The units would hang back and shoot and their firing on the crowd would disperse them EVENTUALLY, or totally derail everything and reinforcements would be called in (which you can't do anyway, so what's the point).
INSTEAD, the recharge rate of these rifles is so long that there's really nothing you can do about the rioters tossing rocks at you and shooting rockets at you. Instead your men just stand there and take it until they eventually run away and you lose the mission. I eventually beat it by glitching out the rioters by just sending my men as high as they could go on the map, sending them all the way to the right, and waiting. I ended up doing this very often in a lot of police scenarios.

on another note for the drastic power difference between cops and rioters: cops can't call in reinforcements, rioters can. The men you start the match with as the cops are the only men you got and if just ONE unit runs away, the whole game is pretty much over.
However, as the rioters, you can consistently call in new units.

On top of all this, lethal weapons do almost nothing to disperse a crowd. During the Arab Spring riots where the crowd is immensely violent and hostile, I decided that, realistically, I shouldn't even bother using tear gas and smoke. I already tried doing it before in previous riots and just ended up failing miserably, so I decided to go fully lethal.
The result? We all retreated due to cooldown times and an inability to continue and focus fire. Oh, and friendly fire. I can understand when a unit has a shotgun and hits a friendly unit in front of him, but a sniper rifle hitting a friendly unit? Who's just meters before him? Really? How bad of a shot can you be?


Last gripe is that the game ends up looking like a total mess. I tried watching it in spectator mode so that I could probably just view how the cops would fight against the rioters, and maybe even see if the beatdown and arrest animations held any weight, since I barely saw any cops end up truly hammering down on a rioter, and all I saw were rioters tossing rocks at cops and the cops running away because of it.

Oh, and final gripe: performance and bugs. I have had the game crash about 6 times and had to restart my computer once due to the game locking my screen at one point. There are also numerous instances of the UI disappearing and the graphics completely fizzing out. It's nuts.


Honestly, I'm disappointed, but think that with more work this game could become immensely wonderful. I'm definitely open to speaking to one of the developers about the issues of the game, if they're willing to listen.

TL;DR
An overall pretty and well-sounding and probably well-intentioned game that results in being a mess that isn't really interesting to watch nor to play, with absurd difficulty ranges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006641134', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1513724453}
review:
Me interesó este juego desde sus comienzos, por su pixel art y temática que me pareció interesante y una idea que hasta ahora no se había retratado.

Ahora lo compré para apoyar al desarrollador. Pero lamentablemente no lo puedo recomendar (aún), y es que tiene muchas carencias y defectos que entorpecen el resultado...paso a explicar:

1_Pixel Art: Muy Bueno, con efectos de luces y sombras.
2_Temática: Original y única.
3_Interfaz(UI): Muy mala, tosca, confusa y para nada intuitiva. El inventario tampoco se salva mucho.
4_Jugabilidad: Terrible! el grupo por momentos se torna incontrolable y desesperante.
5_Dirección: Las introducciones están bien, pero están mal direccionadas, ya que hace unos zooms exagerados y con el pixel art hay que tener cuidado, ya que al acercar mucho la cámara solo se ven cuadrados, la cámara al temblar tampoco ayuda mucho.

En fin, creo que el desarrollador debería darle otro enfoque, mejor control y más intuitivo. También se me ocurre que podría hacer que controlemos solo a uno de los manifestantes/policía con un control total, y que éste sea como un líder que motive a los demás; que tenga sus habilidades y armas personalizables.

La IA está bastante bien, de hecho cuando se elige el modo "Espectador" actúa de una manera creíble y aceptable, por lo cual si controlaríamos a solo una persona los demás podrían reaccionar tranquilamente bien.

El juego tiene potencial y si se pulen sus defectos y se modifican algunas cosas aquí y allá, puede llegar a ser un juego muy bueno, sino, creo que pasará sin pena ni gloria.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I was interested in this game since its inception, for its pixel art and theme that I found interesting and an idea that had not been portrayed until now.

Now I bought it to support the developer. But unfortunately I can not recommend it (yet), and it has many shortcomings and defects that enotorpecen the result ... step to explain:

1_Pixel Art: Very good, with effects of lights and shadows.
2_Temática: Original and unique.
3_Interface (UI): Very bad, rough, confusing and not at all intuitive. The inventory is not much saved either.
4_Jugability: Terrible! the group at times becomes uncontrollable and desperate.
5_Dirección: The introductions are good, but are poorly addressed, since it makes a few exaggerated zooms and pixel art must be careful, because when you zoom in on the camera only look square, the camera does not help much shaking.

Anyway, I think the developer should give it another focus, better control and more intuitive. It also occurs to me that it could make us control only one of the protesters / police with total control, and that this is like a leader who motivates others; Have your skills and weapons customizable.

The AI ​​is quite good, in fact when you choose the mode "Spectator" acts in a credible and acceptable way, so if we control only one person, others could react calmly well.

The game has potential and if its flaws are polished and some things are modified here and there, it can become a very good game, but, I think it will happen without pain or glory.

review:
TLDR: The art and sound are very impressive, but the gameplay mechanics are too clunky to enjoy.

After years of development and setbacks the game was finally released. I was so excited, I went to humble bundle and got my old code to redeem it and was expecting something great! The cutscenes and sound design are really good, I remember the twitter pictures of them breaking glass and recording ambient sounds from long ago. But the actual gameplay is boring and unnecessarily complicated because of the awkward mechanics of units. It may appear that you are pushing a crowd back but one or two people can get stuck  on the outside and stop your momentum. It doesn't actually feel like abilities do anything, molotovs, grenades, diy explosives, flashbangs... are weak to say the least.

After all the time and effort put into the game I cant really find the same to put into this review. It's not as good as it should have been. I'll look at it again as more patches come around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095829853', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1668799224}
review:
[Atualização 26/01/19]

Agora tem um editor de fases imbutido! 

[Atualização 05/03/18]

Ver os devlogs e os changelog reforçam tudo o que eu disse sobre o jogo até agora. Talvez por estar encantado com o RIOT, talvez por ter dormido pouco, com certeza por ter esquecido de tomar meus remédios, eu acabei deixando algumas coisas passarem.

Existiam bugs bem irritantes, principalmente com itens arremessáveis. Você mandava alguém tacar um molotov, um rojão, pedras, etc. e a coisa simplesmente não ia. O que é bem frustrante, pois esses itens tem o aspecto tático bem importante de fazer o B.O.G.A (Buraco Operacional de Grande Acesso)  dos polícias cicatrizar de tanto medo. O rojão era absurdamente ruim, já que você acabava acertando mais gente sua do que no B.O.G.A  dos polícias. Mudou, agora é uma delícia ver policiais recuando com o B.O.G.A incandescente.

Outra coisa extremamente irritante era a massaroca de pixel que os manifestantes viravam, agora ganharam contraste com mais detalhes detalhes e eu sinto que a câmera deu um zoom out mais do que necessário! 

Mas ainda assim os devs precisam fazer alguma coisa pra deixar o jogo mais intuitivo. Eu disse intuitivo, não disse fácil. Ok? Os tutoriais precisavam ser expandidos e apresentar a mecânica com mais riqueza, até agora eu não sei como usar a câmera fotográfica. 

E, por favor, não façam nenhuma fase com os protestos brasileiros de 2013. Vai ser fácil demais ganhar. Só colocar o item "national soccer team jersey" que a polícia vai vir até trazer refrigerante e abraços pra você. Enquanto isso, uns poucos NPCs com bandeiras apanham da massa com a camisa verde e amarela que grita "sem violência!",ou "sem partido! sem partido!". A única DLC cabível pra esse caso seria um spin-off do Shadow of the Colossus, no qual um índio gigante acorda, coça o saco, faz um xixi e volta pra cama.  

Um beijo no B.O.G.A da polícia e no seu também!

********************************

Esperei muito tempo por esse jogo e posso dizer que valeu a pena! 
Existem alguns pontos negativos que eu irei falar primeiro, pois tenho mais coisas boas pra dizer. Vamo lá.

É um jogo em early access, vocês já sabem o que esperar. Não adianta chorar todo putrício quando esbarrar em coisas improvisadas, soluções provisórias (menus, principalemente). Os controles, interface e td mais são bem complicadinhos no começo. Não por se tratar de um novo Arma pixelado, mas pq falta ambientação pro jogador que nem tutorial tinha. Colocaram o da polícia h, por exemplo. 

Isso. Dá pra jogar de gambé ou de "Petralha-Coxinhento-Aborteiro freestyle-Gayzista-Maconheiro"

Os devs são honestos e direitos. Não ficaram criando hype no desenvolvimento, que levou quatro anos. Atualizações frequentes e relevantes. 

Mas o melhor do jogo, pra mim, são as fases e cenários. Todos REAIS! Todos os protestos retratados no jogo aconteceram no nosso plano astral. As cutscenes, apesar da baixa qualidade do vídeo, são beeem legais. 

É um jogo muito inteligente, mas não é pedante. A coisa toda é muito bem amarradinha e com sacadas geniais. Por exemplo, quem já participou de movimento estudantil ou milita em organizações (principalmente da esquerda, creio) sabe bem o problema que são as bandeiras. Aliás, quem saiu de casa nos protestos de 2013 deve lembrar disso tb. 

Quando mais bandeiras num protesto, menos militantes independentes engrossando as fileiras. E o jogo reflete isso. A ideia de usar postagem em redes sociais como um  item foi sensacional. Os devs foram fundo e fizeram direito a lição de casa. Detalhe: fechou o jogo, abre uma janela de navegador com um questionário pedindo feedback. Lindo isso. 

Espero que os meninos saibam aproveitar o potencial gritante dessa pepitinha.
