author: {'steamid': '76561198054776346', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1512626820}
review:
Four long years I waited for this game and what I got was a mixed bag. The developers remained silent for a long portion of the games development, pushing the game back every year for [b]three[/b] years. All while feeding us information on the game with crumbs of short bursts of PR on their [url=http://riotsimulator.com/category/uncategorized/]official blog[/url] and the steam store. The community was having its own riot on the forums, begging for even the smallest amount of information in a sea of conspiracies that they took the money and ran from their [url=https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/riot--4#/]Indiegogo[/url] campaign (which has yet to be updated. 12/6/2017)

But what about the game?

When I started up the game I was initially surprised. Both factions played differently, however the road to victory is always won the same way. The AI is easily exploitable as you can simply push the other faction off the point so long as you don't do anything violent. My favorite map involved a bridge; I had my shields enter a defensive stance and simply [i]walk[/i] to the other side of the bridge. I did this for every mission, but only finding the resolution to finish the "No Tav" campaign. However, even this tactic wasn't easy as the cops have the tendency to run away from the battle and ignore orders, forcing you to restart the mission.

Rioters were by far the most fun while still being on the same road of victory as the police. The easiest way to win is to send a group right up to the cops, plop their butts on the ground and tell them reach for the sky as if God himself came down from the Heaven's. Cops will tremble in fear at the sight of Samantha's badly done nail polish on full display. All other items and abilities are useless when compared to the sky-hug tactic.

Speaking of items and abilities-

Police have the ability to choose between [b]ten[/b] different batons and a wide array of useless items that are the same for every officer class. Armor and weapons increase the cost of officers and their deployment, however there is no clear reason as to why you would pay attention to your cash reserves since you are given a seemingly endless budget. The large selection of grenade launchers, weapons, flags and armor have no visible stats and don't seem to actually matter. I was able to cut my gameplay time in half when I figured this out.

Is it good?

What you get is a mobile game with some pretty pixel art and some tear jerking cutscenes. Even after four years this holiday ham is still undercooked and kicking. The word for this game is "Potential," as it still has the potential to become the perfectly seasoned, oak  roasted ham it set out to be. So long as the dev's are willing to throw it back into the oven.

UPDATE: The year is now 2020. No updates have been posted to the forums in years. The game seems to be dead.

Since this game has minimal gameplay and a long development cycle, I can tell the [i]research trips[/i] the dev's took were just vacations.

This game was abandoned on the doorsteps of a level editor update, and nobody answered the door.

Update 2021 : The devs have [url=https://i.imgur.com/Hl0vOvv.png]sold[/url] out their website for League of Legends boosting

author: {'steamid': '76561198071096719', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1534658281}
review:
[h1] 양측 모두 지치는 시위 현장 게임	[/h1]

RIOT이라는 단어 그대로 시위에 관한게임 입니다.
플레이어는 시위에 참여하거나 시위를 진압해야 됩니다.


플레이 방법은 자신의 진영에서 실제 시위현장에서 이용하는 아이템으로 상대의 진영을 붕괴시키고 목표를 달성하는 간단한 게임입니다.메스컴을 이용해 추가적인 점수를 흭득도 가능합니다. 

괜히 들떠서 화염병만 미친듯이 던지면 오히려 경찰들을 자극해 쉴드에 뚝배기가 깨지는 사태가 발생할 수 있으니 신중히 아이템을 사용해야 합니다.


-장점: 8비트 주제에 실제 시위현장의 느낌을 잘 살렸다는 것.

제작진들이 실제 시위현장을 조사했고, 스토리 역시 실제 있었던 운동으로 진행됩니다.
내가 시위대가 되면은 경찰 욕을 수십번 하고  또 경찰이 되면 시위대를 욕하게 되는 아이러니함을 보면 제작진들의 의도대로 잘 반영된 것 같습니다.


-단점: 컨텐츠 부족, 자잘한 버그들.

"얼리엑세스니깐 버그도 있고 컨텐츠도 부족하겠지."
라고 하기엔 이 게임의 개발기간이 너무 깁니다. 계속 거듭되는 출시 지연 끝에 나온 게임 치고는 스토리도 4개 뿐이고 기초적인 것에서도 버그가 일어납니다.

스토리를 다 깨고 나면 결국은 차후 스토리나 창작마당을 기다려야 되는데 창작마당은 아직 오픈하지도 않았고, 또 얼마나 기다려야 새로운 스토리가 나올까 하는 걱정이 있습니다.

지금 사기에는 조금 이른 게임이기는 합니다. 그래도 게임은 나름 탄탄하니 정가에 구매하기긴 보단 조금 내려갈 때 사시기 바랍니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273572761', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1512628451}
review:
（2017-12-7）现在这款游戏并不值得这个价钱，所以我给出的是不推荐。鉴于尚处在抢先体验版本，所以建议各位先行观望几次更新。
这款游戏想要表现的场景和理念都十分具有创新性，可以感受到作者想要引领玩家去进行某种思考。
但是！目前还有很多很多致命的问题：且不说没有BGM，游戏性几乎没有，指令不清，没有教程，在窗口模式下会无法显示边缘文字，角色会被人流冲到无法移动的位置。入手前请仔细考虑。

review:
「街頭警備の奴ら昼寝でもしてたのか!」～『人狼 -JIN-ROH』(2000年・日本)

長きに渡る冷戦が終結し、人類の進歩と成長が謳われた21世紀。しかし現実に我々を待ち受けていたのは、圧制と暴力の応酬であった。市民労働者諸君、今こそ立ち上がれ、悪しき世を変えるのは我々の声と、力によって叶えられるのだ。

非対称リアルタイム暴動RTS。暴徒か警官隊のリーダーとして、政府に要求を呑ませたり、治安を維持したりしよう。
暴徒は人数に勝る一方、警官隊のように統制をとるのは難しく、銃火器はあまり使えません。
一方警官隊も、盾や銃、ガスなどの装備に優れるも、あんまりやり過ぎるとマスメディアから叩かれたり、逆上した暴徒に物理的に叩かれたりします。少ない手勢でどうやって検挙するかが戦略のカギとなります。

今はまだ未調整だったり、不慮のクラッシュが発生することが時折あるけど、それを差っ引いても魅力に溢れる良いゲームです。スクショを見てビビビっと来たら買い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027226641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1512574706}
review:
我关注这个游戏很长时间了。比起它的艺术风格，我更期待的是游戏对现实事件的描述——游戏中的暴动和骚乱都有实据可依：比如说阿拉伯之春，意大利的NoTAV游行。

游戏中的阵营分为政府的武装力量（武警）和示威群众。我在Challenge难度下打通了NoTAV和阿拉伯之春两个章节，而这也是在现实中政府对示威活动的反应截然不同的两次事件：NoTAV游行是由于政府新上线的高速列车项目会造成环境污染而由民众自发组织的抗议运动。警民双方在事件中都保持了相对克制，抗议活动以民众的失败和TAV项目的实施而告终。反之，在阿拉伯之春中，民众的诉求是政治改革，游行的实施阶段有第三方的介入，政府的对策也从微暴力/克制变为了引入军队力量/镇压示威活动/开枪维持秩序，最终结局以政府的妥协收尾。

在游戏中，政府的武装力量分为三种：带防暴盾的警察负责隔离人流，持短棍的警察负责抓捕和突进，配备特殊装备（比如催泪瓦斯和胡椒喷雾）的警察负责驱散。其中，每种警察都可以使用暴力手段（如殴打和使用实弹武器）——这才是游戏的精髓。警察如果施暴，作为抗议者的AI会判定警察有攻击性，从而用暴力手段来反击。游戏引入了舆论系统，如果作为警察依靠暴力镇压：比如开枪或者殴打，舆论会偏向示威者一方，从而在下一局游戏中增强示威者的反制力量。我觉得这才是制作者真正想引起玩家思考的一点：是否需要暴力介入？如果是的话，在何时以何种手段来实施暴力？对暴力的结果能否承受？

然而，就抗议者方面而言，游戏的玩法就很苍白了。抗议者占绝对的人群优势，作为AI的警察也不敢轻易施暴，只要控制示威队伍组成人墙缓慢推进，就能解决一切问题。

游戏的问题还很多：扮演警察时，玩家的的控制常常会失灵，实弹武器甚至会射杀友军。游戏缺乏教程引导，只能靠玩家的一步步摸索，更多时候，一场游戏的胜利靠的是运气。作为游戏一大卖点的“舆论系统“也不甚完善，一局游戏结束后，只会提示”在下场游戏中，警方会有更多优势“，然而这种优势并没有被明确表现出来。

[b]这个游戏有着很大的潜力，游戏的题材非常独特，也有着代入感极强的音乐和吸引人的像素艺术风格。然而仅就2017.12.7这个版本而言，它更像是一个“概念“而非游戏：游戏的恶性Bug很多，玩法也不太完善。然而为了把这个”概念“转化为一个多数人可接受，并且能玩的下去的游戏，制作组还有很长的路要走，也因此，单就现阶段而言，我不太推荐这款游戏。[b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198010212261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1594166610}
review:
At the moment I can't recommend this game nor favor it.  but this isn't really a review either.
I am really hyped for this game and I am glad it is finally here but now that it is here some things SERIOUSLY need to be addressed for this game to seriously work.

1. a single squad of tacticals of 12 guys should not be able to push out an entire mob(And I mean all riot mob squads) that is SITTING in their position, and even if they tried I am pretty fucking sure the mobs would give more resistance than they do in this game, regardless of peaceful mode.  Rioter hold position? broken and useless don't bother.

2.  The Police AI is overly aggressive,  with how aggressive the Police AI is? you might as well give them assault rifles and tell them to gun down the rioters.  because every riot I've played so far the police have killed 12-40 people CONSISTENTLY.  so far I've played 6 riots, and have redone 2 of them at least twice.  half of these riots I have done nothing to provoke such brutal crackdowns, if the AI is working off of a provocation system like its implied it is, it has some serious faults.

3. a 1 man thick line of riot officers should not be able to repel a riot of 600 people.  NOTAV A32 Highway mission, that is all the police AI needs to do to push me off of the occupy zone and KEEP me off of it until the clock ticks down.  they don't even need the CS Gas grenades from the ballistic teams but thats an infuriating icing on the cake.

4. Rocks, and molotovs, seemingly do NOTHING.  Throw rocks? the cops will ignore it. until it is you who are the cops.  throw molotovs? they'll ignore it.

5. Molaax doesn't seem to hinder the gas effects at all, gas still causes an immediate rout of the riot group, who will run all the way back to the friendly side of the area and then walk back depending on their tactics mode.  wasting precious time and giving the cops a ridiculous advantage on top of the ones they already have.

I will update this as I go on, its less of a review and more of what may need changing.  some of this code is still hot so I can't judge it too harshly.

The menu also is a huge mess when it comes to the different modes. I still haven't found Journalism mode, and 404 mode crashes while loading. Sloppily done, and hopefully they'll overhaul and fix the immense bugs and confusing edit features before they even consider calling it finished.

review:
Ich kann mir nicht ersparen meinen Senf dazu abzugeben so sehr ich auch wollte. Dieser Leonard hat die Leute klassisch über den Tisch gezogen indem er allen quasi eine Luft Packung verkauft hat. Er hat die Community BELOGEN im vollen Bewusstsein darüber, das dieses sogenannte Produkt hier nie das wird was versprochen wurde. In so manch einem Land ist das Betrug, aber auf Steam ist sowas inzwischen Alltag. 

Vorweg, das hier ist KEIN Spiel. Ihr steuert praktisch NICHTS. Ihr gebt Befehle, ihr klickt auch hier und da, doch nichts wird davon wirklich umgesetzt. Von Release ab bis heute hat sich im Gameplay selber GAR NICHTS entwickelt. Das Spiel war early acces und auch dazu ist nicht wirklich ein nennenswerter Unterschied zu ziehen zur "vollen" Version heute. Es gibt praktisch keinen bewertbaren Bereich weil ihr eben nichts tun könnt. Daher weiß ich auch nicht was ich hier als gelungen bewerten soll und da ich dafür Geld bezahlt hab, ein ganz klares NEIN. KEINE SPIELE VON LEONARD oder MERGE GAMES. Absolutes Tabu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079623191', 'num_games_owned': 1726, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1584290662}
review:
What you have is a very good attempt at a game that not a lot of people have done (to my knowledge besides SWAT). There are problems with this game obviously, like frames dropping, glitchy menus at times and NO TUTORIAL. However, when you get down to it, understand how it works and look pass all the faults, you have a good and interesting game to play. You play as either the Riot Police or Rebels. Both sides have different things they can deploy in the mission. From batons and smoke grenades, to live ammunition and flashbangs to scatter the protestors. Rebels have molotovs, sheer numbers and the ability to combat the police with overpowering force. Missions can be done violently or non-violently. Doing things violently and causing damage as well as injury or death can be hindering, as if it is to bad, the opposite side gets a little more support. However, doing things violently means it is a tad bit easier. All units are squad based units (Meaning you don't select them officer by officer.) There are also a small array of equipment things you can equip like flashbangs, smoke grenades or molotov cocktails. 

However, the faults come into play when there are tons of people on the screen as it causes lag and makes the game move slower and even stutter. To be honest, there aren't a whole lot of other units for both sides either. And as I said, some of the menus are a little glitched with some of them being more laggy and sometimes the actions don't go through as expected. There isn't a great deal of variation in terms of gear selection as it is more like "Which type of baton do you want" or "Do you want smoke, rubber bullets, live bullets, or CS gas?" and that is it. 

But the game is still in early access and it does have a lot of potential. Watch youtube though so you can learn the game before you buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198177830341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1513305216}
review:
Premessa: Avercene di giochi così..Detto questo però..

Gioco che ho aspettato spasmodicamente, per le tematiche trattate e per l'aspetto visivo scelto.
Quest'ultimo non ha tradito le mie aspettative; l'impronta artistica con 'sta pixel art zozza e minimalista esce subito, e ad oggi, purtroppo, è l'unico aspetto che funziona. Insieme al reparto sonoro.

PRO: 
-Un gioco che tratta un tema così sensibile andrebbe premiato a priori.
-Per gli amanti della pixel art una goduria
-Scenari reali
-Sonoro eccellente
-l'idea (non la realizzazione) su cui si basa la meccanica dei gruppi è buona.

CONS:
-Gameplay rigido, le azioni che facciamo compiere ai gruppi avvengono in differita, un po' per il framerate funesto, un po' per la scelta simulativa degli sviluppatori credo. Sta di fatto che non si percepisce l'azione in tempo reale, in un contesto giustamente caotico, che ti spinge a prendere decisioni velocemente, sei costretto a vedere al replay l'azione che hai impartito al tuo gruppo (mentre nel frattempo accade altro..). Fondamentalmente non si ha la percezione di "comandare" un gruppo, bensì di indirizzarlo, e questo, almeno per me, fa perdere sul versante dell'immersione.
-Assenza di scorciatoie da tastiera
-Assenza di poter far "caricare semplicemente" il gruppo. Sarò terra terra; un gioco così, aldilà della denuncia sociale, avrebbe potuto avere un gameplay divertente e adrenalinico. Così non è, almeno allo stato attuale.
-Crash e rallentamenti anche su pc di fascia media (ho una 970)  (risolvibili ma li menziono per correttezza)

Ora, il gioco dopo 3,4 anni di sviluppo e mille vicissitudini è in early access, ci sta, non è questo il problema, quello che mi fa provare quel filo di delusione è la meccanica con cui è stato costruito, sarebbe stata un'avventura grafica, una graphic novel, un gioco arcade coi controcazzi, invece è un rts che chiede la sufficienza.

Onore per averci provato, spero di modificare questa recensione in futuro.

review:
I guess it all comes down to what Early Access Alpha games are to you. If you're fine with buying and investing in a nice idea, buy this game. For me, the current state of the game should only be available to Kickstarters/Backers, not to steam customers.

Unlike other reviewers I had never heard of this game until today. The video on the storepage and 2 minutes on twitch made me buy it right away, what an interesting concept. But apart from the concept and the atmosphere (the sound effects are top-notch) this game does not deliver in any way, even though it is in early access.

There is zero explanation for anything. No tutorial, no description of the different equipment for your units, no indicators what is actually happening during the riot, nothing. Just a lot of chaos which ends in random clicking and hoping for the best. There is some kind of "wiki" which should explain some gameplay features to you, call me an idiot, I didn't understand what I was looking at and neither do others if you check the forums. 
So I had no idea what I was doing and won the first 2 stages on medium difficulty playing as the police anyway, don't ask me how. 

On top of that, huge fps drops continuously occured and made the second stage almost unplayable. I understand that there might be a lot going on on the screen, but the game shouldn't be that demanding, especially because the scenery does not change during gameplay and its pixelart presentation. A GTX 960 4GB and an i7 6700k with 16GB of Ram should be able to run this game just fine.

My experiences from other EAA titles make me doubt that all problems, missing features and bugs with this game (short duration of each scenery, tutorials, descriptions, performance, buggy units and more) get ironed out. If they will ever do that, I'd happily buy the game again, but for now I'm asking for a refund, cause I have a strange feeling that after almost 4 years of development the devs are not going to invest that much time to turn this game into something it could be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993301050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1512583218}
review:
Selbst für eine Early Access noch viel zu früh. Dem spiel fehlt jede Anleitung oder ein Tutorial Zu Steuerung, Das Spiel lässt sich nicht intuitiv spielen. Angefangen beim Hud das statt von 1 bis 8 aufgeteilt ist, findet man Wirre zahlen reihen und Pfeiltasten vor. Das Hud ist sehr unaufgeräumt.
Nun zu Steuerung. Man kann so viel klicken wie man will. Aber der Mob Bewegt sich kein stück vor Richtung Polizei anderes rum genauso wenig. Ob Aggressiv oder nicht die Bewegungen sind meist willkürlich. Auch ist das er kennen der Ziele nicht sehr einfach.
Angenommen wir spielen auf der Seite der Demonstranten. Wenn diese nun in dem aggressiven Zustand versetzt werden können diese mit Gegenständen werfen. Molotov Steine und co. Davon bekommt man nur wenig mit.
Man wählt die Gewünschte Wurf Waffe über die Pfeiltasten aus und dann klickt man an die Stelle wo da ganze hinfliegen soll. Das passiert aber auch sehr Radom mäßig nur selten sind Steine Flaschen und co dort angekommen wo sie es sollten. Und genau das macht dann kein Spaß.
Angenommen ich habe 4 Gruppen die ich steuern kann. Dann erwarte ich das diese auch auf meine Befehle reagieren. Ganz egal ob man sie dann zusammenschlägt oder Festnimmt. Wenn ich mit 1000 Demonstranten aufmarschieren und nur 140 Polizisten da sind dann erwarte ich das meine Leute die alle Platt machen.  
Stattdessen wirkt die ganze Steuerung eher so als Könne man eine grobe Richtung vorgeben und den Rest entscheidet der Mob für sich. Ich erwarte aber wie in jedem Echtzeit Strategie spiel unteranderem auch. Das wenn ich meine Truppen an die Frontschicke das sie da auch hingehen und sich dann schlagen. Im echten Leben ist das nicht anderes.
 Vielleicht sollten die Entwickler eine Anzeige einbauen an der man sehen kann wie viel macht man hat. Dass man zum Beispiel erst einmal die Stimmung aufheizen muss bis einem die Gruppen blind vertrauen und genau das machen was ich will. Gerade bei der Polizei sollte es so sein das die Von Anfang an gehorchen.
Das Spiel sollte einem die Möglichkeit geben mit allerhärte vorgehen zu können. Und sei es nur das Die Polizei in einer Reihe vorgeht mit schilden alles nieder prügelt und mit Pfefferspray alles platt macht gefolgt vom Wasser Werfer.

Naja wie man mit bekommt das Spiel ist noch zu unausgereift eine Vollständige Kontrolle seiner Gruppen fehlt und die Steuerung ist katastrophal. 

Habe es nach 1ner stunde leider wieder umgetauscht weil der anfänglich spaß schnell verflogen ist

author: {'steamid': '76561198064056645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1518112172}
review:
Dopo un'interminabile attesa, ecco Riot, gioco Made in Italy (credo quasi interamente) che sicuramente propone qualcosa di nuovo, la tematica delle rivolte urbane.
Non voglio essere troppo severo, visto il prezzo sicuramente abbordabile, quindi:

-concept: geniale, secondo me molto intrigante

-realizzazione del concept: si e no, la resa ancora non soddisfa visti i numerosi bug, l'assenza di un vero tutorial, per non parlare del fatto che il giocatore si trova spesso a non capire cosa stia davvero accadendo..

-grafica: adoro i giochi con interfaccia nostalgica, personalmente non do troppa importanza all'assetto grafico ma.. davvero, si poteva fare meglio, a volte troppo confusionario, soprattutto l'hud appare ancora estremamente caotico

-gameplay e comandi: qui davvero il gioco ha grosse lacune, ho capito che il gioco vuole richiamare le caotiche atmosfere della guerriglia urbana, ma in questo modo davvero non si capisce nulla, risulta complesso intuire la giusta azione da eseguire, o a volte viceversa tutto sembra estramamente semplice.. troppo. i comandi sono un'aspetto che ancora ho capito poco (mea culpa?), sicuramente aiuterebbe se il gioco fosse leggermente piu' lento. Altra grossa pecca e' la telecamera, decisamente scomoda

-suono: discreto, ci sono veri cori dei rioters, e la musica merita molto

-longevita': per ora non altissima, ma tenendo conto del multiplayer anche sotto questo aspetto qualcosa si recupera

in conclusione, tenendo conto che si tratta di un early access, sento di consigliarlo agli amanti del gioco indipendente, visto il prezzo ridotto e la speranza di vedere presto un prodotto finito degno delle aspettative

PS: con quello che c'avete messo per farlo uscire qualcosa di meglio potevate partorirlo.. ma io ancora spero..

author: {'steamid': '76561197995281359', 'num_games_owned': 1505, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1512630371}
review:
So I've waited for a very long time for this game, I bought it back in February, 2013 I'll just let that sink in.

I'm underwhelmed at this point, the game is great in theory. The pixel art so far is 7-9 out of 10. The music is pretty dope for the game and I'm happy with it. I've only played through one side of one senario (rioters) but there are about 30 other missions for me to play, so maybe another 3.5 hours of single player content (not that bad) as well as multiplayer which I haven't touched yet because I barely know how to play honestly. There was no tutorial or even key guide readily avalible just hey play this game. Don't get me wrong I hate it when a game holds my hand but I would have liked at least a click to continue key guide/explanation of how everything works besides having to go into options to figure stuff out on my own.

So all in all I'm happy with the progress made, I was expecting something different but hopefully this will develope more as time goes on. For now, I'd say if you have the money go for it but there are better games to spend (money) it on at this point in time.



(also waiting to hear how exactly I'm getting the soundtrack that I pre-ordered)

(disapointed to not see a credits option so I can easily check if all my perk rewards were fulfilled)

review:
https://youtu.be/EwmJmygDM_M
Gameplay et découverte du jeu ( Tournage tard dans la nuit d'où ma petite voix )
RIOT - Civil Unrest est un jeu de simulateur d'émeute dans lequel vous pouvez incarner soit les manifestants soit les forces de l'ordre, vous pouvez remporter les parties pacifiquement où en usant de la force, vous pouvez même tirer à balles rééls sur les manifestants avec les forces de l'ordre.
Utilisez les réseaux sociaux pour garnir le nombre de manifestants, balancez pétards et cocktails molotoves sur les forces de l'ordre et bien plus encore.
Quelques soucis dans l'interface pour choisir l'équipement des émeutiers, rien de méchant car je pense que ce sera régler très prochainement ( Impossible de choisir le mégaphone qui interfère avec le bouton retour ) 
Un jeu avec un potentiel énorme, il est jouable en multijoueur local de 2 à 4 joueurs, dommage que le Online n'est pas présent ! peut-être plus tard ? je l'éspère !

review:
Crashes a lot however it is release day for early access.

Has the potential to be a very enjoyable little strategy game with elements of mayhem.

So far only played as the rioters and they need to fix the custom games out, as when you play with "Single Horde" there is nobody there and the police insta-win.

Looking forward to how this progresses and I hope they continue to develop it to true completion.

Will edit as time goes on.

First Impression: Good.

EDIT (one day later).

Tried to play this a little more and I feel that what is going on in the Riots is unclear, the units are unresponsive and become stuck at times unable to act, rendering them useless. 

The way to win seems to be just throwing bodies at the police (as Rioters) in a peaceful way as when they turn aggressive there is no real combat... I think the game would benefit HEAVILY if you were able to have the option of an all out battle instead of people running in and out, that being said I suppose it IS going for realism. 

I feel slightly less optimistic now as I did yesterday having given it another couple of hours. Optimisation is horrific at the moment. 

More edits to come after awaiting updates or BETA stage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057829654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1512594619}
review:
Look i've waited for this game since September 2015 and here i can honestly say that it should not have released in early acces. The visuals are great and the experience is great. Gameplay is enjoyable and exciting. 

However, I am EXTREMELY disappointed with the optimization. I can run Arma 3 with 25 to 30 fps and this game on highest is 30 fps at the laggiest speed possible it will jump from 30 fps to 1 fps in a millisecond. I have even ran it at lowest settings and it still jumps from 30 to 1 fps every frame. It is not ready to play yet.

Im actually enjoying my experience with the game as soon as i get over the lag frustration, sadly until the lagged fps and optimization is fixed, i cannot recommend this game. I waited 2 years and they release it in early access. There is never a need to rush a project like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000003499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1570350655}
review:
在2017这一年入手的两打的游戏中，终于有一款感觉值得推介。
这也是我入手的半打的抢先推出的游戏中，唯一一款没让我觉得失望的游戏。


在前一段时间里，由于学习语言的需要，看了一部关于德国防暴警察的纪录片。
由于德国的民众冲突和日渐增多的抗议示威，德国防暴警察的力量已经捉襟见肘了。
后来一直想寻找这种有关于暴乱的模拟类的游戏，在今年的1月份终于关注到了RIOT - Civil Unrest 这款当时还没发行的游戏。
这个由Leonard Menchiari以及IV Productions 制作的游戏，翻看之前的更新说明和评论，我才发现这个游戏也是跳票常客。
在我关注到前竟然已经跳票长达两年。。。

[h1]背景[/h1]
暴乱与秩序，抗议者和防暴警察
与一般的对抗性游戏不同，RIOT - Civil Unrest的游戏场景并非处于战场或者竞技场，那些传统的隐含对抗意义的场景。而是处于我们日常生活的城市、广场，工厂甚至于家楼下的花园。
本作中，设置了西班牙愤怒运动，埃及阿拉伯之春，希腊Keratea之战，意大利NoTAV运动等剧本。
17个游戏场景包括：罗马，奥克兰，巴黎，伦敦和乌克兰。

虽然是款暴动模拟类游戏，但实际上游戏中对于政治或者其他的元素是近乎没有的。
在RIOT - Civil Unrest中对抗是非常直接，抗议者需要在时间限制内守住自己的阵地或者达到自己的目的；守住广场或者大肆破坏，达到自己的目的。
而防暴警察们则尽忠职守地维持秩序，需要在规定的时间里进行人群的驱散和指定位置的清场。

[h1]装备与队伍建设[/h1]
作为防暴警察，能够调配不同的部队，防暴队、“清场队”、还有“特别行动小队”。防暴队属于中坚力量，配备警用甩棍等防备装备，防御力上乘，还配备有

特殊技能增强防御。“清场队”是人数较少的进攻型部队，主要用于驱赶人群，同时也配备甩以及其它的镇暴装备。而“特别行动小队”则配备诸如橡胶子弹和催泪弹等特殊武器。

在每场行动前，警方都可以使用预算调整各个部队的护甲和武器装备，长甩棍、镇暴弹甚至便携摄像头，以求达到最佳组合。在行动中，可使用武器、技能以及装备和阵型变换。

而作为并非如警方一样训练有素的示威者，也可装备诸如鞭炮，燃烧瓶等工具。而进行装备消费的点数则从预算变为人数；装备护甲以及人员质量越好的团队，示威的总人数则相应减少。而在暴动中，示威者也没有阵型的选择，但最重要的是，他们拥有人数上的压制优势。

[h1]行动[/h1]
在示威行动中，双方都可以选择较和平的手段和激进的手段；单纯的推搡或者大打出手。
每个小队的“交战规则”可以被主动改变，也因局势的加剧而变换。
在抢先推出版本中，快捷键还有些许的不方便。但不影响游戏的体验。

[h1]剧情、画面以及音效[/h1]
可以从游戏中看出，制作团队非常用心，在每场剧本中都有相应动画，虽然仍然是像素风，但是非常的精致和带感。囊括了许多真实发生的示威事件。

甚至还可以自创场景。画面是独具一格的像素风，实际上像素风的美工现在并不少见，像常见的一些rouge游戏，之前大火的DOMINA或者最近新推出的Door kicker的续作-Action Squard都是采用
这种风格。

当然像素风并不能给与人3A大作的细腻真实，但实际上它能给予人与3A大作媲美的观感，画面取胜的关键，要不是精致细腻，要不则是模糊得让人有许多空间任由想象力的挥洒。
这使得在RIOT - Civil Unrest 的暴动行动中，大家可以依照在场景中一颗颗的像素，在脑海中填补成一个个有趣而又丰满的细节。
在这又不得不提音效了。对于一个单场景、短时限但却又对抗性紧张感强的游戏，而且画面还是像素风的游戏，音效则成了重要的一环。
游戏中的喧闹，击打、推搡声已经做的不错，但可能由于是抢先推出阶段，感觉还是有可以进步和更加细腻化的空间。

总的而言，这款游戏走的并不是剧情风格或者传统的策略类游戏，更确切的应该说是一个即时对抗策略游戏，三四分钟，不用考虑太多其他因素，只考虑如何驱逐抗议的人群，而相应的，示威者也只需要考虑怎么撑下去。在这样的对抗下，实际上还可能不动用暴力就达到目标。做一个真正和平的抗议者或者坚守秩序的防暴警察。

其实耐心玩下去，会真正感受到，作者对于抗议和示威活动和镇暴行动的思考。对于这个社会上日益显露出来的争端，作者也通过这样一个游戏，提供我们一个思考的机会。从这个层面来说，RIOT - Civil Unrest的内涵精神与《我的战争》也是相似的，都是通过游戏，去思考这些可能平常生活中存在偏见或不常思考的事物。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971593118', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1603126166}
review:
This is a tough one to review because it's difficult to say who this game is for. 

I could say that strategy buffs will love trying to tackle the puzzle of defeating an enemy non-violently, but this doesn't typically offer the type of options that strategy fans are used to and then sometimes it's impossible to defeat your opponent non-violently in this game.

I could say that this game is for all those who are either frustrated with or enthralled by modern day political strife and uprisings, but this game takes such a neutral point of view on political issues, that anyone looking for it to cater to their personal views is going to be sorely disappointed.

Regardless, this game is something unique and special. It's art style is downright beautiful, which I say as a person who never understood nor cared for the popular pixel art style utilized by other games. The sound is immersive and I highly recommend playing this with headphones for that reason; it might just cause you to be more emotionally invested in the well being of your sprites.

For the sake of helping people make their purchasing decision, here are some negatives I noticed: 
-There's zero tutorial or direction as to how to use any of the options at your disposal or what most police items do.
-There are some bugs that seem to negate items you've just chosen or at least no indication as to why they didn't active.
-The game gives no weight to losing your sprites or promotes protecting them. Just a "oh no, they've killed someone."
-Contains four "campaigns" with two playable perspectives, roughly giving an hour of playtime each; is there any replayability once you've finished? Hard to say at this stage, but it seems not unless the game gets expanded on or the community heavily gets behind customizing levels.

Summary: If those negatives don't turn you off right now and you're willing to throw $12-13 behind such a unique, beautiful concept, then I'd say the money is worth it; already I feel like I've gotten my money's worth and that the wait for this game has been worth it; hopefully you'll be able to say the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023470386', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1517697179}
review:
Even if you've been waiting on this one for years now, like I have, I'd recommend that you chill on it for a few more months until it's more enjoyable to play. As of right now, it's unintuitive, unoptimised, buggy and generally difficult to play.

I'll start with the things I enjoyed about the game. Starting off on the rioter side in the Arab Spring scenario, I found that the game succeeded in evoking a strong emotional response while also being suitably challenging. It was genuinely disturbing to watch the police units fire indiscriminately into my crowd of peaceful protestors, and even though I ultimately won the scenario, I was still left feeling morose at the thought of the number of people who had died for that victory. I suspect that that's exactly the sort of emotional response that the game is going for, and in that regard, it succeeds.

However, for everything the game has in its ability to evoke the emotions associated with the scenarios it portrays, it lacks far more in its actual design and gameplay. In designing the controls, I suspect that the developers wanted to simulate the chaos and disorganisation in trying to direct people in a riot, but it comes off as feeling sluggish at best and outright random at worst. Targeted abilities, such as projectiles, can either land directly on their mark or fall completely flat, seemingly at random - I'm not expecting a one-hundred percent hit rate, obviously, but any indication at all of factors that could affect my unit's accuracy would be appreciated. 

The various items and abilities you can confer onto your units are not sufficiently explained and lack almost any feedback when they're used - I can give my protestors laser pointers to 'slow down' police units, for example, but there's no feedback to indicate whether the ability actually landed or had any effect, and even if it did, what's the use in making a single hostile unit move slower for a few seconds? Slingshots are supposedly a more potent way of harming police units at range than the rocks and random debris that all mobs have the ability to throw, but targeting them is an exercise in guessing, as is working out if they had any effect whatsoever. The same goes for many other items, and the only way to discover which ones are actually useful is to play and lose a few times before you hit on a winning combo.

This lack of feedback is unfortunately a running theme on both sides of the protest line. Police units can be individually outfitted with different gear, but there is no indication [i]whatsoever[/i] of the pros and cons of different kinds of gear versus one another. What's the difference between a 'crude long baton', a 'wooden stick', and an '18in plastic tonfa'? How is 'Gasmask 2' better than 'Gasmask 1'? Why do my ballistic units have a choice of five different smoke grenade launchers, and again, how do they differ? Why, after I threw aside my moral values in total frustration and gave every ballistic team lethal ammunition, did they kill [i]less[/i] people than when they were using less-than-lethal rubber bullets? The game makes no effort to answer any of these questions, and even after a solid hour of trying different bits and pieces of cop gear to no visible effect (the first hour being spent playing the protestor side), I'm left no closer to finding out.

The game attempts to model the media outlook on a protest event and supposedly punishes the more violent side by giving their opponent a bonus in the next mission, but once again, precious little information is given on how gameplay is affected. After a particularly bloody day in Cairo in which over a hundred of my protestors were shot dead, I was told that my side would have a 'massive advantage' in the next mission. How that manifested, however, is a mystery to me. I was given fewer units to field, a more difficult mission to fulfil, and the police were no less armed or brutal when they turned up to once again to - quite literally - shoot my peaceful protest down. 

Bugs, too, are rife in this game, which is odd after the huge period of delay it was subject to before launch. Protestor mechanics mostly work well, but the police side is barely functional. Riot shield-clad tactical units occasionally flee their positions and concede ground to peaceful, non-aggressive protestors for no discernible reason. Assault units sent in to strategically separate and arrest vulnerable protestors, proceeding to drag them off-screen, sometimes disappear from the map for up to a minute at a time before trickling back onto the field in disarray - were they indulging in police brutality where I couldn't see them or something? Shotgun-toting ballistic units occasionally only fire one or two of the ten guns available to their squad, and whether or not they hit anything is up to factors that the game makes no effort to inform the player of. Units tasked with throwing stun grenades into the crowd will often seemingly have a seizure and flicker from left to right on the spot, trapping their entire squad in inaction until given a new order. When pushed to it, enemy protestors seem to either phase directly through my testudo of riot shields or merge together into one single super-protestor, making them impossible to dislodge from a map area in either case. 

The relatively static camera has trouble following the action in some maps, and I lost one scenario as the protestor side when a police unit charged off the corner of the map, leaving me unable to target them with attacks or abilities even though they were still counted as being inside the 'objective zone' for the game's purposes of resolving the scenario. As for protestor mechanics, I haven't once been able to get the 'build barricade' ability to work - a frustrating problem, as it's the only way that units in the 'aggressive' stance can attempt to hold a position.

There's a few extra modes to toy with in the 'Custom' section of the game, but I had even less luck getting those to work properly. I gave 'spectator' mode (also called 'journalist mode' when you unlock it, for some reason) a go and attempted to pit 400 furious, heavily-armoured, molotov-tossing guerrillas against 120 equally well-armed officers of the law. When I started the game, I was surprised to find that only four rioters showed up. They promptly ran off-screen, handing an immediate and anti-climactic victory to the police. I figure the cops must've been more confused than I was.

The game's performance, particularly for a two-dimensional game with deliberately low-res graphics, is surprisingly poor, particularly when aiming abilities - it goes without saying that trying to drop a molotov on top of a charging police line before they run out of its landing zone is already challenging, and it becomes impossible when the framerate drops into the low single digits. To its credit, the game didn't crash at any point, though it still escapes me how a 900mb game that seems quite undemanding in terms of system requirements can run as poorly as this one does at times.

To conclude: it's a great concept and it certainly succeeded in evoking the emotional response it was surely aiming for, but as a game - as a collection of interlocking mechanics that responds to player input - it has a long road ahead of it. Hopefully, most of the negative points mentioned in this review will be obsolete after a few months of tuning and polishing from the developer(s?). At present, though, I'd advise putting your purchase on hold.
developer_response:
Hi,

Thanks for this in depth feedback!

It is great to hear your response to witnessing the events portrayed in RIOT.

The targeting issue is something we are working on now and we will have a patch up soon for that. Please keep an eye out for announcements either on the store page or in the News section, we will post bug fix logs there.

You raise the issue of lack of visual feedback. This is mostly intentional as we did try various forms of visual feedback through development. We quickly noticed that with so much being displayed on screen, it quickly became chaotic. We will assess this however and return to it. Regarding laser pointers: There are abilities that the police have to charge and push forward. You can slow them down while you regroup, prepare an attack or construct barricades.
The slingshot point I think comes back to targeting but also visual feedback. We'll address this with an update.

On lethal and other weapons and the outcomes of their usage; It is possible that this would happen because using lethal weapons causes the crowd to disperse. Other weapons would have a reduced effect in this way so more people stay and more violence ensues. Of course, on the surface this seems counter-intuitive but I hope this explains this issue. Regardless, we will look into this. Thanks for the feedback on the item loadouts, these are excellent suggestions and we'll see what we can do.

Thanks for reporting the issue on level difficulty progression. We'll push an update for this soon.

There is a lot to address in the bug reports here. Police fleeing their posision is possible as the fear response is based on group density and numbers. The more dense the crowd, the more sway they have. However I do see that a non aggressive crowd should really not have quite as much control, we can look into patching this. Disappearing from the screen is something we can fix in an update. Shotgun units not using all available shotguns is intentional as a blast from all of them would be overwhelming. However, we can look into addressing this. The impact I believe comes back to targeting. The animation glitch is something we can fix with a patch too. Pushing through the testudo should not be possible and we'll work on that.

We'll work on the camera and barricade construction issues and we'll get an update out for that.

The rioter numbers is a surprising bug! We'll get a patch out for this.

The performance issues you noted are something that we are continuing to work on. The reason why RIOT is extremely resource intensive is that the game, while appearing very light, actually uses a system of AI and collision across each unit. The game calculates all of the physics involved in each interacting with each person you see, the environment and the units as a whole. All of these considerations do lead to a persformace hit, however we will continue to work on improvements.

Thanks again for the review. We'll be sure to list every issue that we address in changelogs that we will share on Steam. You will be able to check out the progress there. Our intention was always so address any issues raised in this Early Access phase but if you return for release to play the game again, we hope you review RIOT again. Hopefully, with a thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989289060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1557663397}
review:
The essence of RIOT can easily be summarized into 2 words: unrest simulator.
It basically puts you in charge of one of the 2 opposite teams, the police and the protesters, with objectives ranging from occupation of public soil (a highway, a square or a construction site) to the disband of a peaceful/violent protest.
The game lets you decide, before each start, what kind of equipment you want to give to your angry mob (from megaphones to rocks to firecrackers and molotovs) or the squads of policemen you want to deploy (there are 3 types, tactical, assault and kinetic squads) and their equipments and veichles.

To complete the objectives it is usually required to push or disperse the opposite team away using various tactics and equipment to support your advance (or your defense).
Very interesting is the mechanic regarding the escalation of violence and the exploit of social media, both simulated into the game. 
First of all, all the squads have two "modes" that can be switched during the game: harmless or violent. Depending on your playstyle you can decide to follow the "harmless way" (protesters sitting in the middle of the road, policemen just pushing people) or the "guerrilla" style (with molotov, barricades, tear gas, flashbangs and even guns shooting each other), using then the social media (aka cameras and cellphones) to depict yourself as the victim persecuted by the other side or call reinforcements.

The game counts 4 campaigns, each composed by 4 missions playable as one of the 2 sides:
-no-TAV protests in Italy
-the arab spring in Egypt
-the protests in Greece
-the Indignados protests in Spain
Plus, each campaign unlocks a series of scenarios ranging from the Kiev protests of Maidan square to France, USA, Colombia, hoping that more will come in the future.

The graphic is clean even if sometimes it can be difficult to follow the action (especially if the situation escalates violently) and it can be very laggy when there are 2-300 people on screen at the same time.
The sound, on the contrary, is perfect with the sounds of bombs, firecrackers and screams very well reproduced in game. There are even the original chores of the protesters taken by the the public footage.

I definitely recommend this game as it simulates pretty accurately how a protest or a riot developes nowadays, with a high level of challenge at higher difficulties.

review:
Appreciating that this is early access, this is a tough game to like.

The pixel art doesn't translate well from still to moving, and the UI glitched out and became invisible more than once. This made it only slightly harder to play, as there is no instruction on how to play properly, so throwing commands to the wind at random was effective.

When this one finishes beta and goes live, I expect it will be much better. Many of the issues with it are ones that don't affect the core of what the game is about or the narratives it is trying to tell - so can be fixed up with some more development time. In it's current form though (6/12/17) I'd say avoid

author: {'steamid': '76561197971154036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1566067969}
review:
I'm a photo-journalist and make a lot of covering on many protests, and this game is just awesome.
Definitely a must buy !

So, after some folks (like "Idlemind" did) here tried out to point that I'm not a photo-journalist and before continue here is some of my works:
Videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeiIdmXUCsemx_NTK62TUzxzOU9H7cg6d 
And Photography: www.louisthomann.com

Like this, I will not have to deal with those kind of comments anymore.

Also, to elaborate more the reason why as a riots journalist I recommand this game is simple: for the damn accuracy of it (and also/off course the fun it gives to play with.)

Indeed, if some of you, journalists or Citizens had the oportunity to get involved into riots, you will instantly feel that the developers are really aware of what they wanted to show in their game.

The great thing in it, is that they really make you a direct actor of it, by controling either the protesters or the Anti-Riots forces in a global way.

It's so efficiant, and very challenging !

More than this, all the historical situations represented in the game are mostly real, without any censoship on it, and they tell you the story of really dense protests that already happened in the past years. As an European myself, I had the opportunity to see two of those showed in the game that are loccated in Spain & Italy. And Yes, all the weapons, the tactics, the details (like the mallox used by the protesters, it was such a tiny but damn real detail), and definitely the violences represented in the game are real, and the developers have been making an awesome work by making those tools for you, the player, to experience it and control it in a more global way.

Even more, I do hope this game will put some interest in the mind of Gamers (like Idlemind in the commentary, who started to doubt about my words), and that those people will maybe then get involved as Citizens beyond the game. And I do think that this was the primary objective of the developers, to informs new generations about whats happening when citizens revolts against autoritary governments.

review: Не рекомендую. Отвратительное управление, каждый отряд приходится выбирать вручную, что сильно влияет на ВСЕ действия, непонятная физика, не понятно куда полетит граната, врежется ли во что-то, потому что ПИКСЕЛЬНАЯ ГРАФИКА УЖАСНАЯ и ничего не понятно в ней,  Ролики отдельная тема, они ужасны в плане графики, пиксели увеличенные в сотню раз выглядят так вырвиглазно, что как это пропустили в игру остаётся загадкой. Интеллект юнитов хромает, они зачастую отказываются делать приказанные им действия, легко пугаются(Ты сильный, рослый полицейский в тяжёлой защите с огромным щитом, под стимуляторами, но боже мой рядом горит костёр от молотова НАХУЙ ЭТО ДЕРЬМО Я СВАЛИВАЮ и убегаешь на другой конец карты.) а вкупе с корявым управлением ты теряешь свои отряды постоянно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278479433', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1563536797}
review:
任何稍有常识的人都可以看出，如果我们的暴民继续前进，这些螳臂当车的警方，难道可以阻挡得了吗？暴民没有投掷燃烧瓶和手榴弹，恰恰证明暴民们保持了最大限度的克制。
很有趣的游戏，开局玩家可以选择带的战术或警方装备，如鞭炮、扔石头，或者橡皮子弹。催泪榴弹。

这是杉果的介绍：
由于世界经济危机加剧，不平等扰乱了社会结构，民众的不满表现在公众和市民骚乱中。
《冲突：动荡》是一款备受期待的实时策略暴乱模拟类游戏，使玩家置身于世界最激烈的冲突中。包括：西班牙愤怒运动，埃及阿拉伯之春，希腊Keratea之战，意大利NoTAV运动。17个游戏场景包括：罗马，奥克兰，巴黎，伦敦和乌克兰。
《冲突：动荡》作者Leonard Menchiari，亲身经历了意大利NoTAV运动。他制作这款游戏来讲述故事，表达经历这些冲突的情感。是什么让民众表现的如此愤怒，具有攻击性？经常寡不敌众，在冲突发生时，警察是什么感觉？《冲突：动荡》让玩家有机会体验冲突的双方-而就冲突而言，没有胜方。孰对孰错？体验《冲突：动荡》，自己寻找结论。

担任警察角色

运用大量的群体管控策略，保守的和激进的
下令攻击，战术和弹道阵容
召集警察卡车，高压水炮或者坦克！
选择是否使用烟雾弹，橡胶和塑料子弹，甚至是实弹。
担任暴动者

指导暴动者和记者
鼓动群体情绪，使他们行为激进或者利用群体策略平息态势
使用燃烧弹，烟火，纸炸弹，石头，街道设施和媒体的力量来对抗权威
多种游戏模式

16种任务关卡，4种游戏场景：西班牙愤怒运动，埃及阿拉伯之春，希腊Keratea之战，意大利NoTAV运动。
从双方角度了解故事-担任暴动者或者警察，完成所有32个关卡
单人模式-与电脑AI进行对抗
对战模式-与朋友或者AI在同一个电脑上进行对战
利用关卡编辑器创建自己的暴乱（在抢先体验中推出）
导入自己的背景图形，改变冲突的背景

author: {'steamid': '76561198048619126', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1564787351}
review:
RIOT - Antifa Simulator 2017
So I haven't really played much of the game since it has basically angered me how stupid the AI can be... But the game is a wonderful concept. The interface is very easy to learn and I think anyone can pick it up incredibly easy. The graphics remind me of Hotline Miami so if you don't care about pixelated stick people running around then this could be a game for you. There is no tutorial at the moment but like I said, its very easy to pick up. The options tab on the menu sometimes crashes, this may just be me i don't know but adjusting the sound actually crashed the game for me, all I wanted to do was to stop the music from blowing up my eardrums :'(

The main issue I had with this game is the fact that the AI will simply just ignore your orders half of the time, this is quite easily sorted with a restart after failing a mission (rip) because the crowd of Antifa nutjobs didn't listen to what you just told them, which was to clearly sit the f**k down so that the police won't push them back, but oh well.. Playing as the riot police can also be incredibly annoying since, again the AI can be an absolute annoyance, I figured this out when I told my riot police to fill in a hole in the fence which one team did but the other team proceeded to run in the opposite direction whilst a third team stood still where they spawned for at least a minute before helping one of the other teams.

I'm not going to recommend this to people at this moment of time mainly because the the AI can be very stupid when you're telling them to do things, but each time this happened to me, a restart of the mission solved the issue. Hopefully the devs add to the game but before they do that they should fix the AI issue since its quite an annoyance to me and maybe some others.

review: It's pretty, very pretty. The gameplay's kind of unique too. If you're looking for a traditional RTS this isn't it, RIOT - Civil Unrest is a game about crowd control. On the easy levels you can get away with using excessive aggression but play it on a harder setting and you'll pay for using too much force. Of course, it's still early access so I expect things to just keep getting better. The promised addition of a level editor will be massive, I can't wait to play new levels and challenges created by the community. 1989's stand off between one man and a tank in Tiananmen Square is going to be top of my list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012714048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1512576163}
review:
I didn't enjoy my time at all with this game, the missions are extremely short and unsatisfying, the AI is braindead and the game just isn't that fun to play. You basically command hordes of angry/peaceful protesters, sometimes violent rioters, or the police, and try to stop eachother's antics. As fun as that sounds, when you actually get into the game and play, it isn't very fun. You just command a bunch of zombies to go and walk into eachother goofily pushing eachother back or scaring eachother away, with gadgets like stun grenades, smoke grenades, fireworks, and water cannons. There was no tutorial (in this current version, anyway), so you are left to figure out the confusing UI and confusing game yourself.

The only few positives I can give this game is the art and the music, both are pretty fantastic. Cutscenes are well animated, music is good and fits the mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961493987', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1512576481}
review:
So, this game has been in development since 2013 and graphically, it looks wonderful and the audio is quite good too.

There's a lot of attention to detail in the environments and it's mostly quite a fun game. You can play as rioters or as the police. There's a system in place where dependent on your and the other faction actions during the course of the riot or protest you can gain bonuses for the next mission.

Sadly however I completed the Italy campaign in a little under 20 minutes. There are a few other campaigns, but it seems a little too short of a game to be worth buying at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971571062', 'num_games_owned': 3301, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1512682305}
review:
[h1]¿Has estado en alguna manifestación?[/h1]

-En Riot, después de ver esas manifestaciones tan chungas por la TV, podremos participar en una. De forma pacifica o no y en el bando de los "alborotadores" o en el de la policia.
-Básicamente es un juego de estrategia en tiempo real, pero muy diferente a lo que habia probado hasta ahora. 
Todavia necesita algunos retoques, pero en general me parece algo fresco y diferente.
-El pixel art está muy currado, aunque en algunas partes "cinematicas" está demasiado zoomeado y resulta un poco dificil identificar lo que vemos.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Un juego original. Creo que no habia nada así antes en el mercado. Eso me gusta.
-No se posiciona a favor de ningún bando. Podemos participar en ambos y ser buenos o malos en ambos.
-4 campañas con 4 misiones cada una basadas en revueltas reales y luego 16 misiones sueltas ambientadas en diferentes zonas del mundo, también reales.
-Multijugador local (no online)
-Editor de niveles.
-Wiki integrada dentro del juego. Podemos consultarla sin minimizar.
-Diferentes armas y objetos en ambos bandos.
-Barato. Pensaba que rondaba los 20€
-Nivel de dificultad variable para todos los gustos.

[h1]CONS[/h1]
-Graficos pixel art muy guapos, pero en ocasiones poco definidos debido al exceso de zoom.
-En la campaña Española, hay algun error un poco bestia (por ejemplo mossos d'escuadra en Madrid).
-Al principio es poco intuitivo. Necesita algun tipo de tutorial para empezar.
-No tiene multijugador online.


En resumen, el juego me ha parecido bueno, bien hecho. Me ha divertido jugarlo y podemos hacer las misiones de varias formas diferentes. El bando de la policia es mas tactico (formaciones, equipo, diferentes tipos de unidad, etc) mientras que el de los manifestantes es mas "barullo" (mucha gente y permanecer unidos sin dispersarse).
Los devs se ven muy interesados en lo que opina la comunidad y seguro que lo parchean de vez en cuando.

Por si quereis verlo en movimiento, os dejo un pequeño gameplay que he subido a mi canal. 
Espero que os sea de ayuda. 

https://youtu.be/V8PHA-UtNJ4

Si os gusta el video, podeis suscribiros a mi canal aqui:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0PmKlXopkymAT1A4tLcsIQ?sub_confirmation=1

Saludos

Miau

author: {'steamid': '76561197976095014', 'num_games_owned': 1908, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1512520887}
review:
Great little game to be honest, wasnt expecting something so well made when this turned up!  Here is what I got the first time I booted it up...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7oiAOpWsrQw

To sum it up, visually is is epic.  I am a fan of pixel art style games, but I have seen many that are just cut and paste, little effort and use the simple graphics to simply make the game building easy... not in this case.  In fact even compared to AAA titles I have never seen any animations, cutscenes and gameplay look so beautiful on this kind of level.  Definitely worth a buy and I can see me sinking many hours into getting this mastered.  Heres some good and bad points from my first play....

[b]PROS[/b]
- Looks beautiful
- Awesome Soundtrack
- Great attention to detail for story lines
- Great Game Mechanics
- No pulled punches for gore and violence - True simulation

[b]CONS[/b]
- First time you play, no idea of how it actually works. 
- Needs tutorial missions or hints on first run to explain some features/mechanics/goals etc
- Some minor bugs with cutscenes skipping etc (nothing major and prob fixed on release)

[b]SUMMARY[/b]
If this is around the 10-15 bucks mark on release its well worth its dolla.  You can tell much love has gone into this game.  I have not seen cuscenes, animations and pixel art to this kind of level before and on this kind of scale with the fights.  It has some minor tweaks needed like hints to show exactly what powerups, game mechanics, gametypes, loadouts etc work but other than that... after 30 mins of gameplay your right into it!

Big thumbs up from me :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198367522879', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1549196167}
review:
Il gioco che attendevo di più in questi anni e non mi ha deluso per niente, un gran lavoro da parte dei sviluppatori per ricreare il più fedelmente possibile le manifestazioni e scontri di piazza che avvengono in tutto il globo, un gran gameplay che soddisfa appieno per le varie strategie che si possono effettuare sia giocando con i ribelli sia con le forze del disordine... grafica in "pixel art" molto ben curata e grande rigiocabilità, unico neo a mio avviso la campagna principale un pò corta ma grazie all'editor interno al gioco credo che nei prossimi mesi verranno alla luce molti nuovi scenari grazie alla comunity molto attiva attorno a questo titolo. I sviluppatori ci hanno fatto sudare 7 camice in questi anni per i continui posticipi dell'uscita del gioco ma finalmente c'è l'abbiamo sui nostri monitor e quindi và detto un  grande grazie a tutto il team per questo stupendo titolo (e bisogna ricordarsi che anche i ragazzi italiani sanno fare Videogiochi ;) ) buon RIOT a tutti!
p.s. un consiglo per tutti i streamers\youtubers ecc. giocate in modalità normale o hard che in quella facile riesce a vincere anche mia nonna :P
